name: Boxwood Cupola 2023
description: The flagship wine from Boxwood Estate Winery in Middleburg, Virginia, founded by former Washington Redskins owner John Kent Cooke. Cupola represents one of Virginia's finest expressions of Bordeaux-style blends, showcasing the potential of the state's emerging wine region. The 2023 vintage captures the elegance and finesse that has established Boxwood as a benchmark Virginia producer.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents refined aromas of black cherry, cassis, and ripe plum, interlaced with notes of violet, cedar, and graphite. Subtle hints of dark chocolate, espresso, and sweet tobacco add complexity from well-integrated oak aging. A distinctive Virginia terroir signature emerges with mineral notes and fresh herbs. The aromatics suggest careful vineyard selection and thoughtful blending, with a balance between New World fruit ripeness and Old World elegance.", "finish": "Long and harmonious, with persistent dark fruit flavors and subtle oak spice. The tannins are fine and integrated, providing structure without astringency. Notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and dried herbs linger, while a mineral backbone adds length and complexity. The finish demonstrates the wine's aging potential and structural elegance.", "palate": "Medium to full-bodied with elegant structure and polished tannins. The palate reveals layers of blackcurrant, dark cherry, and blueberry, supported by bright acidity and fine-grained tannins. Flavors of mocha, vanilla bean, and toasted oak integrate seamlessly with the fruit. A subtle earthiness and crushed stone minerality reflect the Virginia terroir. The wine shows excellent balance and sophistication, with neither fruit nor oak dominating. The mouthfeel is plush yet refined, suggesting careful extraction and barrel selection."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled filet mignon with bordelaise sauce", "Roasted duck breast with cherry gastrique", "Braised lamb shanks with root vegetables", "Aged blue cheese and walnut salad", "Wild mushroom and truffle pasta"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 45-60 minutes to allow the young wine to open and integrate; young vintage benefits from aeration", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux-style glass to showcase aromatics", "temperature": "16-18°C (60-64°F)"}

name: Noughty NA White Wine NV
description: An exceptional dealcoholized white wine blend from organic grapes, crafted by Thomson & Scott. This non-alcoholic offering combines 55% Chenin Blanc with 45% Chardonnay to create a sophisticated alternative that maintains wine character and complexity while removing alcohol through gentle dealcoholization processes.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Bright notes of yellow apple, lime, and chamomile dominate the aromatic profile, creating an inviting and fresh impression. Honeysuckle and citrus fruit aromas layer with delicate jasmine, offering genuine wine-like complexity. The organic grape sourcing contributes to the pure, clean fruit expression.", "finish": "Clean and refreshing finish with lingering citrus and floral notes. The wine maintains the right balance between fruit and dryness, avoiding simple grape juice character while remaining accessible and enjoyable.", "palate": "The palate delivers good balance between acidity and fruitiness, avoiding the pitfalls of excessive sweetness common in non-alcoholic wines. Flavors of yellow apple, lime, and melon are complemented by chamomile and citrus notes. The Chenin Blanc component provides crisp acidity and mineral freshness, while Chardonnay adds body and texture that give the wine satisfying weight despite the absence of alcohol."}

name: Cafe de Paris Organic NV
description: Cafe de Paris Organic represents a casual, approachable wine crafted from organically farmed grapes. This non-vintage blend offers easy-drinking character perfect for everyday enjoyment, with the organic certification ensuring sustainable farming practices without synthetic pesticides or fertilizers.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with friendly aromas of red cherry, strawberry, and raspberry, accompanied by subtle floral notes. Light herbal nuances add freshness, while minimal oak influence allows the fruit to express itself purely. Delicate hints of spice and earth provide gentle complexity without overwhelming the wine's approachable character.", "finish": "The finish is clean and moderately short, with lingering red fruit notes and a refreshing quality. Soft tannins and bright acidity keep the palate lively, inviting another glass.", "palate": "Light to medium-bodied with soft tannins and refreshing acidity, the palate showcases bright red fruit flavors of cherry, cranberry, and red plum. The wine's organic farming origins shine through in the purity of fruit expression and balanced structure. Easy-drinking and versatile, the wine offers immediate pleasure without demanding contemplation, making it ideal for casual occasions and food pairing."}

name: Black Elephant Vintners Power of Love Chenin Blanc 2024
description: A vibrant and full-bodied Chenin Blanc from South Africa's Swartland region, crafted from unirrigated old bush vines. This is the second vintage of the wine, which saw a change of origin from Simonsberg to Swartland, with 5% of proceeds donated to human rights organizations.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose bursts with immense vibrancy and freshness, revealing generous aromas of tropical guava, ripe pineapple, and winter melon. These primary fruit notes are complemented by delicate nuances of citrus zest and hints of white pear, creating an inviting and complex bouquet that speaks to the wine's warm-climate origins.", "finish": "The finish is fresh and balanced, with persistent citrus notes and a subtle minerality from the Swartland terroir. The vibrant acidity carries through, leaving a clean and refreshing impression that invites another sip.", "palate": "On the palate, this Chenin Blanc truly zings with electric energy and fruit-forward character. Flavors of crisp citrus, white pear, and quince dominate the mid-palate, while yellow-fleshed peaches add a luxurious sweetness. The texture is enhanced by two months of full lees contact with regular stirring, which adds richness and a creamy mouthfeel. The lingering blood orange notes add a refreshing bitterness that balances the fruit beautifully."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled prawns with lemon butter", "Thai green curry with chicken", "Fresh oysters on the half shell", "Roasted pork tenderloin with apple compote", "Goat cheese salad with citrus vinaigrette"]

name: Calyptra Zahir Cabernet Sauvignon 2016
description: A distinguished Chilean Cabernet Sauvignon from the acclaimed Cachapoal Valley. The Zahir represents Calyptra's premium tier, crafted from select estate fruit. Previous vintages have earned 90-point scores from Wine Enthusiast, establishing this wine's pedigree for structured, age-worthy reds.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet opens with concentrated black fruit aromas of cassis, blackberry, and dark plum, layered with notes of cedar, tobacco leaf, and dried herbs. Chilean Cabernet character shines through with distinctive eucalyptus and mint notes alongside graphite minerality. Subtle oak spice and vanilla add complexity without dominating the fruit expression.", "finish": "The finish is long and persistent, with fine-grained tannins and lingering notes of dark fruit, leather, and subtle herbal undertones. The 2016 vintage shows excellent aging development with seven years of bottle evolution.", "palate": "Dense and powerful on the palate, displaying ripe black cherry, blackcurrant, and dark chocolate flavors framed by structured tannins. The Cachapoal Valley terroir imparts a characteristic gravelly minerality and bright acidity that lifts the rich fruit. Mid-palate weight is substantial, with integrated oak providing hints of toast and spice while maintaining fruit purity."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled ribeye steak with chimichurri", "Braised short ribs with root vegetables", "Aged Manchego or hard sheep's milk cheese", "Lamb chops with rosemary and garlic", "Mushroom risotto with truffle oil"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 45-60 minutes to soften tannins and reveal complexity", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux or Cabernet glass", "temperature": "60-65�F (16-18�C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Full-bodied, structured Chilean Cabernet Sauvignon", "region": "Cachapoal Valley, Chile", "vintage": "2016", "ageability": "Drinking well now through 2028; can hold longer with proper cellaring", "grapeVariety": "100% Cabernet Sauvignon"}

name: O Leao Red Blend Cachapoal Valley Magnum (DC MD Only) 2019  1.5 l
description: This Chilean red blend from Cachapoal Valley showcases the region's warm climate with ripe fruit character and smooth tannins. The magnum format ensures slower aging and greater longevity, making it ideal for special occasions and extended cellaring.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with intense aromas of ripe blackberries and dark cherries, layered with notes of vanilla and toasted oak from careful barrel aging. Subtle hints of tobacco leaf and dried herbs add complexity, while a touch of graphite minerality reflects the valley's alluvial soils. The magnum format has allowed the aromatics to develop harmoniously over time.", "finish": "The finish is long and persistent, with dark fruit flavors lingering alongside subtle notes of espresso and dark chocolate. Fine-grained tannins provide grip without astringency, suggesting excellent aging potential in the magnum format.", "palate": "On the palate, this blend delivers concentrated flavors of black plum and cassis, supported by well-integrated oak that contributes notes of cocoa and baking spices. The mid-palate shows excellent density with velvety tannins that have softened beautifully since the 2019 vintage. Bright acidity provides structure and balance, while the warm Cachapoal terroir expresses itself through lush fruit concentration."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled ribeye steak with chimichurri", "Braised short ribs with red wine reduction", "Aged manchego and cured meats", "Mushroom and truffle risotto", "Chilean empanadas with spiced beef"]

name: Calyptra Mosaiko Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
description: A full-bodied Cabernet Sauvignon showcasing the classic intensity and structure of this noble variety. The 2021 vintage reveals concentrated black fruit character balanced with firm tannins and vibrant acidity, showing excellent aging potential.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with powerful aromas of black cherries and blackcurrant, the signature hallmark of Cabernet Sauvignon. Secondary notes of eucalyptus and mint emerge, adding complexity and freshness. Subtle hints of cedar and tobacco leaf provide an elegant Old World nuance, while dark plum undertones round out the aromatic profile.", "finish": "The finish is long and persistent, showcasing the variety's characteristic tannic grip. Cedar and cigar box notes emerge on the aftertaste, typical of well-structured Cabernet Sauvignon. The wine's firm acidity ensures a clean, refreshing conclusion that invites another sip.", "palate": "On the palate, this wine delivers full-bodied richness with high tannin structure and noticeable acidity that provides excellent backbone. Black cherry and plum flavors dominate the mid-palate, complemented by layers of blackcurrant and blackberry. The wine's concentration and phenolic depth suggest careful vineyard management and optimal ripeness at harvest. Moderate oak influence adds complexity without overwhelming the fruit expression."}

name: Casablanca Valley D. Bosler Pinot Noir 2018
description: D. Bosler's Casablanca Valley Pinot Noir represents the excellence of Chilean cool-climate viticulture. The Casablanca Valley, located between the Pacific Ocean and the coastal mountain range, provides ideal conditions for Pinot Noir with its morning fog, cool temperatures, and afternoon breezes. The 2018 vintage has had time to develop additional complexity while maintaining its vibrant fruit character.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet reveals classic Pinot Noir aromatics with a distinctly Chilean character, featuring bright red cherry, wild strawberry, and raspberry alongside earthy notes of forest floor, dried leaves, and subtle spice. Floral hints of rose petal and violet add elegance, while underlying notes of cocoa, cola, and gentle oak provide depth. The coastal influence is evident in a subtle saline quality and fresh herbal notes. The wine's aromatics show beautiful development from the 2018 vintage.", "finish": "The finish is long and elegant, with persistent red fruit notes, fine-grained tannins, and a distinctive earthy minerality. Touches of spice and dried herbs linger, while the wine's bright acidity provides a clean, refreshing conclusion. This mature Pinot Noir showcases both the variety's elegance and the terroir's unique character.", "palate": "On the palate, the wine displays medium body with silky, well-integrated tannins and vibrant acidity that's characteristic of cool-climate Pinot Noir. Flavors of tart cherry, cranberry, and red currant dominate, supported by notes of black tea, earthy mushroom, and subtle baking spice. The texture is refined and elegant, with excellent balance between fruit intensity and structural elements. Oak aging has added complexity without overwhelming the delicate fruit, contributing notes of vanilla and cedar. The wine's freshness belies its age, demonstrating excellent winemaking."}
foodPairings: ["Duck confit with orange glaze", "Grilled wild salmon with dill butter", "Mushroom and truffle ravioli", "Roasted chicken with root vegetables", "Aged Gruyère and soft-ripened cheeses"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 45-60 minutes to allow the mature wine to fully express its developed character", "glassware": "Burgundy glass to capture the wine's delicate aromatics", "temperature": "58-62°F (14-17°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Cool-Climate Pinot Noir with Mature Development", "region": "Casablanca Valley, Chile", "vintage": "2018", "ageability": "Drinking beautifully now with developed secondary and tertiary characteristics. Best consumed by 2027-2028 to enjoy the wine at its peak of maturity before fruit begins to fade.", "grapeVariety": "100% Pinot Noir"}

name: TeHo Malbec 2020
description: TeHo, meaning 'blood from earth' in the ancient Huarpe language, represents concentrated expression from the historic Tomal vineyard planted 75 years ago in La Consulta, Valle de Uco. This high-altitude Malbec showcases the intense character and opulent fruit that has made Argentine Malbec world-renowned.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Luscious and intensely aromatic, packed full of dark fruits with succulent blueberries taking center stage alongside kirsch and picked blackberries. Delicate violet notes add floral elegance, while dried herbs, sweet spices, and subtle earthiness contribute complexity. The nose is wonderfully ripe and inviting, reminiscent of sticky hedgerows in autumn.", "finish": "Long and satisfying finish marked by persistent dark fruit, subtle spice, and a touch of minerality. The opulent juiciness carries through to the end, leaving impressions of ripe fruit and gentle earthiness.", "palate": "Opulent and juicy on the palate with concentrated black sticky fruits and layers of complexity. The wine is lean yet focused, showing the elegant side of high-altitude Malbec without over-extraction. Ripe fruit flavors of blackberry, blueberry, and cherry meld with earthy undertones and subtle oak integration. The mouthfeel is rich but balanced, with fine-grained tannins providing structure."}
foodPairings: ["Argentine-style grilled beef asado", "Braised lamb shanks with herbs", "Blue cheese and dark chocolate pairing", "Grilled portobello mushrooms with chimichurri", "Hearty beef empanadas"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 30-45 minutes to allow the concentrated fruit to express itself fully and integrate with the earthy notes", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux glass to capture the intense aromatics and allow the wine to breathe", "temperature": "60-65°F (16-18°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Dry Red Wine - Full-Bodied, High-Altitude Expression", "region": "Valle de Uco, La Consulta, Mendoza, Argentina", "vintage": "2020", "ageability": "Drink now through 2030. The old vine concentration and critics score of 92/100 suggest excellent aging potential over the next decade.", "grapeVariety": "100% Malbec from 75-year-old vines in Tomal vineyard"}

name: Calyptra Inedito 2020
description: A sophisticated Chilean red blend from the Cachapoal Valley, crafted from 64% Cabernet Sauvignon, 18% Merlot, and 18% Syrah. Each variety was meticulously aged in French oak barrels for 28 months, followed by 12 months of bottle aging, resulting in a wine of exceptional character and 15-year aging potential.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with an exceptional bouquet full of fresh red fruit aromas, particularly ripe cherries and plums, interwoven with forest fruits and blackberries. Delicate floral notes of violets emerge alongside mineral aspects, creating a complex aromatic tapestry. Subtle hints of graphite add depth and sophistication to the overall aromatic profile.", "finish": "The finish is impressively long and refined, with persistent notes of tobacco leaf and exotic spices lingering on the palate. The soft tannins continue to provide structure while maintaining elegance, leaving a lasting impression of both power and finesse that signals excellent aging potential.", "palate": "On the palate, the wine reveals notable structure with soft, enveloping tannins that provide a luxurious mouthfeel. Well-balanced acidity supports the fruit core while allowing the wine's inherent elegance to shine through. The mid-palate shows concentrated dark fruit flavors accented by delicate notes of tobacco and warm baking spices, all harmoniously integrated from the extended oak maturation."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled ribeye steak with chimichurri", "Braised lamb shanks with rosemary", "Aged Manchego cheese", "Wild mushroom risotto", "Dark chocolate desserts with berries"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 45-60 minutes to allow the complex aromatics to fully express and the tannins to soften further", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux-style glass", "temperature": "64-66°F (18°C)"}

name: Oceano Zero Chardonnay 2023
description: An ultra-premium non-alcoholic Chardonnay from Oceano Wines, sourced from the sustainably-certified Spanish Springs Vineyard along California's San Luis Obispo Coast. This dealcoholized wine maintains the character and complexity of traditional Chardonnay while offering just 6 calories per serving. The single-vineyard, single-vintage approach ensures quality comparable to traditional wines.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Straw gold in color with brilliant clarity. The nose is vibrant and aromatic, opening with ripe Meyer lemon and tangerine zest that provide bright citrus character. Delicate notes of jasmine add floral elegance, while hints of tropical fruit emerge in the background. The aromatic profile is fresh and inviting.", "finish": "Persistent and refreshing with lingering citrus and melon notes. The finish is clean and invigorating, leaving the palate cleansed and satisfied.", "palate": "Refreshing and well-structured with a dry, balanced profile. The palate delivers flavors of young pineapple and honeydew melon, complemented by notes of spearmint that add herbal complexity. A hint of Granny Smith apple provides crisp fruit character. The wine shows supple texture from the winemaking process, creating a satisfying mouthfeel despite the absence of alcohol. The balance between fruit, acidity, and texture is impressive."}

name: Calyptra Vivendo Assemblage Blend 2021
description: An organic Chilean red blend from Cachapoal Valley, the Vivendo Assemblage represents Calyptra's premium selection combining Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Merlot. Hand-harvested from organic vineyards and aged 26 months in French oak from Allier and Tronçais forests.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents an intriguing combination of earthy complexity and ripe fruit character. Dark plum, black cherry, and mulberry aromas intertwine with notes of prune and dried fruit. Underlying earthy tones suggest forest floor and turned soil, while subtle hints of sweet spice from the extended oak aging add layers of vanilla and toast.", "finish": "The finish is long and satisfying with persistent dark fruit and earthy mineral notes. Well-integrated tannins provide structure and grip, while a touch of espresso and dark chocolate linger. The organic viticulture shines through with pure, clean fruit expression and remarkable balance.", "palate": "Rich and full-bodied on entry, the palate delivers concentrated dark fruit flavors with excellent depth. Syrah provides a spicy backbone with black pepper and dark berry notes, while Cabernet Sauvignon contributes structure and cassis flavors. The Merlot component adds plushness and dark chocolate undertones. The 26 months in French oak have integrated beautifully, providing subtle vanilla and cedar without overwhelming the fruit."}

name: Oceano Low Alcohol Syrah 2023
description: An innovative low-alcohol Syrah crafted for health-conscious wine consumers who seek full flavor without high alcohol content. Modern winemaking techniques such as early harvesting, reverse osmosis, or spinning cone technology allow winemakers to reduce alcohol while preserving varietal character. This wine represents the growing category of lower-alcohol premium wines.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet reveals fresh aromas of red cherry, raspberry, and cranberry, with subtle notes of violet, white pepper, and dried herbs. Despite lower alcohol, the wine maintains Syrah's characteristic spice and herbal complexity. Light oak influence contributes hints of vanilla and toast. A bright, fresh aromatic profile emphasizes fruit purity and varietal character, with less concentration than traditional Syrah but appealing freshness.", "finish": "The finish is clean and moderately persistent, with lingering red fruit and peppery spice. Soft tannins and bright acidity keep the wine balanced and refreshing. The lower alcohol allows for extended drinking without palate fatigue, making this an excellent choice for warm weather or extended meals.", "palate": "Light to medium-bodied with soft tannins and vibrant acidity. The palate shows bright red fruit flavors of cherry, raspberry, and red plum, complemented by subtle peppery spice and herbal notes. The lower alcohol (typically 9-11% ABV) creates a lighter, more refreshing mouthfeel while maintaining good flavor intensity. Notes of black tea, dried herbs, and a touch of cocoa add complexity without weight. The wine is surprisingly structured for its alcohol level, with balanced acidity and gentle tannins providing framework."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled chicken with herbs de Provence", "Salmon with black pepper and lemon", "Vegetable ratatouille", "Turkey burgers with caramelized onions", "Mild cheddar and fruit platter"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Brief decanting of 15-20 minutes can help the wine open, but not essential", "glassware": "Medium-sized red wine glass or universal stemware", "temperature": "14-16°C (57-61°F), slightly cooler than traditional Syrah"}

name: Abadia de Acon Roble 2019
description: A modern expression of Tempranillo from Ribera del Duero's acclaimed Abadía de Acón estate. Aged five months in oak barrels, this Roble (young oak) style showcases the intense fruit of high-altitude Ribera with well-integrated wood influence. The wine represents an accessible introduction to the bigger, more powerful style of Tempranillo found in the Duero region.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Deep, dark cherry-red color with marked purple hues, clean and brilliant. The nose is intense and very well-balanced, showing elegant notes of ripe red and black berries. Concentrated aromas of blackberry and dark cherry mingle with chocolate, liquorice, and cocoa. A spicy, toasty background emerges with hints of toffee and roasted coffee beans.", "finish": "Persistent and long with lingering notes of dark fruit and spice. The finish showcases the wine's concentration and oak influence, leaving a satisfying impression of ripe fruit and coffee.", "palate": "Full-bodied, rich and oaky with lip-staining sweet black fruit dominating the palate. The wine is powerful, lively and tasty with attractive layers of ripe fruit accompanied by chocolate, liquorice and cocoa flavors. Notes of vanilla and toast from oak aging integrate seamlessly with the fruit. The texture is dense and mouth-coating, yet the wine maintains balance through refreshing acidity."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled ribeye steak", "Spanish chorizo and potato stew", "Roasted leg of lamb with garlic", "Manchego cheese platter", "Dark chocolate desserts"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "30-45 minutes recommended to soften oak influence and open fruit", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux or Tempranillo-specific glass", "temperature": "62-65°F (17-18°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Full-bodied oak-aged Tempranillo (Roble style)", "region": "Ribera del Duero, Spain", "vintage": "2019", "ageability": "Drink now through 2025-2026; designed for near-term enjoyment", "grapeVariety": "100% Tempranillo"}

name: Adir Grenache Blanc Mevushal (MD & DC)
description: Adir's Mevushal Grenache Blanc represents premium kosher winemaking, showcasing this Mediterranean variety's aromatic complexity and textural richness. The mevushal designation indicates the wine has been flash-pasteurized to maintain kosher status while preserving fruit character. This is a unique expression of Grenache Blanc that combines varietal typicity with the requirements of traditional kosher wine production.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents an enticing array of white flowers, including honeysuckle and acacia, alongside aromas of white peach, pear, and citrus blossom. Subtle herbal notes of fennel and dried thyme add Mediterranean character, while hints of almond and mineral provide complexity. The aromatics display impressive intensity and purity despite the mevushal process, with a distinctive floral lift characteristic of quality Grenache Blanc.", "finish": "The finish is clean and moderately long, with lingering notes of citrus, white flowers, and a subtle mineral quality. The wine's refreshing acidity ensures a bright conclusion while maintaining the variety's characteristic richness. This is a well-crafted kosher white that showcases Grenache Blanc's unique personality.", "palate": "On the palate, this Grenache Blanc shows medium to full body with generous flavors of ripe stone fruit, particularly apricot and yellow peach, complemented by notes of Meyer lemon and honeydew melon. The wine displays excellent texture and weight, with a slightly oily, glycerin-rich mouthfeel that's typical of the variety. Bright acidity provides balance to the fruit richness, while subtle notes of white pepper and herbs add savory complexity. The wine's roundness and approachability make it exceptionally food-friendly."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled Mediterranean fish with lemon and herbs", "Roasted chicken with garlic and rosemary", "White fish ceviche", "Vegetable couscous with preserved lemon", "Fresh mozzarella and heirloom tomato salad"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Brief aeration of 15 minutes will help the wine express its full aromatic range", "glassware": "Medium-sized white wine glass", "temperature": "48-52°F (9-11°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Medium to Full-Bodied White Wine, Mevushal Kosher", "region": "Mediterranean region (likely Israel or Southern France)", "vintage": "Current Release", "ageability": "Best enjoyed within 2-3 years of release to preserve fresh fruit character and varietal aromatics. Drinking window: now through 2027.", "grapeVariety": "100% Grenache Blanc"}

name: Albina Essencia Tinto Reserva 2011
description: A critically acclaimed Rioja Reserva from Bodegas Riojanas, earning 93 points from both Guía Peñín and Wine Advocate, placing it among the top 3% of wines worldwide on Vivino. This traditional Rioja blend of Tempranillo and Graciano showcases extended aging and classic regional character.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The wine displays intense cherry red color with terracotta hues that signal maturity and extended aging. A powerful bouquet emerges with red berries—raspberry, strawberry, and red cherry—harmonized with dried prune-type fruit that adds concentrated sweetness. Barrel aromas stand out prominently, showcasing vanilla, dark chocolate, licorice root, and complex spice notes including cinnamon, clove, and black pepper. The oak integration is masterful, adding layers of complexity while preserving the wine's fruit character.", "finish": "Long and complex, with red fruit flavors gradually giving way to chocolate, licorice, and savory spice notes. The wine's excellent structure ensures a persistent finish that evolves in the glass.", "palate": "Great structure announces itself from the powerful entry, with concentrated fruit balanced by good natural acidity that provides lift and longevity. The palate is elegant and remarkably well-balanced, showcasing red berry fruit interwoven with chocolate, vanilla, and savory spice from extended barrel aging. The Tempranillo provides the wine's backbone and red fruit character, while Graciano adds freshness, aromatic complexity, and age-worthiness. The texture is smooth and evolved, with tannins fully integrated after years of aging, creating a wine of sophistication and harmony."}
foodPairings: ["Slow-roasted lamb shoulder with rosemary", "Manchego cheese aged 12+ months", "Beef tenderloin with wild mushroom sauce", "Spanish chorizo and bean stew", "Duck confit with cherry gastrique"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant 30-45 minutes to awaken mature aromatics and ensure wine is fully expressive", "glassware": "Large Rioja/Tempranillo glass to showcase evolved complexity", "temperature": "16-18°C (61-64°F)"}

name: Sky Devil Rose 2022
description: A vibrant and refreshing rosé from Washington State, Sky Devil showcases the crisp elegance of Pacific Northwest winemaking. This 2022 vintage captures bright fruit character with mineral undertones, offering approachable sophistication perfect for warm weather enjoyment.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with enticing aromas of fresh strawberry and watermelon, layered with delicate white peach and hints of rose petals. Subtle notes of citrus zest add brightness, while a whisper of wet stone provides depth. As the wine breathes, nuances of wild herbs and red currant emerge, creating an inviting aromatic profile that promises refreshment.", "finish": "The finish is clean and refreshing, with lingering notes of strawberry and citrus. A subtle minerality persists, leaving the palate cleansed and ready for the next sip. The bright acidity ensures a mouthwatering conclusion that invites another glass.", "palate": "On the palate, this rosé delivers crisp acidity balanced with fresh red fruit flavors. Ripe strawberry and raspberry dance alongside tangy cranberry, while underlying notes of pink grapefruit add citrus vibrancy. The mid-palate reveals gentle watermelon sweetness and mineral salinity, creating a dry yet fruit-forward profile. The wine's medium body and bright character make it incredibly food-friendly and sessionable."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled salmon with herb butter", "Mediterranean mezze platters with hummus and tabbouleh", "Caprese salad with heirloom tomatoes and fresh mozzarella", "Thai spring rolls with peanut dipping sauce", "Charcuterie boards with prosciutto and mild cheeses"]

name: Alfaro Family Vineyards A  Estate Chardonnay 2021
description: A crisp, fruit-forward Chardonnay from Santa Cruz Mountains estate vineyards, showcasing the cool-climate elegance of California's coastal appellations. Small-production wine from this family-owned winery reflects careful vineyard selection and minimal intervention winemaking.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Inviting aromas of ripe yellow orchard fruits open the bouquet. Fresh pear and golden apple lead, followed by white peach and nectarine notes. Subtle hints of lemon curd add brightness, while delicate honeyed oak provides just enough richness without overwhelming the fruit. Faint white flower and mineral notes add complexity.", "finish": "Clean, bright finish with lingering citrus and apple notes. A mineral quality emerges at the end, providing freshness and length.", "palate": "The palate is crisp and refreshing with vibrant acidity driving the wine forward. Intense flavors of pear, green apple, and white peach fill the mid-palate with concentrated fruit character. Lemon curd and subtle vanilla oak add layers of complexity while maintaining freshness. The wine balances richness with elegance, showing restraint in oak usage that allows the pure fruit expression to shine."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled Pacific halibut with lemon-herb butter", "Roasted chicken with herbs de Provence", "Dungeness crab salad", "Creamy mushroom risotto", "Grilled scallops with citrus beurre blanc"]

wineDetails: {"style": "Cool-climate, fruit-forward Chardonnay with moderate oak influence", "region": "Santa Cruz Mountains, California (Estate vineyards in Corralitos area)", "vintage": "2020", "ageability": "Best enjoyed within 3-5 years to appreciate the fresh fruit character. Drink 2023-2026.", "grapeVariety": "100% Chardonnay"}

name: Alella Vinicola Super Marfil
description: A premium white wine from the historic Alella Vinícola cooperative, established in 1906 as one of Spain's first winemaking cooperatives. The iconic Marfil brand has captivated Barcelona and beyond since the 1920s, produced in a stunning modernist winery designed by Jeroni Martorell in 1906. This wine showcases the DO Alella region's signature grape, Pansa Blanca (known as Xarel·lo elsewhere).
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose reveals the classic aromatic profile of Pansa Blanca with bright citrus notes, white flowers, and subtle Mediterranean herbs. Stone fruit aromas of white peach and apricot emerge, complemented by a distinctive coastal minerality that speaks to the wine's proximity to the Mediterranean just north of Barcelona. Delicate hints of almond blossom add elegance.", "finish": "The finish is crisp and refreshing with persistent citrus and mineral notes. A subtle saline quality lingers, reminiscent of the nearby Mediterranean, while the wine's natural acidity provides a clean, mouth-watering conclusion that pairs beautifully with food.", "palate": "On the palate, the wine displays vibrant acidity characteristic of DO Alella whites, with flavors of green apple, lemon zest, and white peach. The rocky limestone and granite soils of the region impart a pronounced mineral quality and saline edge. The mid-palate shows good weight and texture while maintaining freshness, a hallmark of quality Pansa Blanca."}

name: Aresca Fiore d Atunno Moscato dAsti 2020
description: A delicately sweet, lightly sparkling Moscato d'Asti from Piedmont's renowned Asti region. This 'Autumn Flower' (Fiore d'Autunno) captures the aromatic intensity and gentle effervescence that make Moscato d'Asti a beloved dessert wine worldwide.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Explosively aromatic with intoxicating notes of orange blossom, honeysuckle, and jasmine. The nose is dominated by fresh peach, apricot, and ripe Muscat grape, with underlying hints of lychee, rose water, and honey. There's a citrus element of mandarin orange and Meyer lemon zest, while subtle spice notes of ginger and white pepper add complexity.", "finish": "The finish is sweet and aromatic, with lingering notes of peach, honey, and orange blossom. The gentle effervescence continues to lift the flavors, leaving the palate with a clean, slightly honeyed impression.", "palate": "Light-bodied and gently sparkling (frizzante), with fine bubbles that create a soft, creamy mousse on the palate. The wine is sweet but balanced by refreshing acidity that prevents cloying. Flavors mirror the aromatics—ripe peach, apricot nectar, and honeyed Muscat grape—with additional notes of candied citrus peel and tropical fruit. The low alcohol (typically 5-6%) makes this wine delicate and easy-drinking, while the persistent bubbles add textural interest."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh fruit tarts and crostatas", "Panna cotta with berry coulis", "Light biscotti or amaretti cookies", "Fresh peaches with mascarpone", "Creamy cheesecake"]

name: Aratas Napa Valley Petite Sirah 2010
description: A historic Petite Sirah from Aratas that received the highest rating Wine Spectator had given to a Petite Sirah in over 30 years. Publisher Marvin Shanken's 91-point score and Editor's Pick designation marked this wine as exceptional. Now available as a library selection, this fully mature Petite Sirah showcases the variety's ability to age gracefully while maintaining power and intensity.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Deep, dark and opaque in the glass with a mesmerizing, inky appearance. The bouquet is expressive and layered, opening with concentrated aromas of plum, blackberry, and dark cherry. Notes of black licorice add complexity alongside darker chocolate undertones. Floral hints of violet emerge, providing elegance to the powerful fruit core. The aromatic intensity is captivating.", "finish": "Very long lasting finish with persistent fruit and earthy tannins. The wine's intensity carries through to a satisfying conclusion, with layers of fruit, spice, and tannin that linger impressively.", "palate": "Very well layered with exceptional intensity of fruit flavors that coat the palate. The wine delivers waves of ripe plum, blackberry, and dark cherry supported by notes of licorice and dark chocolate. Despite the power, the wine maintains balance and structure. Somewhat earthy tannins anchor the fruit, providing grip and aging potential. The texture is dense and mouth-filling, characteristic of premium Petite Sirah."}

name: Two Mountain Rawn Rose   250 ml
description: A vibrant rosé from the Rawn brothers' family winery in Washington's Yakima Valley Rattlesnake Hills, drawing on four generations of farming experience. This elegant rosé earned praise from the brothers with a playful nod: 'Provence called and said, Not bad, Americans!' - a testament to its quality and finesse.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The wine blooms with ripe wild strawberry leading the aromatic profile, accented by a touch of watermelon and hints of fragrant violet. The nose is fresh and inviting, capturing the essence of summer berries with floral elegance that rivals traditional Provence rosés.", "finish": "Clean and fruit-driven finish with lingering berry notes and balanced acid that keeps the palate refreshed. The finish shows excellent length for a rosé, inviting another sip.", "palate": "The palate bursts with rich red fruit expression, showing concentrated strawberry and raspberry flavors balanced by vibrant, well-integrated acidity. The fruit is ripe but never cloying, with excellent tension between richness and freshness. The wine demonstrates versatility and sophistication, with a texture that's both refreshing and satisfying."}

name: Hertelendy Chardonnay 2015
description: A mature Hungarian Chardonnay from the Hertelendy estate, showcasing the potential of Central European Chardonnay with nearly a decade of aging. The 2015 vintage has developed complex tertiary characteristics while maintaining the bright acidity typical of cool-climate Hungarian wines. This wine represents an interesting alternative to more familiar Chardonnay regions.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents evolved aromas of baked apple, poached pear, and honeyed apricot, layered with notes of toasted hazelnut, butterscotch, and crème brûlée from oak aging. Tertiary development brings hints of dried flowers, chamomile, and beeswax. A subtle mineral quality and wet stone character add complexity, while restrained oxidative notes suggest careful cellaring. The aromatic profile shows the wine's maturity while maintaining freshness and elegance.", "finish": "Long and contemplative, with lingering flavors of toasted nuts, honeyed fruit, and subtle oak. The acidity provides lift and structure, while a mineral quality and gentle phenolic grip add complexity. The finish shows the wine's maturity and integration, with all elements in harmony.", "palate": "Medium-bodied with creamy texture and well-integrated acidity. Flavors of baked orchard fruit, lemon curd, and toasted almond dominate, complemented by notes of vanilla, caramel, and subtle oak spice. The wine shows excellent development with oxidative characteristics adding complexity—think white mushroom, salted butter, and brioche. Hungarian Chardonnays typically retain higher acidity than warmer climate examples, and this wine's bright acid backbone keeps it balanced despite its age. A distinctive mineral quality and saline finish reflect the terroir."}
foodPairings: ["Roasted chicken with mushroom cream sauce", "Lobster bisque with crème fraîche", "Aged Gruyère and comté cheese", "Pan-seared scallops with brown butter", "Wild mushroom risotto with truffle oil"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Brief decanting of 15-30 minutes can help integrate elements, but not essential for mature wine", "glassware": "Large Burgundy-style glass to capture evolved aromatics", "temperature": "12-14°C (54-57°F), warmer than young Chardonnay to showcase complexity"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Aged, oak-influenced Chardonnay", "region": "Hungary (specific region unknown)", "vintage": "2015", "ageability": "Drinking at peak maturity now; enjoy within 2-3 years as the wine is fully evolved; drink 2025-2028", "grapeVariety": "100% Chardonnay"}

name: Chateau Puy Laborde Bordeaux Superieur 2019
description: A balanced and approachable Bordeaux Supérieur representing excellent value from this classic French region. This blend showcases traditional Bordeaux varieties with smooth fruit, integrated oak, and versatile food-pairing capabilities.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The wine presents an intense purple color, introducing a nose packed with elegant fruit and floral aromas. Red and dark fruits dominate, with blackberry leading alongside touches of dark cherry and plum. A little leather adds complexity and Old World character, while the floral elements provide lift and aromatic interest. The oak integration is subtle, contributing vanilla smoothness without overwhelming the fruit expression. The overall impression is one of elegance and balance rather than power.", "finish": "Medium finish with balanced fruit and subtle oak influence. The tannins are soft and integrated, while the acidity provides a clean, refreshing conclusion. Notes of dark fruit and subtle spice linger pleasantly.", "palate": "Generous and well-rounded on the palate, the wine shows supple and melted tannins that provide structure without astringency. Blackberry fruits touched by vanilla smoothness create a harmonious mid-palate, while the acidity and spice work together to provide balance and vibrancy. The texture is medium-bodied with good depth, showing the characteristic roundness of a successful Bordeaux blend. The fruit remains present throughout, supported by moderate tannins and medium-plus acidity that keeps the wine fresh and food-friendly."}

name: Bernard Gaucher Champagne NV
description: A distinguished grower Champagne showcasing 90% Pinot Noir with 10% Chardonnay, earning gold medals at the prestigious Concours Mondial de Bruxelles in both 2014 and 2015. This Brut Réserve expression demonstrates the power and richness possible from Pinot Noir-dominant Champagne, offering exceptional value from an underrated producer.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is bold and immediately engaging, opening with strong mineral accents and honeysuckle aromatics that signal quality. Brioche and toasted hazelnut notes from extended lees aging intertwine with fresh citrus—particularly lemon and lime—while a subtle sweet earthiness adds depth. Ripe fruit aromas of baked apple and ripe pear emerge with air, complemented by delicate floral notes and a distinctive stony, petrol-like minerality that speaks to terroir.", "finish": "Great persistence through the long finish, with citrus and mineral notes gradually giving way to subtle brioche and almond. A slight pleasant bitterness on the tail adds sophistication and cleansing freshness.", "palate": "Fruit-driven and mouth-filling, the palate showcases the Pinot Noir dominance through rich, round flavors balanced by wonderful acidity. Layers of crisp apple and bright grapefruit provide freshness, while lychee and pear add exotic fruit complexity. The texture is elegant yet substantial, with fine persistent bubbles creating a creamy mouthfeel. Yeasty autolytic character adds savory depth, while the mineral backbone keeps everything lifted and vibrant. The balance between richness and refreshing acidity creates a Champagne of impressive versatility."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh oysters with mignonette sauce", "Butter-poached lobster", "Creamy Brie and triple-cream cheeses", "Smoked salmon canapés", "Roasted chicken with lemon and herbs"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed; serve directly from bottle in proper Champagne flutes", "glassware": "Champagne flute or tulip glass to preserve bubbles and concentrate aromatics", "temperature": "8-10°C (46-50°F) - well-chilled to emphasize freshness"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Brut Réserve Champagne, Pinot Noir-dominant", "region": "Champagne, France", "vintage": "NV (Non-Vintage)", "ageability": "Drink now through 2027; purchase for current enjoyment", "grapeVariety": "90% Pinot Noir, 10% Chardonnay"}

name: Beefsteak Malbec 2019
description: An award-winning Malbec from high-altitude Mendoza vineyards, inspired by 18th-century dining clubs that celebrated the beefsteak as a symbol of liberty and prosperity. This wine showcases the bright, smooth character of classic high-altitude Argentine Malbec with careful oak aging for richness and complexity.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is attractive and expressive with aromas of bramble, elderberry, and ripe black cherry, complemented by violet and rose petal top notes that are characteristic of quality Malbec. A little pepper adds spice, while oak aging contributes lush vanilla and gently spiced aromatics including cinnamon and clove that balance the wine's dark fruit character.", "finish": "The finish is long and smooth with persistent dark fruit flavors, vanilla, and gentle spice notes. The soft tannins carry through to the end, leaving a warm, satisfying impression.", "palate": "The palate is bright, smooth, and approachable, showcasing succulent dark berry fruit including blackberry, plum, and black cherry. The wine has a rich and layered mouthfeel with a creamy texture and soft tannins that provide structure without harshness. Juicy ripe black-fruit notes are balanced by delicious freshness and acidity that keeps the wine lively and food-friendly."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled ribeye steak or Argentine asado", "Beef empanadas with chimichurri", "BBQ ribs with smoky sauce", "Portobello mushroom burgers", "Aged cheddar or Manchego cheese"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Brief decanting of 20-30 minutes will help the wine open up, though it's designed to be approachable upon opening", "glassware": "Large bowl red wine glass or Bordeaux-style glass", "temperature": "16-18°C (60-64°F), slightly cool room temperature"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Bright, approachable high-altitude Malbec with oak aging and soft tannins", "region": "Mendoza, Argentina (high-altitude vineyards)", "vintage": "2019", "ageability": "Drink now through 2027. This wine is designed for relatively near-term enjoyment, though it will develop additional complexity over the next 3-5 years with the fruit integrating further with oak and developing subtle leather notes.", "grapeVariety": "100% Malbec"}

name: Terra Nostra Corse 2021
description: A distinctive Corsican red wine showcasing the island's indigenous varieties. Corsica's warm Mediterranean climate with 2,750 annual sunshine hours and diverse soils create wines with concentrated flavors and distinctive regional character. This vintage benefits from the island's dry harvest conditions and emphasis on quality-focused, temperature-controlled winemaking.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with pronounced notes of wild Mediterranean herbs and garrigue, characteristic of Corsica's spice wines. Dried red berries intermingle with savory elements of black pepper and juniper, while subtle hints of scrubland vegetation and sun-warmed stones add complexity. The aromatic profile reflects the island's unique terroir with a distinctive spicy character that has earned Nielluccio recognition as the 'spice wine of France.'", "finish": "The finish is moderately long with lingering spice notes and a touch of minerality that reflects the diverse Corsican terroir. Red fruit echoes persist alongside dried herb and white pepper accents, leaving a clean, refreshing impression typical of the island's youthful red wines.", "palate": "On the palate, this medium-bodied red delivers bright red cherry and wild strawberry flavors supported by earthy undertones of mushroom and dried herbs. The wine's structure shows good acidity balanced with gentle tannins, typical of wines from Corsica's schist and granite soils. Savory notes of cured meat and Mediterranean scrub provide depth, while the natural fruit concentration from the dry, sunny growing season gives the wine approachable richness without heaviness."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled lamb chops with rosemary and garlic", "Wild boar ragu over pappardelle", "Corsican charcuterie including lonzu and figatellu", "Herb-crusted pork tenderloin", "Aged pecorino or sheep's milk cheeses"]

name: Sutherland Rose 2023
description: A refreshing rosé likely from South Africa's cool-climate Sutherland region, one of the highest and coldest wine-growing areas in the country. This wine captures the crisp acidity and bright fruit character that defines cool-climate rosé production.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Delicate aromatics of fresh strawberry and raspberry dominate, complemented by notes of watermelon and pink grapefruit. Floral hints of rose petal and orange blossom add elegance, while a subtle herbal character—fresh mint and basil—provides complexity. There's a mineral undertone suggesting the unique terroir of high-altitude viticulture.", "finish": "The finish is fresh and lively, with lingering berry fruit and citrus notes. A subtle bitter almond character on the tail adds complexity, while the wine's natural acidity leaves the palate refreshed and ready for the next sip.", "palate": "Light to medium-bodied with vibrant acidity that makes this wine refreshing and food-friendly. The palate shows bright red berry flavors—wild strawberry, cranberry, and red currant—with a citrus edge of pink grapefruit and blood orange. The wine is dry with just a hint of residual sweetness that balances the acidity. A subtle salinity and mineral quality add interest, while the texture is crisp and clean."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled prawns with herbs", "Summer salads with berry vinaigrette", "Fresh sushi and sashimi", "Chilled gazpacho", "Soft cheeses with crackers"]

description: A vibrant Australian rosé from Victoria's cool-climate wine regions, showcasing the fresh, fruit-forward style that characterizes modern Australian rosé production. This 2024 vintage captures the essence of a recent harvest, offering immediate drinkability and bright, approachable character. The Paddy's Blend name suggests a unique proprietary blend that reflects the producer's distinctive winemaking vision.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Bright and expressive aromatics jump from the glass with intense notes of fresh watermelon, ripe strawberries, and ruby red grapefruit. The nose shows youthful exuberance with hints of rose hip and cranberry, while subtle undertones of white pepper and fresh-cut grass add complexity. A delicate floral note reminiscent of hibiscus and a touch of minerality round out this inviting aromatic profile that speaks to the wine's cool-climate origins.", "finish": "The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering notes of citrus zest and red berries. Bright acidity leaves the palate cleansed and energized, perfect for another sip or pairing with food.", "palate": "Crisp and lively on the palate, this rosé bursts with juicy flavors of fresh strawberry, watermelon candy, and blood orange, supported by mouthwatering acidity that provides excellent structure. The wine's light to medium body carries vibrant fruit flavors without heaviness, while notes of pomegranate and tart cherry add depth. A subtle saline quality and hint of crushed herbs provide savory balance to the bright fruit, creating a refreshing, food-friendly profile typical of quality Australian rosés designed for immediate enjoyment."}

Boplaas Gamka Red 2021
description: This Double Gold award-winning red blend from South Africa's Klein Karoo region represents Boplaas Family Vineyards' Portuguese-led flagship. Crafted from low-yield, old vines and aged in French oak, the Gamka Red combines power with elegance. The 2021 vintage earned Double Gold at the 2023 National Wine Challenge, cementing its status as one of South Africa's premier Portuguese-variety blends.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is expressive and layered, revealing concentrated aromas of black hedgerow fruits, wild blackberry, and dark plum. Tart cranberry notes add brightness, while exotic spice elements—cinnamon, clove, and white pepper—contribute complexity. Subtle undertones of violet, dark chocolate, and toasted oak complete the aromatic bouquet.", "finish": "The finish is long and savoury, with persistent notes of dark fruit, exotic spices, and fine-grained tannins. Oak influence is present but well-integrated, adding structure and complexity. The wine's intensity and depth suggest excellent aging potential while remaining approachable now.", "palate": "Full-bodied and structured, with intense dark fruit flavors anchored by fine oak tannins. The blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Barocca, and Shiraz creates a savory, complex palate with layers of blackberry, plum, and black cherry. Traditional vinification methods and 16 months in new French oak have produced integrated tannins that provide grip without harshness. The wine shows excellent concentration from old vines while maintaining balance and elegance."}
foodPairings: ["Braised short ribs with red wine reduction", "Grilled Portuguese-style peri-peri chicken", "Venison loin with blackberry sauce", "Aged Gouda and dark chocolate pairing", "Lamb bobotie (South African spiced lamb casserole)"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 45-60 minutes to soften tannins and allow the wine's complexity to emerge", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux glass to accommodate the wine's intensity", "temperature": "62-66°F (17-19°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Full-bodied Portuguese-variety blend", "region": "Klein Karoo, Western Cape, South Africa", "vintage": "2021", "ageability": "Drink now through 2033. The wine will continue to develop complexity over the next 8-12 years, with tannins softening and tertiary notes emerging.", "grapeVariety": "Touriga Nacional, Tinta Barocca, Shiraz"}

name: Bonelli Bonarda Amabile (Frizzante, Semi Sweet) 2023
description: A delightful semi-sweet, lightly sparkling red wine from Emilia-Romagna's Colli Piacentini DOC. Made from 100% Croatina grapes (locally called Bonarda) using the Charmat method, this wine offers a unique, approachable style perfect as an aperitif or with fruit-based desserts.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Intense ruby red color with violet highlights catches the eye immediately. The nose releases delicate and pleasant aromas dominated by characteristic violet florals and fresh red cherry. Sweet berry notes of strawberry and raspberry add fruitiness, while subtle hints of rose petal provide additional floral complexity. The gentle effervescence carries the aromatics beautifully.", "finish": "Soft, fruity finish with lingering violet and cherry notes. The gentle sparkle refreshes the palate, inviting the next sip.", "palate": "Pleasantly sweet and full-bodied with persistent flavor. The slight sparkle (frizzante) adds lively freshness and prevents the sweetness from becoming cloying. Red cherry and berry fruits dominate the palate with genuine, unadulterated fruit character. The medium body and gentle bubbles create a smooth, velvety texture that's immediately appealing. Low tannins and moderate acidity balance the residual sugar perfectly."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh strawberries and cream", "Fruit tarts and berry desserts", "Roasted chestnuts", "Prosciutto and salami", "Aged Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed; serve directly to preserve the delicate bubbles", "glassware": "Flute or tulip glass to showcase the effervescence", "temperature": "50-54°F (10-12°C) - serve well chilled"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Semi-sweet, lightly sparkling (frizzante) red wine, Charmat method", "region": "Colli Piacentini DOC, Emilia-Romagna, Italy", "vintage": "2023", "ageability": "Best enjoyed young within 1-2 years to appreciate the fresh fruit and lively bubbles. Drink 2023-2025.", "grapeVariety": "100% Croatina (locally known as Bonarda)"}

name: Cantina Fratelli Pardi Sacrantino 2019
description: A powerful expression of Sagrantino di Montefalco, one of Italy's most structured and age-worthy red wines. This wine from Cantina Fratelli Pardi showcases the intense tannins and concentrated fruit that make Sagrantino legendary among collectors and enthusiasts.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Intense and complex, the nose reveals concentrated dark fruit—blackberry, black cherry, and plum—alongside notes of black tea, dried violets, and dark chocolate. There's a distinctive earthy quality with truffle, leather, and tobacco leaf emerging. Oak aging contributes vanilla, toasted oak, and sweet baking spices. Hints of tar, licorice, and dried herbs add further complexity.", "finish": "Exceptionally long and persistent, the finish showcases the wine's structure with firm but fine-grained tannins that linger for minutes. Dark fruit, bitter chocolate, and a hint of iron or blood orange remain, along with the characteristic astringency that defines young Sagrantino.", "palate": "Full-bodied and powerfully structured, this wine showcases Sagrantino's legendary tannins, which are firm and gripping yet refined from aging. The palate is dense with flavors of blackberry jam, cassis, and preserved plum, supported by notes of espresso, dark chocolate, and balsamic. Despite the intensity, there's balance from bright acidity and underlying minerality. The wine's concentration is remarkable, with layers of fruit, earth, and spice unfolding with each sip."}
foodPairings: ["Braised wild boar with polenta", "Grilled bistecca alla fiorentina", "Aged Pecorino Romano cheese", "Truffle-infused pasta dishes", "Roasted lamb with rosemary and garlic"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Essential—decant 2-3 hours before serving to soften tannins and allow the wine to open fully", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux glass with generous bowl for aeration", "temperature": "17-19°C (63-66°F)"}

name: Boxwood Gris 375 ml 2023  375 ml
description: An expressive Sauvignon Gris from Boxwood Estate Winery in Middleburg, Virginia, crafted from 100% estate-grown grapes. This pink-skinned varietal creates a voluptuous, single-varietal wine with powerful floral aromatics and excellent structure. Recent vintages have earned critical acclaim, including 91 points from James Suckling and a silver medal at the 2022 Best of Loudoun wine competition.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is aromatic and distinctive, revealing a characteristic slate or 'wet rock' minerality that defines this wine. Vibrant citrus notes of fresh orange and lemon zest mingle with delicate spring-time flowers and white blossoms. Layers of ripe pear, almond, and a touch of honey add richness, while the wine's powerful floral character—hallmark of the pink-skinned Sauvignon Gris varietal—provides elegance and lift.", "finish": "The finish is clean and persistent, with lingering flavors of citrus zest, pear, and wet stone minerality. The wine's crisp acidity ensures a refreshing conclusion that leaves the palate invigorated.", "palate": "The palate exhibits good weight and a voluptuous texture, supported by crisp-apple acidity that provides structure and balance. Flavors of ripe pear, citrus, and almond dominate, while the wine's mineral core—wet stones and crushed gravel—adds textural interest and reinforces the terroir's influence. The balanced structure ensures that richness and freshness coexist in perfect harmony, creating a wine that is both generous and refined."}
foodPairings: ["Seared scallops with citrus beurre blanc", "Roasted chicken with lemon and herbs", "Creamy risotto with spring vegetables", "Fresh goat cheese and mixed greens salad", "Grilled shrimp skewers with garlic butter"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting necessary; serve directly from the half-bottle to preserve freshness and aromatic intensity", "glassware": "Standard white wine glass with a moderate bowl to showcase the wine's floral aromatics and mineral character", "temperature": "Serve well-chilled at 8-10°C (46-50°F)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Dry, aromatic white wine with voluptuous texture and powerful floral character", "region": "Middleburg, Loudoun County, Virginia", "vintage": "2023", "ageability": "Drink now through 2026. This wine is best enjoyed within 2-3 years of vintage to capture its vibrant aromatics, crisp acidity, and distinctive mineral character.", "grapeVariety": "100% Sauvignon Gris (estate-grown)"}

name: Boxwood Sauvignon Blanc 375 ml 2023  375 ml
description: An elegant Virginia Sauvignon Blanc from Boxwood Estate in the Middleburg AVA, this half-bottle showcases the potential for world-class wine production in Virginia's emerging wine country. Boxwood's meticulous viticulture and winemaking creates a vibrant, terroir-driven expression that competes with top Sauvignon Blancs from established regions.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is vibrant and expressive, opening with intense aromas of fresh grapefruit, lime zest, and gooseberry. Notes of passion fruit and white peach add tropical dimension, while herbaceous hints of freshly cut grass, tomato leaf, and elderflower provide classic Sauvignon Blanc character. A distinctive mineral quality reminiscent of crushed stone and wet slate adds complexity, reflecting Virginia's unique terroir.", "finish": "The finish is crisp, clean, and remarkably long, with persistent citrus and mineral notes. Hints of grapefruit pith and fresh herbs linger, while the wine's vibrant acidity leaves the palate refreshed and ready for food or another sip.", "palate": "Medium-bodied with electric acidity, this Sauvignon Blanc is both refreshing and sophisticated. The palate bursts with citrus flavors of grapefruit and lemon, complemented by tropical notes of guava and green melon. Herbaceous elements of fresh herbs and green bell pepper add complexity without overwhelming the fruit. A pronounced mineral streak runs through the core, providing structure and length, while the wine's crisp acidity keeps everything focused and lively. The texture is lean yet not austere, with subtle weight that comes from quality fruit rather than manipulation."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh Chesapeake Bay oysters", "Grilled asparagus with lemon and parmesan", "Goat cheese and herb tart", "Seared tuna with citrus vinaigrette", "Fresh spring salad with vinaigrette"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Not necessary; serve well-chilled directly from refrigerator", "glassware": "Sauvignon Blanc glass or medium-sized white wine glass", "temperature": "45-48°F (7-9°C)"}

tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is rich and inviting with aromas of black currant, blackberry, and plum creating a dark fruit core. Mocha, cocoa, and woodsmoke notes from aging in American and French oak add complexity, while subtle hints of cassis and dark berry provide additional depth.", "finish": "The finish is long and satisfying with persistent dark fruit, chocolate, and oak spice notes. The tannins are well-integrated, carrying through with excellent balance.", "palate": "The palate is packed with black fruit and raspberry flavors framed by mocha nuances from oak aging. Flavors of boysenberry, plum, and dark chocolate create richness, while integrated oak adds vanilla and toasted notes. The wine's structure is broad-shouldered with ripe tannins that provide backbone without harshness, creating a mouthfeel that is both powerful and refined."}

name: Castoro Cellars Charbono 2022
description: A unique and treat-worthy wine from Castoro Cellars' CCOF certified organic Whale Rock Vineyard in the Templeton Gap of Paso Robles. Charbono is a rare variety, making this wine a distinctive addition to any cellar. The winery has earned acclaim for its Charbono, with the 2020 Whale Rock Reserve earning 92 points and Editors' Choice from Wine Enthusiast.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose displays intense aromatics of black cherry, spice, and plum, complemented by notes of toasted oak from barrel aging. Blueberry and blackberry add dark fruit complexity, while subtle hints of vanilla, cedar, and sweet tobacco from oak contribute depth. Earthy undertones and dried herb notes speak to the organic viticulture, while a touch of graphite and mineral adds refinement.", "finish": "The finish is lengthy and satisfying with persistent dark fruit flavors and subtle oak spice. Soft tannins provide gentle structure, while the wine's richness and complexity linger beautifully. This is a memorable conclusion that showcases why Charbono is worth seeking out.", "palate": "On the palate, the wine delivers rich flavors of blueberry, plum, and black cherry as the core fruit profile. Layers of dark chocolate, espresso, and toasted oak add complexity without overwhelming the fruit. The wine shows good concentration and weight from the organic Whale Rock fruit, with a silky texture and soft, well-integrated tannins. Despite its richness, the wine maintains balance and elegance, showing the refined character that earned critical acclaim for Castoro's Charbono program."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled ribeye or porterhouse steak", "Braised short ribs with red wine reduction", "Duck confit with cherry gastrique", "Wild mushroom risotto with truffle oil", "Aged sharp Cheddar or smoked Gouda"]

name: Colle Corviano Cerasuolo Rose 2024
description: An authentic Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo rosé from Italy's Abruzzo region, crafted entirely from Montepulciano grapes. This wine exemplifies the distinctive cherry-red color and robust character that sets Cerasuolo apart from lighter rosés, earning its own DOC designation in 2010. The 2024 vintage captures the wine's signature combination of depth and freshness that makes this style a favorite among rosé enthusiasts seeking more substantial flavor profiles.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose reveals characteristically intense aromatics of ripe strawberry and dried cherry, layered with distinctive notes of orange peel and cinnamon that define quality Cerasuolo. The wine's deeper color from Montepulciano's highly pigmented skins contributes to more concentrated aromatics than typical rosés, with hints of raspberry leaf and crushed red berries. Subtle floral notes of wild rose and a whisper of Mediterranean herbs add complexity to this aromatic, inviting profile.", "finish": "The finish is substantial and lingering, with persistent notes of dried cherry, orange peel, and spice. Unlike lighter rosés that fade quickly, this Cerasuolo maintains presence on the palate with its structured tannins and bright acidity, leaving a satisfying, food-friendly impression.", "palate": "Medium-bodied and notably heartier than most rosés, this Cerasuolo delivers robust flavors of strawberry, dried cherry, and red currant, supported by the structure and tannin presence that comes from the Montepulciano grape's thick skins. Distinctive notes of orange zest, cinnamon spice, and hints of pomegranate create the complex flavor profile praised by experts like Joe Bastianich. The wine maintains excellent acidity to balance its fruit intensity, with savory undertones of dried herbs and a mineral edge that reflects the Abruzzo terroir, particularly from the mountainous L'Aquila province."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled swordfish with tomato and olive relish", "Pasta all'amatriciana with guanciale", "Porchetta with fennel and herbs", "Arrosticini (Abruzzese lamb skewers)", "Aged pecorino cheese with honey"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Brief 15-minute decanting can enhance aromatics and soften tannins", "glassware": "Medium white wine glass or small red wine glass", "temperature": "48-52°F (9-11°C), lightly chilled"}

Knuttel Family Wines Tentadora Malbec 2017
description: A distinguished Argentine Malbec showcasing the deep color, intense fruity flavors, and velvety texture that characterize premium wines from this region. The 2017 vintage offers additional complexity from bottle age, with the wine developing secondary characteristics while maintaining the juicy fruit notes and violet aromas typical of quality Malbec. This wine represents the aging potential that has made Argentine Malbec rival its French counterparts in critical acclaim.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet opens with intense aromas of ripe blackberry, black cherry, and plum, layered with the distinctive violet and floral notes that define quality Argentine Malbec. As the wine has aged, secondary aromas of leather, tobacco leaf, and dark chocolate have emerged, adding complexity to the youthful fruit. Hints of vanilla and sweet spice from oak aging integrate beautifully, while subtle notes of dried herbs and graphite provide depth. The wine's deep, inky color is reflected in the intensity and concentration of its aromatic profile.", "finish": "The finish is impressively long and layered, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually revealing notes of leather, cocoa, and sweet spice. Soft, integrated tannins provide structure while the wine's velvety texture lingers, demonstrating the aging potential that has earned high-altitude Argentine Malbecs scores above 95 points from major critics.", "palate": "Rich and plush on the palate, this Malbec delivers concentrated flavors of blackberry compote, dark plum, and black cherry, supported by the soft, velvety tannins that characterize premium Argentine production. The wine's full body is balanced by fresh acidity that maintains structure and prevents heaviness, while the mid-palate reveals complexity with notes of mocha, dark chocolate, and hints of blueberry. Oak aging contributes layers of vanilla, cinnamon, and toasted spice, while the wine's natural fruit concentration creates a juicy, fruit-forward profile with savory undertones of black olive and dried herbs."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled Argentine asado with chimichurri", "Braised beef short ribs with red wine reduction", "Rack of lamb with herb crust", "Aged Manchego or Gruyère cheese", "Dark chocolate desserts with berry compote"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 45-60 minutes to allow complex flavors to fully express and integrate", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux or Malbec-specific glass", "temperature": "62-66°F (16-19°C)"}

name: Frascole Chianti Rufina Riserva 2017
description: An elegant Chianti Rufina Riserva from the esteemed Frascole estate, representing one of Chianti's most refined sub-zones. Rufina is known for producing Chianti with exceptional aging potential and distinctive character from its high-altitude vineyards northeast of Florence.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Classic Chianti aromatics of red cherry and violet are complemented by more complex notes developed from Riserva aging. The bouquet shows layers of dried cherry, plum, and cranberry alongside earthy elements of leather, tobacco, and forest floor. Oak influence is subtle and integrated, contributing vanilla, cedar, and sweet spice. Herbal notes of sage and dried oregano add a Tuscan character, while hints of balsamic and tea leaf provide depth.", "finish": "Long and sophisticated, with the fruit and earth elements in beautiful harmony. Red cherry and dried herb notes persist, accompanied by fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. A subtle note of orange peel and anise emerges at the very end.", "palate": "Medium to full-bodied with the structured elegance that defines Rufina. The palate reveals bright red fruit—cherry, raspberry, and pomegranate—balanced by savory notes of dried herbs, mushroom, and cured meat. The acidity is vibrant and mouthwatering, typical of the cooler Rufina climate, while the tannins are firm but refined from extended aging. Underlying minerality and a hint of iron add complexity, while the oak is well-integrated, providing support without dominating."}
foodPairings: ["Bistecca alla fiorentina (Florentine T-bone steak)", "Wild boar ragu with pappardelle", "Aged Tuscan Pecorino cheese", "Osso buco with saffron risotto", "Grilled lamb chops with rosemary"]

name: Central Valley Banner Day Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
description: A robust California Cabernet Sauvignon from the Central Valley, this wine delivers approachable fruit-forward character with smooth tannins. The warm Central Valley climate produces ripe, concentrated fruit that makes for an immediately enjoyable red wine with classic varietal character.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Bold aromas of blackcurrant and ripe blackberry leap from the glass, immediately announcing this wine's generous fruit character. Underlying notes of dark cherry and plum add depth, while hints of cedar, tobacco leaf, and sweet vanilla from oak aging provide complexity. A subtle suggestion of dried herbs and dark chocolate rounds out the aromatic profile, creating an inviting and layered bouquet.", "finish": "The finish is warm and lingering, with persistent dark fruit flavors accompanied by notes of vanilla and subtle spice. Soft tannins carry through to the end, leaving a smooth, satisfying conclusion that showcases the wine's approachable nature.", "palate": "The palate is full-bodied and richly textured, opening with concentrated flavors of black fruit compote and cassis. Mid-palate notes of blackberry jam, dark cherry, and hints of mocha create a plush, velvety mouthfeel. Well-integrated tannins provide structure without harshness, while the wine's moderate acidity keeps it balanced and prevents it from feeling heavy. Touches of vanilla, toasted oak, and baking spices add dimension throughout."}

wineDetails: {"style": "Full-bodied, fruit-forward California red", "region": "Central Valley, California", "vintage": "2019", "ageability": "Drink now through 2027; approachable now with potential for short-term cellaring", "grapeVariety": "100% Cabernet Sauvignon"}

name: Champagne Bauget-Jouette Blanc de Blancs 2016
description: An elegant vintage Champagne crafted entirely from Chardonnay grapes, Bauget-Jouette's Blanc de Blancs 2016 exemplifies the finesse and precision of this prestigious style. With extended aging on lees, this wine has developed complexity and refinement while maintaining the vibrant freshness that makes great Champagne so captivating.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with refined aromas of green apple, white peach, and citrus zest, elevated by the wine's fine, persistent mousse. With aeration, layers of brioche, toasted almond, and fresh-baked pastry emerge, testament to its extended lees aging. Delicate notes of white flowers, particularly acacia and hawthorn, add elegance, while subtle hints of chalky minerality and sea spray speak to the terroir. A whisper of honey and lemon curd adds richness without heaviness.", "finish": "The finish is exceptionally long and precise, with lingering citrus, mineral, and toasted bread notes. The wine's remarkable balance leaves a lasting impression of elegance and complexity, with a subtle nuttiness and vibrant freshness persisting well after the glass is empty.", "palate": "On the palate, this Blanc de Blancs is beautifully structured with racy acidity and an ultra-fine bead of bubbles that creates an elegant, creamy mousse. Flavors of crisp apple, Meyer lemon, and white grapefruit provide the foundation, enhanced by notes of blanched almond, brioche, and subtle butterscotch from autolytic aging. The wine's mineral backbone is pronounced, lending precision and focus to the rich, developed flavors. A saline quality adds tension and freshness, while the integration of fruit, aging characters, and acidity is seamless and sophisticated."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh oysters on the half shell", "Lobster with drawn butter", "Seared scallops with cauliflower purée", "Caviar and blinis with crème fraîche", "Aged Gruyère or Comté cheese"]

name: Oleandri Rutherford Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
description: A prestigious Cabernet Sauvignon from Rutherford AVA, one of Napa Valley's most celebrated appellations. The 2019 vintage captures the essence of Rutherford's unique terroir, featuring the district's famous gravelly loam soils that impart a distinctive dusty tannin quality alongside concentrated dark fruit character.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with intense aromas of cassis and blackberry, layered with notes of graphite, cedar, and cigar box. Classic Rutherford characteristics emerge in the form of dried sage, pencil lead, and the subtle dusty quality that defines the appellation. Hints of dark chocolate, espresso, and sweet tobacco add complexity, while a touch of violet and eucalyptus provides aromatic lift. The integration of French oak is evident in subtle vanilla and baking spice notes.", "finish": "The finish is long and powerful, with persistent dark fruit flavors and integrated oak spice. The dusty tannins characteristic of Rutherford provide texture and grip, while the wine's balanced acidity ensures freshness. Notes of dark chocolate and coffee linger alongside fruit, promising excellent evolution over the coming decade.", "palate": "Full-bodied and powerful, the palate delivers concentrated flavors of black currant, blackberry, and black cherry, framed by firm but refined tannins. The famous 'Rutherford dust' character manifests as a fine, powdery tannin structure that coats the palate with elegant grip. Layers of dark chocolate, espresso, and toasted oak provide depth, while hints of mint, anise, and black pepper add savory complexity. The wine's structure suggests excellent aging potential while remaining approachable in its youth."}
foodPairings: ["Prime dry-aged ribeye or New York strip steak", "Herb-crusted rack of lamb", "Braised beef short ribs with red wine reduction", "Grilled portobello mushrooms with blue cheese", "Aged hard cheeses like aged Gouda or Parmigiano-Reggiano"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "1-2 hours recommended to soften tannins and unlock aromatic complexity", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux-style glass to showcase aromatics", "temperature": "62-68°F (17-20°C)"}
