name: Libertine "You Are Still Alive" Pet-Nat 2022
description: A vibrant pétillant naturel from Oregon's Willamette Valley, crafted using the ancestral method with native vineyard yeasts and minimal intervention. This natural sparkling wine showcases the pure expression of its terroir through fermentation in neutral oak barrels with no additives except a minimal amount of sulfite.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with lively effervescence releasing fresh orchard fruits—green apple and Asian pear—intermingled with white flowers and a subtle bread dough character from extended lees contact. Delicate notes of citrus zest and raw almonds add complexity, while a mineral undertone hints at the volcanic soils of the Willamette Valley. The aromatic profile is clean yet expressive, balancing wild fermentation character with bright fruit purity.", "finish": "The finish is refreshingly crisp with lingering citrus notes and a clean mineral edge. A gentle effervescence persists, leaving the palate energized and ready for another sip. The conclusion is dry yet fruit-forward, with subtle phenolic grip providing structure to this fun, unconventional sparkling wine.", "palate": "On the palate, fine, persistent bubbles create a creamy mousse that carries flavors of crisp green apple, Meyer lemon, and white peach. The wine shows remarkable tension between its fruity sweetness and zippy acidity, with a slightly saline quality adding depth. Mid-palate weight comes from extended lees aging, offering a subtle yeasty richness without heaviness. The neutral oak barrel fermentation provides texture rather than oak flavor, allowing the fruit and natural wine character to shine through."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh oysters with mignonette", "Grilled white fish tacos with lime crema", "Aged goat cheese and honey", "Vietnamese spring rolls with nuoc cham", "Fried chicken with herbs"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed; open and pour immediately. Note that pet-nat is unfiltered and may contain sediment—pour gently or embrace the cloudiness as part of the natural wine experience", "glassware": "White wine glass or champagne flute to concentrate aromatics and display bubbles", "temperature": "45-50°F (7-10°C), well-chilled to showcase effervescence and acidity"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Pétillant Naturel (Pet-Nat), Natural Sparkling Wine", "region": "Willamette Valley AVA, Oregon", "vintage": "2022", "ageability": "Drink now through 2025. Pet-nat wines are meant to be enjoyed young and fresh to capture their vibrant, exuberant character and lively bubbles.", "grapeVariety": "Blend of white varietals fermented with native vineyard yeast"}

name: Chateau Josephine Cabernet Sauvignon Semi Sweet   (MD & DC) 2023
description: This semi-sweet kosher Cabernet Sauvignon from Yecla, Spain offers an approachable style with bright fruit flavors and gentle sweetness. Perfect for those preferring a softer wine profile, it balances ripe fruit character with just enough structure to remain food-friendly.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Fruity and expressive, the nose bursts with aromas of fresh cherries, black currant, and a distinctive eucalyptus note that adds herbal complexity. The semi-sweet style showcases forward fruit aromatics with hints of vanilla from oak contact. Inviting and approachable, with bright berry fruit leading the way.", "finish": "The finish is smooth and fruit-forward with lingering sweet cherry notes and a touch of vanilla. Pleasant sweetness persists without heaviness, making this wine particularly enjoyable for casual sipping.", "palate": "Rich flavors of black currant and dark cherries dominate the palate, complemented by creamy vanilla notes and gentle sweetness. The semi-sweet profile provides roundness and immediate accessibility, while moderate acidity prevents cloying. Soft tannins and plush fruit create a crowd-pleasing, easy-drinking experience with noticeable but balanced residual sugar."}

name: Chateau Maris Brama 2018
description: An exceptional biodynamic white wine from Languedoc's Château Maris, Europe's first B Corp certified winery. Made from 100% Grenache Gris and aged in new French oak barrels followed by concrete eggs, this wine received a Master Medal at the Drinks Business Global Organic Masters. The wine represents the estate's commitment to sustainable, innovative winemaking while showcasing the unique character of Grenache Gris.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is fresh and focused, opening with vibrant tropical fruits including pineapple and mango. Delicate honeysuckle and white flowers add elegance, while notes of lemon rind provide citrus brightness. A distinctive note of buttered almonds from oak aging adds richness and complexity to the aromatic profile.", "finish": "Clean and persistent with lingering tropical fruit and subtle oak notes. The acidity carries through to a refreshing conclusion that showcases the wine's purity and elegance.", "palate": "Medium-bodied with a lovely, elegant texture that's beautifully lifted by the wine's natural acidity. The wine is racy and pure, delivering concentrated tropical fruit flavors alongside citrus and stone fruit. The oak influence is seamlessly integrated, adding depth without overwhelming the fruit. Notes of toasted almond and subtle vanilla complement the fruit core. The texture is refined and sophisticated."}
foodPairings: ["Seared scallops with beurre blanc", "Lobster with drawn butter", "Roasted chicken with herbs", "Creamy risotto with mushrooms", "Aged Gruyère cheese"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Brief 15-20 minute aeration recommended to open aromatics", "glassware": "White Burgundy or large-bowled white wine glass", "temperature": "50-55°F (10-13°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Full-bodied oak-aged white wine, biodynamic", "region": "Minervois, Languedoc, France", "vintage": "2018", "ageability": "Drink now through 2026; has structure for medium-term aging", "grapeVariety": "100% Grenache Gris"}

name: Chateau Jupille Carillon Saint Emilion 2015
description: The 2015 vintage from Château Jupille Carillon represents a powerful expression from one of Saint-Émilion's quality-focused estates. Wine Enthusiast praised this Cuvée Prestige for its firm structure and serious wood aging, noting the wine's richness and development potential. Crafted from 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Franc from 67-year-old vines, this wine captures the intensity and complexity of a stellar Bordeaux vintage.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Intense and complex nose revealing layers of ripe fruits including blackberry, dark cherry, and plum. Notes of licorice emerge alongside light woody and spicy character that's well integrated. The aromatics show both power and elegance, with hints of graphite, tobacco leaf, and dried herbs adding complexity. The oak influence is present but harmonious.", "finish": "Long and structured with firm, dry tannins that will soften with age. The finish shows the wine's potential for development, with layers of fruit, spice, and oak that will integrate further over time.", "palate": "Both fresh and powerful on the palate, showing excellent balance between fruit ripeness and structural elements. Hints of blackberry dominate the fruit core, supported by dark cherry and cassis. The wine displays good sweetness from ripe fruit, with character and depth that reveal the quality of the vintage. Elegant tannins provide structure and aging potential while remaining refined. The acidity lifts the fruit and extends the flavor profile."}

name: Noughty NA Red Wine NV
description: A sophisticated dealcoholized Syrah from South Africa's renowned wine regions, expertly crafted to retain the structure, tannins, and complexity of traditional red wine while removing the alcohol to less than 0.5% ABV. This organic, vegan-friendly wine offers an authentic red wine experience without the intoxicating effects.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The wine presents a deep burgundy color with warm, inviting aromas of ripe red fruits—cherries, pomegranate, and strawberries—layered with dried rose petals and a hint of crushed black pepper. Subtle vanilla and oak notes emerge from French oak integration, adding depth without overwhelming the fruit character. Delicate floral jasmine notes provide elegance, while a whisper of candied cherry and blackcurrant adds complexity to this remarkably expressive non-alcoholic wine.", "finish": "The finish shows surprising length and persistence for a dealcoholized wine, with lingering cherry and subtle oak spice notes. Soft tannins provide a gentle, pleasing astringency that cleanses the palate, while the overall impression remains fresh and vibrant rather than medicinal or overly sweet.", "palate": "On the palate, Noughty Rouge defies expectations with a medium-bodied structure and smooth, velvety mouthfeel that avoids the thin, stripped character common in many non-alcoholic wines. The wine retains impressive soft tannins that provide gentle grip and structure, beautifully balanced with bright red fruit flavors. Crushed black pepper and subtle coffee notes add savory complexity, while French oak tannins integrate seamlessly to create depth and roundness. The wine maintains excellent balance between fruit sweetness and acidity, delivering a genuinely satisfying red wine experience."}

description: A full-bodied Dry Creek Valley Cabernet Sauvignon that exemplifies the robust character of this renowned Sonoma region. Crafted from the 2021 vintage which experienced earlier-than-normal harvest and dry conditions that concentrated flavors while reducing yields, resulting in exceptional depth and intensity.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with lush aromas of ripe blackberry and dark cherry, interwoven with plum and cranberry notes that add brightness. Classic Dry Creek Valley herbal nuances emerge—bay leaf, dried sage, and white pepper—complemented by hints of nutmeg and cedar from oak aging. Underlying floral notes of violet add elegance, while earthy undertones of mushroom and fine leather provide complexity and suggest the wine's serious pedigree.", "finish": "The finish is long and layered, with persistent dark fruit flavors, subtle oak spice, and a minerality that adds elegance. Fine-grained tannins and balanced acidity ensure a clean, satisfying conclusion that invites another sip. The wine's plush texture and well-integrated components suggest it will develop beautifully with proper cellaring.", "palate": "This full-bodied Cabernet reveals concentrated flavors of black currant, black cherry, and cranberry on a plush, well-rounded palate. The wine shows excellent fruit intensity balanced by savory elements of herbes de Provence, mocha, and espresso. Fine leather and mineral notes bolster the wine's richness, while hints of dried herbs add complexity. Firm yet supple tannins provide excellent structure without being aggressive, making this Cabernet approachable in its youth while promising excellent aging potential. The wine's concentrated fruit character reflects the outstanding flavor development from the 2021 vintage's reduced yields."}

name: Korde Pinea Blanco 2022-2023
description: An innovative white wine from Ribera del Duero's Pinea winery, showcasing the region's native white grape varieties. This unique cuvée represents a dialogue between two consecutive vintages—2022 and 2023—blended to achieve both depth and freshness in a single wine, demonstrating the winemaker's creative approach to expressing indigenous varietals.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose unfolds with restrained elegance, revealing delicate white flowers—acacia and orange blossom—interwoven with ripe citrus notes of Meyer lemon and grapefruit zest. A distinctive saline, mineral touch adds complexity, evoking limestone soils and cool cellars. Subtle hints of stone fruit (white peach and apricot) emerge with aeration, while a creamy, lees-derived note suggests texture and richness beneath the wine's elegant aromatic profile.", "finish": "The finish is remarkably persistent and creamy, with lingering citrus and saline notes providing freshness against the wine's rich texture. The combination of vintages ensures balance between weight and acidity, making the conclusion both satisfying and uplifting. Subtle oak spice and a mineral edge complete this unique white wine experience.", "palate": "On the palate, this wine displays tremendous structure and a viscous, almost glycerin-like texture that coats the mouth luxuriously. The dual-vintage vinification creates exceptional complexity—the older vintage providing depth, oak integration, and evolved flavors, while the younger vintage contributes vibrant acidity and fresh fruit character. Abundant aromas of flowers and fruits translate to flavors of citrus, stone fruit, and subtle tropical notes (pineapple, mango). The wine's creamy mouthfeel comes from extended lees aging in French oak barrels, while maintaining refreshing minerality and tension. This is a white wine of substance and character, far from simple or one-dimensional."}
foodPairings: ["Pan-seared scallops with brown butter and capers", "Roasted turbot with lemon-herb crust", "Creamy risotto with saffron and shellfish", "Aged Manchego cheese with quince paste", "Grilled lobster tail with garlic butter"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "30 minutes of decanting or extended time in the glass helps this complex wine open up and reveal its layered character", "glassware": "Burgundy-style white wine glass to showcase aromatic intensity and texture", "temperature": "50-54°F (10-12°C), cool but not ice-cold to appreciate texture and complexity"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Complex White Wine, Dual-Vintage Assemblage", "region": "DO Ribera del Duero, Castilla y León, Spain", "vintage": "2022-2023 (dual vintage blend)", "ageability": "Drink now through 2027. The dual-vintage approach and oak aging provide structure for medium-term aging. name: Natte Valleij Cinsault Stellenbosch 2023
description: An exceptional single-varietal Cinsault from one of South Africa's most celebrated producers of this underappreciated grape. Sourced from 46-year-old bush vines planted on decomposed granite soils on the slopes of the Helderberg Mountain, just 7km from False Bay. The maritime influence and ancient vines create a wine of remarkable elegance and purity that has earned critical acclaim (96 points Greg Sherwood, 95 Tim Atkin, 17.5 Jancis Robinson).
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The wine captivates with an intriguing rosé-ruby color and aromas of vibrant red fruits—wild strawberry, fresh cherry, and pomegranate—that leap from the glass with purity and intensity. Delicate floral notes of jasmine, violet, and rose petal add aromatic complexity and elegance. The cool maritime influence from nearby False Bay contributes a subtle salinity and freshness, while the old bush vines provide depth and concentration. Hints of white pepper, dried herbs, and subtle earthy notes add savory complexity without detracting from the wine's primary fruit character.", "finish": "The finish is pure, persistent, and refreshing, with lingering red berry fruit, floral notes, and pronounced minerality. The wine's bright acidity and subtle tannins ensure a clean, lifted conclusion that invites immediate revisitation. At only 11.5% alcohol, the wine finishes with remarkable energy and drinkability, making it dangerously easy to enjoy.", "palate": "On the palate, this Cinsault defies expectations with its combination of delicacy and intensity. Bright red fruit flavors—cherry, cranberry, and red currant—dominate, supported by remarkable freshness and energy from the wine's low 11.5% alcohol and vibrant acidity. The decomposed granite soils contribute a distinctive mineral edge and silky texture, while the maritime influence adds subtle saline notes that enhance the wine's complexity. Despite its light body and pale color, the wine shows impressive concentration from the ancient bush vines, with surprising depth and length. The short maceration in vats preserves the wine's juicy, fruit-forward character while maintaining structural elegance."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled tuna with Provençal herbs", "Roasted duck breast with cherry gastrique", "Charcuterie board with pâté and cornichons", "Mushroom and goat cheese tart", "Seared salmon with beet and citrus salad"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "30 minutes of gentle decanting or extended time in the glass allows the wine's aromatic complexity to fully express itself. The wine is delicate, so avoid aggressive aeration", "glassware": "Pinot Noir or Burgundy-style glass to capture delicate aromatics and showcase the wine's elegant structure", "temperature": "55-60°F (13-15°C), slightly cool to highlight freshness and delicate aromatics"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Light-bodied Red Wine, Old Vine, Maritime Influence", "region": "Stellenbosch, Helderberg Mountain, Western Cape, South Africa", "vintage": "2023", "ageability": "Best consumed within 3-5 years to preserve primary fruit character and freshness (drink by 2026-2028). While the old vines provide structure for moderate aging, this wine's appeal lies in its vibrant fruit and delicate aromatics, which are best enjoyed relatively young. Serve slightly chilled in warm weather.", "grapeVariety": "100% Cinsault from 46-year-old bush vines on decomposed granite soils"}

name: Cobden Wini Old Federal Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
description: A contemporary Australian Cabernet Sauvignon that showcases the intensity and fruit-forward character of New World winemaking. This wine balances ripe fruit concentration with structural integrity, offering immediate appeal while maintaining aging potential. An approachable yet serious expression of Cabernet.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose displays vibrant aromas of ripe blackcurrant, blueberry, and dark cherry with excellent clarity. Notes of eucalyptus and mint add an Australian signature, while cedar, vanilla, and sweet oak spices contribute complexity. Subtle hints of dark chocolate and graphite provide depth, creating an inviting and complex aromatic profile.", "finish": "The finish is clean and moderately long with persistent dark fruit and subtle oak influence. Ripe tannins provide gentle structure, while balanced acidity maintains freshness. Notes of blackcurrant and cedar fade gracefully, leaving a satisfying and harmonious conclusion.", "palate": "Medium to full-bodied with concentrated flavors of blackberry, cassis, and plum. The palate reveals layers of dark chocolate, coffee, and toasted oak, supported by firm yet approachable tannins. Mid-palate richness shows hints of black olive, dried herbs, and a touch of peppery spice. Well-integrated oak adds structure and vanilla notes without dominating the pure fruit expression."}

name: Colle Corviano Chardonnay 2022
description: An approachable Italian Chardonnay from the Abruzzo region, this wine showcases the fresh, mineral-driven style typical of Central Italian white wines. Colle Corviano crafts balanced expressions that highlight fruit purity while maintaining vibrant acidity and elegant structure.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with enticing aromas of ripe golden apples and white peaches, layered with subtle notes of citrus blossom and a whisper of toasted almonds. As the wine breathes, delicate hints of fresh herbs and mineral undertones emerge, adding complexity. A touch of vanilla from gentle oak contact provides a sophisticated backdrop without overwhelming the fresh fruit character.", "finish": "The finish is clean and moderately long, with lingering notes of citrus and almond. A pleasant mineral quality persists, accompanied by a refreshing acidity that invites another sip and makes this wine particularly food-friendly.", "palate": "On the palate, this Chardonnay delivers a medium-bodied experience with bright acidity that energizes the taste buds. Flavors of crisp pear and green apple dominate the entry, followed by notes of ripe stone fruit and a hint of lemon zest. The wine's creamy texture balances beautifully with its refreshing citrus elements, while a subtle minerality runs through the mid-palate, lending precision and focus. The integration of fruit and oak is seamless, creating a harmonious whole."}

name: Cobden Wini Russian River Valley Pinot Noir 2022
description: An elegant Russian River Valley Pinot Noir that exemplifies the region's cool-climate excellence and signature style. The 2022 vintage captures the area's ability to produce wines of remarkable finesse, combining intense aromatics with silky texture and complex fruit character shaped by coastal fog and well-drained soils.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Seductive aromas of fresh red cherry and cranberry dominate, accompanied by layers of wild strawberry and rhubarb. Floral notes of violet and rose petal add elegance, while subtle undertones of forest floor, dried tea leaves, and baking spice create intrigue. A delicate hint of oak-derived vanilla and toasted hazelnut weaves through the fruit, never overpowering the wine's inherent elegance.", "finish": "Long and graceful finish with persistent red fruit and earthy undertones. The tannins are polished and seamless, while bright acidity ensures a clean, refreshing conclusion. Subtle spice notes linger alongside the fruit, leaving a sophisticated impression.", "palate": "Silky and refined on the palate with bright red fruit flavors of Bing cherry, raspberry, and pomegranate taking center stage. The texture is luxurious yet weightless, with fine-grained tannins providing structure without heaviness. Mid-palate complexity reveals earthy notes of mushroom, autumn leaves, and subtle cola spice, while integrated acidity keeps everything vibrant and lifted. The Russian River character shines through with its combination of fruit purity and savory complexity."}

name: Lambert Estate A Thousand Words Chardonnay 2023
description: A premium Chardonnay from Australia's Barossa Valley, showcasing the region's capacity for world-class white wine production. This wine combines vibrant fruit expression with sophisticated oak treatment, spending 9 months on lees in 30% new French oak to develop richness and complexity.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Lively and inviting, the wine displays vibrant gold color with aromas of lychee, pineapple, and rock melon (cantaloupe) leading the tropical fruit spectrum. Subtle hints of toasted cashews, butterscotch, and baking spice emerge from the oak aging, creating layers of complexity. Additional notes of lemon zest and nectarine add brightness to the aromatic profile.", "finish": "Generous and lengthy finish with lingering tropical fruit, creamy texture, and subtle toasted oak. The hazelnut and butterscotch notes carry through, leaving a sophisticated, satisfying impression.", "palate": "Rich and opulent on the palate, featuring complex flavors of lychee, nectarine, and mandarin zest balanced by a creamy, hazelnut-cream texture from lees aging. The butterscotch and melted butter oak notes integrate beautifully beneath the stone fruit surface. Despite the richness, a vibrant acid backbone provides structure and prevents the wine from becoming heavy, creating excellent balance."}
foodPairings: ["Lobster with drawn butter", "Roasted chicken with tarragon cream sauce", "Seared scallops with cauliflower purée", "Aged Gruyère or Comté cheese", "Creamy risotto with wild mushrooms"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed, though allowing the wine 10-15 minutes in the glass helps it open up", "glassware": "Burgundy glass or full-bodied white wine glass to capture the rich aromatics", "temperature": "50-55°F (10-13°C), slightly warmer than typical Chardonnay to appreciate the texture and complexity"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Dry White Wine - Full-Bodied, Oak-Aged Chardonnay", "region": "Barossa Valley, South Australia", "vintage": "2023", "ageability": "Drink now through 2028. The wine has the structure and acidity to develop additional complexity over the next 3-5 years, though it's also delicious in its youth. 13.5% alcohol.", "grapeVariety": "100% Chardonnay"}

name: Clos d'Audhuy Les Polissons 2022
description: A joyful, approachable Malbec from Cahors in Southwest France, crafted by Benoît Aymard at Clos d'Audhuy. Made from 30-year-old Malbec vines using organic farming practices (certified 2018) and minimal intervention winemaking, this wine exemplifies the modern, fruit-forward approach to Cahors that prioritizes drinkability and pleasure over power and extraction.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose bursts with exuberant dark fruit aromas—blackcurrant, blueberry, and black cherry—that showcase Malbec's inherent fruitiness when handled gently. Rich coffee and espresso notes add depth and roasted complexity, while subtle hints of cocoa and dark chocolate suggest the variety's natural richness. Delicate floral notes of violet emerge with aeration, adding refinement. The aromatic profile is clean, pure, and intensely fruity, reflecting the short maceration and tank vinification that preserve fresh fruit character over extracted tannins.", "finish": "The finish is smooth, fruity, and satisfying, with lingering dark berry fruit, subtle coffee notes, and soft tannins. The conclusion is clean and refreshing rather than heavy or extracted, making this a wine that invites another pour. The organic, low-intervention approach shines through in the wine's purity and drinkability.", "palate": "On the palate, Les Polissons lives up to its name (which translates to 'rascals' or 'scamps') with juicy, playful fruit that prioritizes immediate pleasure. Flavors of ripe blackberry, plum, and dark cherry dominate, accompanied by coffee, mocha, and subtle spice notes. The wine is round and silky with approachable tannins that provide structure without astringency—a result of the gentle short maceration technique. Medium body and fresh acidity keep the wine lively and food-friendly, while avoiding the heavy, tannic character of traditional Cahors. The minimal use of sulfites (40-60 mg/l total) and natural winemaking approach preserve the wine's vibrant fruit purity and make it incredibly drinkable."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled steak frites with herb butter", "Duck confit with roasted potatoes", "Cassoulet with Toulouse sausage", "Aged Cantal or Laguiole cheese", "Mushroom and truffle risotto"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "20-30 minutes of decanting can help the wine open up, though the approachable style makes immediate drinking enjoyable. Natural wines often benefit from aeration", "glassware": "Standard red wine glass or Bordeaux-style glass", "temperature": "60-64°F (15-18°C), slightly cool to emphasize freshness and fruit"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Organic Red Wine, Natural Winemaking, Minimal Intervention (low sulfites, no oenological additives)", "region": "Cahors AOC, Sud-Ouest, France", "vintage": "2022", "ageability": "Drink now through 2027. This wine is crafted for early consumption to showcase fresh fruit and juicy character. While the tannins provide some structure for short-term aging, the wine's appeal lies in its immediate drinkability. Best enjoyed within 3-5 years of vintage.", "grapeVariety": "100% Malbec from 30-year-old vines"}

name: Colle Corviano Pecorino 2023
description: From the Abruzzo region of Italy, this Pecorino showcases one of Italy's most exciting indigenous white varietals. Colle Corviano crafts this fresh, aromatic wine that captures the variety's distinctive character and the terroir of the Adriatic hillsides.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Aromatic and expressive, the nose offers white peach, green apple, and citrus blossom alongside delicate floral notes of acacia and chamomile. Herbal elements of fennel, fresh herbs, and a hint of anise add complexity and Mediterranean character. Subtle mineral notes of flint and wet stone provide depth, while a touch of almond and white pepper adds intrigue. The aromatic profile is fresh, inviting, and distinctly Italian.", "finish": "Long and satisfying, the finish features persistent stone fruit and citrus flavors with pronounced minerality. A subtle almond note and herbal character add complexity, while bright acidity ensures a clean, refreshing conclusion. The wine leaves a slightly saline impression that enhances its food-friendly nature.", "palate": "Medium-bodied with excellent structure and a rich, almost oily texture characteristic of Pecorino. The palate delivers flavors of ripe stone fruits—peach, apricot, and nectarine—balanced by bright citrus notes of lemon and grapefruit. Fresh acidity provides energy and lift, while a distinctive saline minerality adds complexity and a sense of place. Subtle nutty notes and hints of fennel seed contribute to the wine's unique personality. The texture is more substantial than many Italian whites, with a slight glycerol richness that doesn't compromise freshness."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled branzino with lemon and herbs", "Seafood risotto with saffron", "Fried calamari with aioli", "Pecorino cheese (no relation) with honey", "Pasta alle vongole (clams)"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting necessary. Serve chilled.", "glassware": "Medium-sized white wine glass", "temperature": "10-12°C (50-54°F)"}

Drink now through 2026, though Pecorino can develop interesting complexity with 2-3 years of aging.", "grapeVariety": "100% Pecorino"}

name: Colle Corviano Trebbiano d'Abruzzo 2024
description: A fresh, vibrant expression of Trebbiano d'Abruzzo from a young, family-run winery in the mountainous Tavo Valley. Owners Antonella di Tonno and Rodrigo Redmont tend 30 hectares of vineyards with a strong commitment to sustainability, crafting high-quality, affordable wines that showcase the region's unique terroir. This 2024 vintage delivers exceptional value at an approachable price point.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is bright and inviting, revealing intense aromas of ripe apples and peaches, complemented by notes of tangerine and citrus flowers. Delicate floral nuances add elegance, while subtle hints of white pepper and Mediterranean herbs provide complexity. The overall aromatic profile is fresh, racy, and immediately appealing.", "finish": "The finish is clean and persistent, bolstered by good weight and tangy tastiness that lingers pleasantly. The wine's bright acidity ensures a refreshing conclusion that leaves the palate invigorated and ready for the next sip.", "palate": "Light to medium-bodied with a lovely pithy texture of mineral and delicate extract, the palate showcases refreshing flavors of ripe apple and peach, balanced by tangy citrus notes of tangerine and lemon zest. The wine's bright acidity provides structure and vibrancy, while a gentle, tangy tastiness persists through the mid-palate. Subtle mineral notes—wet stones and saline—add textural interest and reinforce the wine's terroir-driven character."}

name: Collina San Ponzio Dolcetto D Alba 2020
description: A traditional Dolcetto from a century-old family vineyard in Barolo, representing Piedmont's beloved everyday wine. This approachable red showcases the varietal's characteristic fruit-forward profile with bright acidity and soft tannins, perfect for casual dining and early enjoyment.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet opens with vibrant red berry aromas - raspberry, red cherry, and wild strawberry - accented by subtle violet florals and baking spice. Hints of blackberry and blueberry add depth, while gentle rose petal notes provide elegance. The aromatic profile is straightforward yet charming, with touches of almond and spice emerging as the wine breathes.", "finish": "The finish is clean and moderately persistent, with lingering red fruit, subtle spice, and that telltale bitter almond note that marks quality Dolcetto. The conclusion is refreshing rather than heavy, inviting another glass.", "palate": "On the palate, this Dolcetto delivers exactly what Piedmont locals crave - plenty of juicy fruit with minimal tannin interference and refreshing acidity. Raspberry jam dominates the flavor spectrum, joined by red cherry, clove, and orange zest that add complexity and brightness. The wine shows deep fruity flavors balanced by a characteristic almond note on the mid-palate. The tannic texture is soft and approachable rather than grippy, making this supremely food-friendly. Nice acidity provides structure and makes the wine versatile across various dishes."}
foodPairings: ["Classic Piedmontese pasta dishes with meat ragù", "Margherita pizza or casual Italian fare", "Grilled sausages with peppers and onions", "Mushroom risotto or pasta with porcini", "Mild to medium-aged cheeses and antipasti platters"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting necessary; this wine is ready to enjoy immediately", "glassware": "Standard red wine glass or Burgundy-style glass", "temperature": "Serve slightly cool at 55-60°F (13-15°C) to emphasize freshness"}

name: Alella Barbabianco Vermut Blanco
description: A distinctive white vermouth from the Alella region near Barcelona, this aromatic fortified wine combines local white grape varieties with a carefully curated blend of Mediterranean botanicals. Barbabianco represents the Spanish tradition of blanc vermouth, offering a sophisticated aperitif experience with layers of herbal and citrus complexity.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Enticing aromatics of fresh citrus peel—lemon zest and bitter orange—mingle with fragrant chamomile flowers and delicate white florals. The botanical bouquet includes notes of cardamom, coriander, and a whisper of Mediterranean herbs like rosemary and marjoram. Subtle sweetness emerges with hints of honey and vanilla, balanced by gentle spice notes of clove and ginger.", "finish": "Clean and refreshing with lingering botanical complexity. The finish shows gentle bitterness from quinine and citrus peel, balanced by a touch of sweetness and aromatic herb notes. Cardamom and ginger spice persist on the aftertaste, leaving the palate cleansed and ready for food or another sip.", "palate": "Medium-bodied with a luscious, slightly viscous texture that coats the palate. The initial sweetness is immediately balanced by refreshing acidity and gentle bitter notes from the botanical infusion. Flavors of candied citrus, white grape, and stone fruit are interwoven with layers of aromatic spices—juniper, quinine, and warming cinnamon. The fortification provides structure without heaviness, while the herbal components add complexity and depth throughout the mid-palate."}

name: Paloma Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
description: A distinguished Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon from Paloma Vineyards, this 2019 vintage captures the essence of one of California's finest wine regions. Crafted from estate-grown fruit, this wine exemplifies the power, concentration, and elegance that have made Napa Cabernet world-renowned, with the 2019 vintage offering optimal ripeness and structure.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Opulent and layered nose showcasing ripe black currant, blackberry, and dark cherry alongside notes of crushed graphite, pencil lead, and cigar box. The bouquet reveals classic Napa hallmarks: eucalyptus, mint, and cedar from the region's distinctive terroir, interwoven with rich oak-derived notes of vanilla, sweet tobacco, and baking spices. Subtle violet and dark chocolate nuances add depth and complexity to this compelling aromatic profile.", "finish": "Long, persistent finish with layers of dark fruit, oak spice, and subtle mineral notes. The tannins are firm yet refined, with a chalky quality that suggests excellent aging potential. Notes of dark chocolate, tobacco, and mint linger on the aftertaste, inviting contemplation and another sip.", "palate": "Full-bodied and concentrated with a plush, velvety texture that exemplifies premium Napa Cabernet. The palate delivers intense flavors of cassis, black cherry, and ripe plum, supported by medium-high tannins that provide structure without harshness. Layers of complexity unfold with notes of dark chocolate, espresso, black pepper, and sweet oak-derived vanilla and toast. The wine shows excellent fruit concentration balanced by bright acidity that prevents any sense of heaviness. Alcohol is well-integrated at 13.5-14.5%, contributing to the wine's full body and richness while maintaining elegance and balance."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled ribeye or New York strip steak", "Braised short ribs with red wine reduction", "Roasted rack of lamb with herb crust", "Aged hard cheeses like aged cheddar or Parmigiano-Reggiano", "Wild mushroom and truffle dishes"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 1-2 hours to soften tannins and fully express the wine's complex aromatics", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux or Cabernet-specific glass to maximize aeration and aroma development", "temperature": "62-68°F (17-20°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Premium Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon", "region": "Napa Valley, California", "vintage": "2019", "ageability": "Drinking well now with decanting; excellent aging potential of 10-15+ years. Optimal drinking window 2025-2035.", "grapeVariety": "Cabernet Sauvignon (likely 85-100%), possibly with small amounts of Merlot or Cabernet Franc"}

name: Conde Valdemar Crianza 2019
description: A classic Rioja Crianza from Bodegas Valdemar, this wine exemplifies the traditional style of Rioja Alta and Alavesa. Aged 15 months in American oak barrels, it offers a harmonious balance between vibrant fruit and integrated oak influence, showcasing the quality of estate-grown Tempranillo with supporting varietals.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with intense aromas of black fruits, particularly ripe plum and blackberry, intertwined with well-integrated oak notes. Sweet spice characteristics emerge, including vanilla and cinnamon from the American oak aging, accompanied by subtle hints of licorice and dried herbs that add complexity to the aromatic profile.", "finish": "The finish is long and persistent, echoing the black fruit characteristics with lingering notes of sweet spices and licorice. The wine maintains its balance through to the end, leaving a pleasant impression of integrated oak and ripe fruit that invites another sip.", "palate": "On the palate, this wine is fleshy and full of flavor, delivering excellent balance between fruit concentration and oak integration. The entry is smooth and pleasant with a fresh quality that maintains vibrancy. Flavors of black fruit dominate, supported by spice notes and touches of tobacco, while the tannin structure remains firm yet approachable, providing framework without overwhelming the fruit."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled ribeye steak with chimichurri", "Beef short ribs braised in red wine", "Wood-fired pizza with chorizo and peppers", "Manchego and aged sheep's milk cheeses", "Mushroom risotto with truffle oil"]

name: Alfaro Family Vineyards Estate Pinot Noir 2023
description: A vibrant, coastal-style Pinot Noir from Alfaro Family Vineyards' estate in California's Central Coast region. This young wine showcases the fresh, fruit-forward character and elegance that California's cool-climate regions can achieve with Pinot Noir. The 2023 vintage captures bright fruit purity and the distinctive terroir of the estate's maritime-influenced vineyards.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Bright and expressive aromatics bursting with fresh red fruit: ripe cherry, red raspberry, and wild strawberry dominate the nose. Delicate floral notes of rose petals and violet add elegance, while subtle hints of crushed herbs, forest floor, and baking spices provide complexity. Light oak influence contributes gentle notes of vanilla and sweet toast. The overall impression is youthful, fresh, and inviting, with the purity of fruit shining through.", "finish": "Medium-length finish with lingering red fruit, subtle spice, and gentle tannins. The bright acidity leaves the palate refreshed and cleansed, while notes of cherry, rose, and subtle earth persist. The finish is clean and vibrant, inviting another sip.", "palate": "Light to medium-bodied with a silky, elegant texture and fine-grained tannins that caress the palate. The wine delivers concentrated red fruit flavors—cherry compote, red raspberry, and cranberry—supported by vibrant acidity that keeps the wine lively and refreshing. Subtle earthy notes of mushroom and tea leaves add depth without overwhelming the bright fruit character. The maritime influence shows in a mineral quality and bright freshness, while light oak aging contributes whispers of vanilla, clove, and Coca-Cola. The mouthfeel is graceful and refined, with 12-13.5% alcohol maintaining balance and elegance."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled salmon with herbs", "Roasted duck breast with cherry sauce", "Mushroom risotto or pasta", "Herb-roasted chicken", "Soft, creamy cheeses like Brie or Camembert"]

name: Julie & Toby Bainbridge Highway 8 2022     Partial cs!
Coste Caumartin Haut Cotes de Beaune 2021
description: A classic Burgundian Pinot Noir from Domaine Coste-Caumartin, a family estate cultivating vineyards in Pommard since 1793. This wine from the Hautes-Côtes de Beaune appellation reflects over two centuries of winemaking tradition, crafted from sustainably farmed vineyards (HVE certified since 2019) across the family's 13 hectares in Pommard, Saint-Romain, and Beaune.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose displays classic Burgundian Pinot Noir character with bright red fruit aromas of cherry, raspberry, and cranberry. Subtle earthy notes reminiscent of forest floor and mushroom add complexity, while delicate floral hints of violet and rose petal provide elegance. The cooler climate and higher elevation of the Hautes-Côtes de Beaune contribute to a fresher, more delicate aromatic profile compared to Côte de Beaune village wines, with hints of spice and mineral notes emerging as the wine opens.", "finish": "The finish is clean and persistent with lingering red fruit flavors and a touch of mineral salinity. The wine's refined tannins and bright acidity ensure a refreshing finish that invites another sip, while subtle earthy notes provide complexity on the aftertaste.", "palate": "On the palate, this wine shows the elegance and finesse typical of well-made Burgundy, with silky tannins and vibrant acidity framing flavors of red cherry, strawberry, and pomegranate. The wine has medium body with excellent balance, displaying purity of fruit without excessive oak influence. Subtle savory notes of herbs and earth add depth and complexity, while the natural acidity keeps the palate fresh and lively. The high environmental value (HVE) farming practices contribute to the wine's transparent expression of terroir."}

name: Coste Caumartin 1er Cru Rouge Les Chouacheaux 2019
description: A distinguished Premier Cru red Burgundy from the esteemed Beaune appellation, produced by Domaine Coste-Caumartin. This historic estate, with roots dating back to the time of the Dukes of Burgundy, is now managed by Jerome and Benoit Sordet who balance traditional Burgundian techniques with modern precision.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with classic Burgundian Pinot Noir aromatics of red cherry, raspberry, and wild strawberry, complemented by delicate floral notes of violet and rose petal. As the wine breathes, earthy notes of forest floor, mushroom, and subtle truffle emerge, along with hints of sweet spice including cinnamon and clove. The aromatic profile reflects the Premier Cru vineyard's limestone-rich terroir.", "finish": "The finish is long and graceful with lingering red fruit, earth, and spice notes. The wine's fine tannins and bright acidity carry through to the end, leaving an impression of elegance and terroir expression.", "palate": "The palate is elegant and refined, showcasing red fruit flavors of cherry and cranberry supported by fine-grained tannins that provide structure without heaviness. Flavors of earth, dried herbs, and subtle oak spice add complexity, while the wine's bright acidity provides energy and lift. The mouthfeel is silky and persistent, with a mineral quality that speaks to the Beaune terroir."}
foodPairings: ["Coq au vin or other classic Burgundian preparations", "Roasted duck breast with cherry sauce", "Grilled salmon with herbs and butter", "Mushroom risotto with Parmesan", "Aged Comté or Gruyère cheese"]

Costers Del Segre Petit Sios Blanco 2024
description: An explosive and aromatic organic white wine from Bodegas Costers del Sió in Catalonia. This fresh young blend of Viognier, Chardonnay, and Muscat showcases the estate's commitment to organic farming, delivering intense aromatics and pleasant texture from vineyards at 310 meters elevation in the Costers del Segre DO.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Explosive on the nose with vibrant aromatics that immediately captivate. Pleasant notes of fresh Muscat grapes lead the way, followed by exotic fruits including lychee, mango, and passion fruit. White flower aromatics - orange blossom and honeysuckle - add an elegant floral dimension, all wrapped in a gentle freshness that keeps the wine lifted and inviting. Subtle hints of stone fruit and citrus add complexity.", "finish": "The finish is fresh and fruity with lingering exotic fruit flavors and floral notes. A gentle mineral edge adds definition, while the wine's balanced acidity leaves the palate refreshed.", "palate": "Intense and flavorful on the palate with a pleasant, almost creamy texture from the Viognier component. The wine is fresh and smooth with balanced acidity that supports rather than dominates. Flavors of ripe white peach, apricot, and tropical fruits are complemented by citrus notes and a subtle minerality. The Chardonnay adds structure and body, while the Muscat provides distinctive grape and floral character. Despite its intensity, the wine remains direct and uncomplicated, making it accessible and enjoyable."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled prawns with garlic and herbs", "Thai green curry with chicken", "Soft fresh cheeses like burrata", "Seared scallops with citrus beurre blanc", "Vietnamese spring rolls with nuoc cham"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed; the wine's fresh character is best enjoyed immediately", "glassware": "Medium white wine glass to concentrate the aromatic intensity", "temperature": "8-10°C (46-50°F) - well chilled"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Aromatic, fresh, organically farmed white wine", "region": "Costers del Segre DO, Catalonia, Spain", "vintage": "2024", "ageability": "Best enjoyed young to preserve fruit and freshness. Drinking window: 2024-2026.", "grapeVariety": "Blend of Viognier, Chardonnay, and Muscat"}

name: Costers del Segre Petit Sios Tinto 2021
description: A vibrant young red from Catalonia's Costers del Segre DO, crafted by Bodegas Costers del Sió. This approachable blend combines classic Spanish varietals with French influence, offering fruit-forward charm with subtle oak integration from four months in used French barrels.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet presents bright red berry aromas with emphasis on fresh strawberry and red cherry. Subtle undertones of Mediterranean herbs, including thyme and rosemary, emerge alongside gentle spice notes from the oak aging. A touch of violet and crushed rose petal adds floral complexity to the fruit-driven profile.", "finish": "A fresh, direct finish with lingering red fruit and a whisper of spice. The wine's youthful energy and balanced acidity create a clean, refreshing conclusion that makes it highly versatile at the table.", "palate": "The wine enters with lively acidity and medium body, showcasing the blend's harmonious composition of Tempranillo's structure, Cabernet Sauvignon's depth, and Grenache's red fruit exuberance. Flavors of ripe cherry, raspberry, and hints of blackberry dominate, while background notes of vanilla, cinnamon, and toasted oak provide subtle complexity. The texture is smooth and approachable with soft, integrated tannins."}

name: Crosarola Ripasso 2017
description: A distinguished Valpolicella Ripasso showcasing the unique 'repassed' winemaking technique that adds depth and complexity to classic Venetian reds. This wine bridges the gap between traditional Valpolicella and powerful Amarone, offering enhanced structure and rich flavors. An excellent introduction to this prestigious style.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet is complex and inviting with aromas of dried cherries, black plum, and raisined fruit from the ripasso process. Notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and sweet tobacco emerge alongside hints of leather and dried herbs. Subtle balsamic and spice notes add complexity, while integrated oak contributes vanilla and cedar nuances.", "finish": "The finish is long and evolving with persistent dark fruit and savory notes. Layers of leather, tobacco, and spice linger beautifully, while the wine's tannic grip and slight bitterness (in the best sense) add complexity. The conclusion is rich yet balanced, showcasing the distinctive character that makes Ripasso special.", "palate": "Full-bodied with impressive depth and concentration. The palate delivers flavors of sour cherry, blackberry, and fig, enriched by the secondary fermentation on Amarone pomace. Mid-palate richness reveals dark cocoa, dried fruit, and a distinctive tar-like character. Firm yet polished tannins provide excellent structure, while elevated alcohol adds warmth and weight without overwhelming balance."}
foodPairings: ["Braised beef short ribs with polenta", "Wild mushroom risotto with aged Parmigiano", "Osso buco alla Milanese", "Aged Pecorino Romano or Grana Padano", "Duck breast with cherry reduction"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 45-60 minutes to fully express the wine's complex aromatics and soften tannins", "glassware": "Large Burgundy-style glass or universal wine glass", "temperature": "62-65°F (17-18°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Full-bodied red, 'repassed' style with enhanced complexity", "region": "Valpolicella Ripasso DOC, Veneto, Italy", "vintage": "2017", "ageability": "Drinking beautifully now through 2027. The ripasso technique provides structure for medium-term aging; peak 2024-2026", "grapeVariety": "Blend of Corvina, Rondinella, and Molinara"}

name: Stel + Mar Andrew Cabernet Sauvignon (DC/MD Only) 2023
description: A young, vibrant Cabernet Sauvignon exclusively available in the DC/MD market, this wine showcases fresh fruit character and modern winemaking. The 2023 vintage is incredibly recent, offering primary fruit flavors and accessibility while maintaining Cabernet's structural backbone. Stel + Mar's Andrew bottling represents approachable premium Cabernet designed for near-term enjoyment.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Fresh and exuberant nose bursting with youthful Cabernet character: ripe blackcurrant, fresh blackberry, and dark cherry lead the way, supported by notes of cassis and red plum. The aromatic profile shows bright fruit purity with subtle hints of green bell pepper and fresh herbs that indicate youth and varietal authenticity. Light oak influence contributes gentle vanilla, cedar, and sweet toast notes. A whisper of violet and dark chocolate adds intrigue to this vivacious bouquet.", "finish": "Medium-length finish with persistent dark fruit and gentle tannins. Notes of blackberry, vanilla, and subtle oak spice linger, with a touch of fresh herbs on the aftertaste. The finish is clean and youthful, with refreshing acidity leaving the palate ready for food or another sip.", "palate": "Medium to full-bodied with juicy, approachable fruit and moderate tannins that provide structure without astringency. The wine delivers concentrated flavors of blackberry, black cherry, and cassis, with bright acidity maintaining freshness and vitality throughout. Oak aging adds layers of vanilla, mocha, and baking spices, while subtle notes of tobacco, cedar, and graphite hint at classic Cabernet complexity. The tannins are present but soft, suggesting some oak maturation to round out the wine's texture. The alcohol (likely 13.5-14%) is well-integrated, supporting the fruit concentration. Despite its youth, the wine shows good balance and drinkability."}

name: Dogwood & Thistle Pinot Noir 2021
description: Dogwood & Thistle crafts elegant, terroir-driven Pinot Noir that showcases the variety's delicate character and regional expression. The 2021 vintage represents modern cool-climate winemaking, balancing fruit purity with structural complexity. This wine demonstrates the producer's commitment to minimal intervention and expressing the unique character of their vineyard sites.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents a captivating array of red fruit aromas, featuring bright cherry, fresh raspberry, and wild strawberry alongside floral notes of rose petal and violet. Subtle earthy elements of mushroom, forest floor, and wet stone add depth and intrigue. Delicate spice notes of cinnamon and white pepper emerge with air, along with hints of cranberry and pomegranate. The aromatics display the purity and precision characteristic of well-made cool-climate Pinot Noir, with beautiful clarity and intensity.", "finish": "The finish is long and refined, with persistent red fruit notes, fine-grained tannins, and a distinctive mineral quality. Subtle spice and floral notes linger elegantly, while the wine's fresh acidity provides lift and ensures a clean conclusion. This is a beautifully crafted Pinot Noir that captures the variety's essential character with precision and grace.", "palate": "On the palate, the wine reveals medium body with silky tannins and vibrant acidity that energizes the fruit. Flavors of tart cherry, red currant, and raspberry are complemented by notes of rhubarb, black tea, and subtle oak-derived spice. The texture is refined and elegant, with a core of minerality that adds tension and complexity. The wine's balance is exemplary, with fruit intensity matched by structural elements that provide both immediate appeal and aging potential. Savory undertones of dried herbs and earth add complexity without overwhelming the delicate fruit character."}
foodPairings: ["Seared duck breast with cherry reduction", "Grilled wild salmon with herbs", "Mushroom and gruyère tart", "Roasted chicken with thyme and lemon", "Soft-ripened cheeses like Brie and Camembert"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Allow 30-40 minutes of breathing time to reveal the wine's full aromatic complexity", "glassware": "Burgundy glass with generous bowl to capture delicate aromatics", "temperature": "58-62°F (14-17°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Cool-Climate Pinot Noir with Elegant Structure", "region": "Likely Oregon Willamette Valley or similar cool-climate region", "vintage": "2021", "ageability": "Drinking beautifully now through 2028-2030. The wine has excellent structure for 5-8 years of cellaring, during which it will develop additional earthy complexity while maintaining its core fruit character.", "grapeVariety": "100% Pinot Noir"}

name: Dogwood & Thistle Cavalier Cuvee Pinot Noir (Private Label) 2021
description: A California Pinot Noir from Dogwood & Thistle, showcasing the producer's expertise with this delicate variety. While the specific "Cavalier Cuvee" designation appears to be a private label selection, Dogwood & Thistle is known for producing elegant, terroir-focused Pinot Noirs from coastal California vineyards.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with bright red cherry complemented by warm baking spices including nutmeg and hints of cola. Delicate notes of English rose petals add a floral dimension, while a pleasant wild character pushes the fruit toward herbal aromas that skew towards bay leaf. Both red and black cherries mingle, creating a savory, complex aromatic profile.", "finish": "Long, mouth-quenching, and elegant, the finish demonstrates the wine's poise and refinement. The fruit lingers with subtle spice notes and a mineral thread that extends the conclusion gracefully.", "palate": "On the palate, concentrated red cherry fruit dominates with accents of wild mountain red berries creating a vibrant, energetic core. Earthier notes of dried mushrooms and crushed stone emerge mid-palate, adding complexity and depth. The texture is creamy yet maintains a dried cranberry crispness that provides structure and definition to the fruit."}

Oceano Chardonnay 2021
description: A vibrant coastal Chardonnay from Spanish Springs Vineyard in the San Luis Obispo Coast AVA, located just 1.5 miles from the Pacific Ocean. Made from clones 809, 17, and 96, this wine was fermented and aged for 9 months in 228L French oak barrels, producing only 537 cases and earning a 92+ rating from Jancisrobinson.com.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents enticing aromas of lemon curd and sea air with a hint of grapefruit and jasmine, creating a distinctly maritime character. Additional layers reveal bright gardenias, white peach, lime zest, and quince, complemented by subtle notes of green mango and wildflower honey. The aromatic profile perfectly captures the wine's cool-climate coastal origins.", "finish": "The finish features delightful dryness with persistent lemon pith-and-peel notes and a slightly silky texture from the barrel aging. The maritime salinity and mineral edge linger pleasantly, providing a crisp, clean conclusion that invites another sip.", "palate": "Bright and stony flavors of lemon pith and lemon oil dominate the palate, enhanced by yellow herbs and a fresh nectarine attack. The mid-palate unfolds with juicy notes of apricot, grapefruit, kiwi, and tangerine, all supported by superb acidity that provides structure and refreshment. The rocky limestone terroir expresses itself through pronounced minerality and chalky texture."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled Pacific halibut with citrus beurre blanc", "Dungeness crab salad with avocado", "Seared scallops with brown butter", "Chicken piccata with capers", "Fresh oysters on the half shell"]

name: Domaine Benedetti Biologique Vaucluse 2022
description: An organic red wine from Vaucluse in southeastern France, produced by a domain certified in organic agriculture since 2000. This elegant blend of Merlot, Cinsault, and Syrah represents excellent value and showcases the aromatic richness of the southern Rhône terroir.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Captivating cherry red color introduces an aromatic nose of great richness. Fresh blackberry and wild berry fruits dominate, enhanced by classic Provençal garrigue herbs—thyme, lavender, and wild rosemary. Delicate violet florals add elegance, while subtle licorice and sweet spice notes from Syrah contribute complexity. Hints of cocoa and dark chocolate round out the bouquet.", "finish": "Medium-length finish with lingering wild berries, violet, and subtle spice. Soft tannins and bright acidity leave the palate refreshed.", "palate": "Elegant and approachable with excellent balance between fruit, structure, and freshness. The palate echoes the nose with wild fruits, blackberry, and garrigue herbal notes. Medium body provides satisfying weight without heaviness. The Merlot contributes roundness, Cinsault adds bright red fruit and freshness, while Syrah provides structure and spice. Aromatic richness carries through from start to finish."}
foodPairings: ["Herbes de Provence lamb chops", "Ratatouille", "Grilled sausages with lentils", "Beef bourguignon", "Medium-aged Comté cheese"]

name: Dogwood & Thistle Shenandoah White Blend 2022
description: An artisanal white blend from Virginia's Shenandoah Valley that showcases the region's terroir through a harmonious marriage of complementary varietals. This thoughtfully crafted 2022 vintage demonstrates the winery's commitment to creating distinctive wines that reflect both place and winemaking vision.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents an elegant tapestry of orchard fruits, with ripe pear and golden apple taking center stage. Delicate floral notes of acacia blossom and honeysuckle weave through the fruit, while subtle hints of toasted almonds and wet stone add depth. A gentle kiss of vanilla suggests judicious oak contact that enhances rather than dominates the aromatic profile.", "finish": "Medium-length finish with persistent fruit and a refreshing mineral quality. Subtle hints of baking spice and citrus zest linger, complemented by bright acidity that cleanses the palate beautifully.", "palate": "On the palate, the wine shows beautiful balance between fruit richness and refreshing acidity. Flavors of Bartlett pear, yellow apple, and white nectarine unfold gracefully, supported by a creamy mid-palate texture. Mineral notes provide structure and lift, while integrated oak lends subtle complexity without heaviness. The blend's components work in seamless harmony, creating a wine greater than the sum of its parts."}
foodPairings: ["Roasted chicken with herbs and root vegetables", "Lobster risotto with saffron", "Grilled halibut with citrus beurre blanc", "Creamy butternut squash soup", "Aged Gruyère and fig chutney"]

name: Dolce Vita Spritz NV
description: An Italian-inspired aperitivo-style sparkling wine cocktail that captures the essence of la dolce vita. This ready-to-serve spritz combines aromatic herbs, bitter citrus, and effervescent wine in a perfectly balanced blend that evokes the cafe culture of Venice and Milan.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet opens with bright, zesty citrus notes dominated by pink grapefruit, blood orange, and bitter orange peel. Aromatic herbs including gentian, wormwood, and subtle botanical spices add complexity, while floral hints of chamomile and elderflower provide elegance. The aromatic profile is vibrant and inviting, with a pleasant bitter-sweet balance.", "finish": "The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering citrus and herbal notes. The bubbles fade gently, leaving a pleasant bitter-sweet conclusion that stimulates the palate and appetite, true to the aperitivo tradition.", "palate": "Lightly carbonated with a refreshing effervescence, the palate delivers crisp citrus flavors of grapefruit, mandarin, and orange zest. The wine base provides body and structure, while the aperitivo blend contributes pleasant bitterness balanced by soft vanilla sweetness. Herbal notes of rhubarb, cinchona bark, and botanical spices weave through the citrus core, creating a sophisticated yet approachable flavor profile with mellow, not aggressive, bitterness."}
foodPairings: ["Antipasto platter with olives and cured meats", "Bruschetta with tomato and basil", "Light seafood appetizers", "Parmigiano-Reggiano and prosciutto", "Citrus-marinated shrimp"]

name: Domaine Borgeot Bourgogne Chardonnay 2022
description: A classic Bourgogne Chardonnay from the village level tier, showcasing the terroir-driven character that Burgundy is renowned for. Crafted from 100% Chardonnay grapes grown in Burgundy's limestone-rich soils, this wine exemplifies the elegant, mineral-focused style of the region with restrained oak influence.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with bright citrus aromas of lemon zest and green apple, intertwined with delicate white flower notes of acacia and honeysuckle. Subtle hints of wet stone and chalk emerge, reflecting the limestone terroir, while a gentle touch of vanilla and toasted hazelnut adds complexity from carefully measured oak aging. Fresh and inviting, the aromatics speak to the wine's youthful vitality and classic Burgundian restraint.", "finish": "The finish is clean and persistent, with lingering citrus acidity and chalky minerality that refresh the palate. A whisper of toasted oak and white pepper appears on the tail, encouraging another sip. This is a food-friendly wine built for near-term enjoyment over the next 2-4 years.", "palate": "Medium-bodied with vibrant acidity that drives the palate forward, revealing layers of crisp Granny Smith apple, Meyer lemon, and white peach. The mid-palate shows impressive mineral tension with flinty, saline notes characteristic of Burgundy's chalky soils, balanced by creamy texture from partial malolactic fermentation. Flavors of blanched almond and subtle butter add richness without overwhelming the wine's essential freshness and purity of fruit."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled sea bass with herb butter", "Roasted chicken with lemon and thyme", "Goat cheese salad with walnuts", "Scallops in white wine sauce", "Mushroom risotto"]

name: Domaine Benedetti Cotes du Rhone Vielles Vignes 2021
description: An organically grown Côtes du Rhône from vines over 45 years old planted on clay-limestone soils. This 2021 vintage earned 91/100 from critics and exemplifies the gourmand intensity and fresh character that Domaine Benedetti achieves from their old vine holdings in this classic Southern Rhône appellation.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet opens with a beautiful perfume of summer flowers and sour cherries, immediately inviting and expressive. Dark garnet with purple hues in appearance, the nose reveals sweet plum and red berry aromas intertwined with appealing floral notes. Black fruit characteristics emerge, particularly cherry and cassis, creating a layered aromatic profile that balances freshness with ripeness.", "finish": "Velvety and supple with excellent length. The red and black berry flavors persist through a long conclusion, supported by fine tannins and bright, lifting acidity that ensures a clean, elegant finish with staying power.", "palate": "Ample medium to full-bodied palate with impressive volume and texture. Crushed red berries dominate the flavor profile, supported by sweet plum and black cherry notes. Fine-grained tannins provide excellent structure and grip, while fresh acidity deftly lifts the wine and maintains energy throughout. Mild herbal spiciness weaves through the fruit, adding complexity without overwhelming. The clay-limestone terroir contributes well-kept freshness and a textured quality that gives the wine personality and distinction."}

name: Domaine Chevallier Cuvee Prestige 2022
description: A distinguished Rhône Valley blend from Domaine Chevallier, the Cuvée Prestige represents the estate's top selection from their finest vineyard parcels. This wine showcases the rich, sun-drenched character of Southern Rhône wines with depth, complexity, and the garrigue-influenced terroir that defines the region.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose reveals an opulent bouquet of ripe dark cherry, blackberry, and plum, interwoven with the classic Rhône Valley aromatics of lavender, thyme, and dried herbs de Provence. Notes of black olive, leather, and cracked black pepper add savory complexity, while hints of violet, star anise, and sweet tobacco emerge with aeration. A subtle smokiness and touch of game round out this multifaceted aromatic profile.", "finish": "The finish is long and satisfying, with persistent dark fruit and savory herb notes. Hints of black pepper, licorice, and roasted meat linger, accompanied by fine-grained tannins that promise good aging potential while remaining smooth and integrated.", "palate": "Full-bodied and richly concentrated, the palate delivers waves of dark fruit flavors including blackberry, black cherry, and cassis, supported by layers of complexity. Savory elements of roasted meat, tapenade, and dried Mediterranean herbs intermingle with the fruit, creating a compelling interplay. The wine's tannins are firm yet ripe, providing structure for aging while remaining approachable. Notes of garrigue, leather, and sweet spice from oak aging add depth, while the wine maintains balance through moderate acidity and excellent fruit concentration."}
foodPairings: ["Braised lamb shanks with rosemary and garlic", "Beef daube Provençale with olives and herbs", "Grilled lamb chops with tapenade", "Duck confit with wild mushrooms", "Aged Comté or Manchego cheese"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 1 hour to fully express aromatics and soften tannins", "glassware": "Large Rhône or Burgundy-style glass to capture complexity", "temperature": "62-66°F (17-19°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Full-bodied Southern Rhône red blend", "region": "Côtes du Rhône, France", "vintage": "2022", "ageability": "Drink now through 2032; excellent cellaring potential", "grapeVariety": "Grenache, Syrah, Mourvèdre blend (typical GSM)"}

name: Domaine Nakajima Pétillant Rosé 2024             Partial cs!
Les Brebis Willamette Pinot Noir 2023
description: A vibrant expression of Oregon's Willamette Valley Pinot Noir from the small, family-run Les Brebis winery ("breu-BEE"), whose name references the Shaffer family's German heritage meaning "shepherd." Produced from sustainably farmed vineyards in the Eola-Amity Hills AVA and South Salem Hills, this wine is fermented in small lots with native yeast, aged in French oak barrels without chips, and bottled unfiltered without fining agents.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with vibrant ripe red berry aromas, particularly dark cherry and cranberry, characteristic of premium Willamette Valley Pinot Noir. Subtle earthy undertones emerge, along with a touch of forest floor and delicate spice notes that speak to the organic and biodynamic farming practices. Light floral hints add elegance to the aromatic profile.", "finish": "The finish is clean and persistent, with the red fruit flavors continuing alongside subtle earthy notes. The unfiltered, unfined bottling provides natural texture and authenticity, allowing the wine's true character to shine through the final moments.", "palate": "On the palate, everything you want from Willamette Pinot is present: juicy dark cherry flavors mingle with bright cranberry and hints of raspberry. A little spice from the oak aging adds complexity without overwhelming the pure fruit expression. The earthiness detected on the nose carries through, providing depth and terroir expression, while maintaining the characteristic silky texture of quality Oregon Pinot Noir."}
foodPairings: ["Wild salmon with herb butter", "Roasted duck breast with cherry reduction", "Mushroom and gruyère tart", "Herb-roasted chicken with root vegetables", "Truffle mac and cheese"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Optional brief decanting of 15-20 minutes to aerate; native yeast fermentation benefits from air exposure", "glassware": "Burgundy-style glass with wide bowl", "temperature": "58-62°F (14-17°C), slightly cool cellar temperature"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Organic/Biodynamic Oregon Pinot Noir, native yeast fermentation", "region": "Willamette Valley (Eola-Amity Hills AVA and South Salem Hills), Oregon", "vintage": "2023", "ageability": "Drink now through 2028; best enjoyed within 5 years to preserve fresh fruit character", "grapeVariety": "100% Pinot Noir"}

name: Domaine de la Denante Bourgogne Pinot Noir 2023
description: A classic Bourgogne Rouge showcasing the approachable side of Burgundian Pinot Noir, with the characteristic richness and earthy complexity that defines the region. This wine offers authentic Burgundian character at an accessible price point, demonstrating balanced fruit expression with subtle terroir influence.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The wine presents a rich garnet color, revealing appealing aromas of grilled plum, blackberry, and integrated baking spices. Notes of dark cherry emerge alongside subtle hints of bramble fruit, while a gentle earthiness adds complexity. The aromatic profile suggests ripe fruit balanced by classic Burgundian restraint.", "finish": "The finish extends gracefully with slightly earthy notes persisting alongside dark fruit flavors. Black plum skin tannins provide grip without astringency, while subtle spice notes linger. The conclusion is balanced and food-friendly, inviting pairing with classic Burgundian cuisine.", "palate": "Round and graceful on the palate, the wine delivers concentrated flavors of dark cherry, blueberry, and bramble berries. The texture is smooth and inviting, with black plum skin tannins providing structure without heaviness. Earthy elements characteristic of Burgundy emerge on the mid-palate, adding dimension to the fruit-forward core. The wine shows medium body with well-integrated oak influence."}

name: Bodegas Riojanas Monte Real Reserva 2015
description: A traditional Rioja Reserva from one of the region's most respected historic producers, Bodegas Riojanas. This wine embodies classic Rioja characteristics with extended oak aging, showcasing the elegance and complexity that has made Rioja famous worldwide.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "A solid nose common to Rioja opens with earthy berry fruits, dried leaves, and olives that speak to traditional aging. The aromatic profile includes cherries and leather with a touch of smoke, creating layers of complexity. Spices emerge including pepper, sage, and vanilla from oak influence. Less sour cherry than many Riojas at this price point, with darker, riper fruit character.", "finish": "Amazingly complex finish that evolves and develops with each sip. Dark cherry and plum flavors persist alongside spicy oak notes and hints of leather. The acidity provides lift and length, while the smooth tannins ensure a polished, refined conclusion. The wine leaves a lasting impression of classic Rioja character.", "palate": "The palate is punchy with screechy acidity that offers flavors of plum and currant touched up by oaky vanilla. Smooth texture is complemented by a bit of chocolate that adds richness and depth. Over time, the wine fleshes out dramatically, becoming downright succulent with air exposure. The integration of fruit, oak, and acidity creates exceptional harmony for the price point."}
foodPairings: ["Roasted leg of lamb with garlic", "Grilled Ibérico pork chops", "Mushroom and truffle risotto", "Aged sheep's milk cheese", "Beef tenderloin with red wine reduction"]

name: Domaine des Perrelles Moulin a Vent 2020
description: From the prestigious Moulin-à-Vent cru in Beaujolais, Domaine des Perrelles crafts this exceptional Gamay from 60+ year-old vines. Produced by the Perrachon family, this wine represents the power and structure that Moulin-à-Vent is famous for, earning its nickname as the 'King of Beaujolais' for wines that can age gracefully like fine Burgundy.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The wine presents a deep ruby color with captivating aromatics of red fruit compote, featuring ripe cherry and wild strawberry. Classic Beaujolais floral notes of iris and faded rose emerge delicately, adding elegance to the fruit-forward profile. Subtle earthy undertones provide depth, while hints of violet and fresh peach create an intoxicating, complex bouquet. The 12 months of oak foudre aging contributes gentle spice notes without overwhelming the wine's natural aromatics.", "finish": "The finish reveals discreet, pleasant tannins that provide structure without astringency. Quite complex, the wine lingers with flavors of red fruit, earth, and delicate spice. The refined tannin structure and persistent minerality create a sophisticated, age-worthy conclusion that distinguishes this from lighter Beaujolais styles.", "palate": "Round and well-structured on the palate, this wine showcases the power that defines Moulin-à-Vent. Concentrated flavors of succulent stone fruits and ripe cherries form the core, framed by vibrant acidity and earthy minerality. The texture is wonderfully structured with soft, delectable tannins that wrap around the fruit. Licorice and floral notes add complexity, while the old vines contribute depth and concentration. At 13% alcohol, the wine maintains balance and drinkability despite its intensity."}
foodPairings: ["Coq au vin with pearl onions and mushrooms", "Roasted chicken with herbs de Provence", "Grilled salmon with tarragon butter", "Mushroom and truffle risotto", "Soft-ripened cheeses like Camembert or Brie"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 30-45 minutes to allow the wine to breathe and tannins to soften", "glassware": "Burgundy glass or standard red wine glass", "temperature": "55-60°F (13-15°C), lightly chilled"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Structured, age-worthy Beaujolais cru", "region": "Moulin-à-Vent, Beaujolais, France", "vintage": "2020", "ageability": "Drink now through 2030. This wine has the structure to age gracefully for 5-10 years, developing tertiary complexity while maintaining its fruit character.", "grapeVariety": "100% Gamay from 60+ year-old vines"}

name: Maison Ogier Vacqueyras 2023
description: A distinguished Southern Rhône red from Maison Ogier, one of the historic houses of Châteauneuf-du-Pape. This Vacqueyras showcases the power and elegance of wines from this elevated appellation, blending traditional Rhône varieties with precision and finesse.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents a harmonious blend of ripe red and black fruits characteristic of the Southern Rhône. Expect aromas of dark cherries, blackberries, and plums complemented by the classic garrigue notes of the region including wild herbs, lavender, and Mediterranean scrubland. Subtle spicy elements add complexity to the aromatic profile.", "finish": "The finish maintains the wine's balance between power and elegance, with lingering fruit flavors complemented by peppery spice. The tannins are fine-grained and well-integrated, providing structure for aging while remaining approachable in youth. Notes of wild herbs return on the finish, creating a sense of place and terroir.", "palate": "Generous and direct on the palate with excellent balance between spicy notes and the freshness of the fruit. Well-structured yet delicate tannins provide framework without overwhelming the wine's inherent elegance. The 2023 vintage shows the youthful vigor expected from a recent release, with vibrant fruit flavors of dark berries and cherries supported by integrated oak influence."}

name: Pomar Junction Sidetrack Red 2023
description: A proprietary red blend from Pomar Junction Vineyard & Winery, crafted to highlight the unique El Pomar District of Paso Robles. This family-owned estate practices sustainable farming (SIP Certified) in vineyards blessed with distinctive limestone soils and cooling Templeton Gap breezes. The blend typically features 43% Merlot, 31% Cabernet Sauvignon, and 26% Syrah, though proportions may vary by vintage.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The wine displays a brilliant, deep, rich color and opens with wonderful aromas of ripe plums and blueberries. Dark red roses add a floral complexity, while rich caramel notes suggest careful oak integration. The aromatic profile is immediately inviting and speaks to the wine's generous, approachable style.", "finish": "The finish is food-friendly and approachable, with the luscious berry and chocolate notes persisting alongside subtle spice. The limestone terroir contributes a mineral backbone that keeps the wine from being overly heavy, despite its generous fruit profile.", "palate": "Luscious berry flavors dominate the palate, showcasing the ripe fruit character of Paso Robles. Dark chocolate notes emerge mid-palate, adding depth and richness to the berry core. Warm baking spices from oak aging provide complexity without overwhelming the fruit, while the perfect amount of oak integration ensures balance and structure throughout."}
