name: Domaine Du Fossile Rouge 2023
description: A fresh, vibrant Loire Valley red from Chinon, made from Cabernet Franc. This wine expresses the terroir of the Loire with its characteristic balance of fruit, earth, and herbaceous complexity. Designed for near-term enjoyment, it captures the essence of young, juicy Loire reds.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose bursts with notes of blackberry and raspberry bramble, mingling with the scent of freshly turned soil and savory herbs. Classic Cabernet Franc aromatics emerge with violet and graphite, while subtle green peppercorn and tobacco leaf add complexity. The earthy, herb-driven character speaks to the wine's Loire origins and cool-climate expression.", "finish": "The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering red fruit and herbal notes. Bright acidity carries the flavors through to a crisp conclusion, leaving the palate ready for another sip or the next bite of food.", "palate": "Juicy and vibrant on the palate, the wine showcases bright red fruit supported by supple, silky tannins that provide structure without weight. Red currant and cranberry flavors mingle with earthy undertones of forest floor and dried herbs. The texture is refreshing and energetic, with medium body and fine-grained tannins creating an approachable, food-friendly profile that epitomizes drinkable Loire Cabernet Franc."}

name: Bodegas Riojanas Vina Albina Gran Reserva 2017
description: A prestigious Gran Reserva from Bodegas Riojanas, one of the historic houses that has written the history of Rioja with capital letters. Founded in 1890 in Cenicero by the Artacho family along with Rafael Carreras, this wine represents the culmination of traditional Rioja winemaking with 30 months in American oak barrels and a minimum of two years bottle aging before release. The 2017 vintage earned a Silver Medal at Rioja Masters and a 92/100 critics score.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Elegant on the nose with well-blended aromas that showcase the harmony between extended oak aging and varietal character. Ruby-red fruit notes of cherry and raspberry mingle with hints of vanilla, coconut, and sweet tobacco from the American oak. Subtle leather, dried fig, and earthy undertones add complexity, while a touch of balsamic and forest floor speaks to the wine's maturity.", "finish": "The finish is long and refined, with the polished tannins continuing to provide elegance. Notes of tobacco, vanilla, and dried red fruit persist, while the excellent balance between fruit, oak, and acidity ensures a harmonious conclusion. This is classic Rioja Gran Reserva at its finest.", "palate": "Very fine and well-structured in the mouth, the wine reveals the benefits of late harvest and slight over-ripening of the grapes. Good acidity provides backbone and freshness despite the wine's richness, while polished tannins offer structure without harshness. The blend of 80% Tempranillo, 15% Mazuela, and 5% Graciano creates layers of red fruit, spice, leather, and vanilla that are beautifully integrated and balanced."}
foodPairings: ["Roasted lamb with rosemary and garlic", "Aged Manchego and Idiazábal cheeses", "Wild mushroom risotto with truffle oil", "Braised beef cheeks in red wine sauce", "Serrano ham and cured Spanish meats"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 45-60 minutes to allow this mature wine to fully express its complex aromatics", "glassware": "Large Rioja or Burgundy-style glass", "temperature": "62-65°F (17-18°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Traditional Rioja Gran Reserva with extended American oak aging", "region": "DOCa Rioja, Spain", "vintage": "2017", "ageability": "Excellent aging potential; drink now through 2032 or beyond", "grapeVariety": "80% Tempranillo, 15% Mazuela (Carignan), 5% Graciano"}

name: Domaine du Vieux College Marsannay Blanc "Les Vignes Marie" 2021
description: A refined white Burgundy from the Marsannay appellation, showcasing Chardonnay from the specific 'Les Vignes Marie' vineyard parcel. This wine represents the quality renaissance of Marsannay's white wines, offering excellent value for terroir-driven Burgundy with precision and elegance.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Delicate and precise aromatics feature white peach, yellow apple, and Bartlett pear, complemented by subtle notes of white flowers, acacia honey, and crushed limestone. The nose reveals classic Burgundian Chardonnay character with hints of hazelnut, brioche, and a touch of lemon zest. Restrained oak influence contributes vanilla bean and light toast notes without overpowering the fruit. The mineral component is pronounced, reflecting the limestone-rich terroir of Marsannay.", "finish": "The finish is clean, focused, and moderately long, with citrus zest, white stone fruit, and mineral notes persisting gracefully. A touch of salinity and flinty character lingers, typical of well-made Marsannay blanc, leaving the palate refreshed yet satisfied.", "palate": "Medium-bodied with elegant structure and excellent balance. Flavors of ripe pear, white peach, and citrus fruits are supported by vibrant acidity and a distinctive chalky minerality. The wine shows beautiful texture and depth, with creamy notes from lees aging balanced by refreshing citrus and stone fruit flavors. Mid-palate richness is complemented by mineral tension and a saline quality that adds complexity. The oak integration is seamless, contributing texture rather than overt flavor."}

name: Baleia Sauvignon Blanc 2024
description: A distinctive Sauvignon Blanc from Baleia Wines, established in 2009 by the Joubert family in South Africa's Southern Cape. Despite the Portuguese name meaning 'whale,' this wine hails from the Cape South Coast's rocky limestone soils in a remote and unspoilt corner. The labels are inspired by St. Sebastien Bay, known as the 'Whale Nursery of South Africa,' and the winemaking style draws inspiration from the region's Mediterranean climate.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The wine displays a pale, greenish-gold color in the glass. Classic Sauvignon Blanc aromas dominate with elderberry flower and green fig leading the way. The rocky limestone soil imparts distinctive mineral notes, while the proximity to the Indian Ocean contributes subtle maritime nuances. Fresh-cut grass and hints of white pepper add aromatic complexity.", "finish": "The finish is vibrant and mineral-driven with the chalky limestone character persisting alongside green fruit and citrus notes. The saline edge from the ocean proximity lingers pleasantly, providing a refreshing conclusion that makes you immediately want another sip. The wine's purity and focus are impressive.", "palate": "On the palate, crisp green litchi flavors are the hallmark, accompanied by gooseberry, passion fruit, and lime zest. The pure, solid limestone soil with very high mineral content creates a particular mouthfeel reminiscent of chalky minerality. Maritime salinity from the coastal location adds a unique dimension, providing both freshness and texture that distinguishes this wine from typical Sauvignon Blanc."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh oysters with mignonette", "Grilled linefish with lemon butter", "Goat cheese salad with herbs", "Asparagus risotto", "Sushi and sashimi"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting necessary; serve directly from the bottle", "glassware": "Sauvignon Blanc or standard white wine glass", "temperature": "45-48°F (7-9°C), well-chilled"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Coastal limestone-driven Sauvignon Blanc with maritime influence", "region": "Cape South Coast, South Africa", "vintage": "2024", "ageability": "Best enjoyed within 2-3 years to preserve vibrant acidity and fresh aromatics; drink 2024-2027", "grapeVariety": "100% Sauvignon Blanc"}

name: Domaine Fevre Chablis 2023
description: A classic expression of Chablis from the renowned Domaine William Fèvre, one of Burgundy's most respected producers. The 2023 vintage showcases the appellation's signature minerality and crisp acidity, with the sunny vintage adding ripeness and depth to the traditional Chardonnay profile.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with fresh aromas of lemon, green apple, and freshly sliced pear, capturing the essence of Chablis purity. White flowers—particularly apple blossom and acacia—add delicate floral lift. Classic Chablis minerality emerges with notes of wet stones, chalk, and crushed oyster shell. Green almond and fennel provide subtle complexity, while the aromatics remain clean, precise, and inviting. The 2023 vintage shows more ripeness than typical, with hints of green melon adding depth.", "finish": "The finish is crisp and mineral-driven, with lingering notes of citrus, green apple, and chalk. Clean and refreshing, the wine concludes with bright acidity and a distinctive flinty character that defines great Chablis.", "palate": "Light to medium-bodied and well-balanced, the palate features bright citrus flavors of lemon and lime zest, complemented by crisp green apple and ripe pear. The texture is supple yet creamy, with a milky quality that adds richness without weight. Notable minerality is the hallmark—wet stone and flinty notes run through the wine, providing classic Chablis character and terroir expression. A tang of fresh, crunchy acidity keeps the wine vibrant and food-friendly, with green melon ripeness from the sunny 2023 vintage adding depth. The finish is malic and refreshing, maintaining energy throughout."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh oysters on the half shell", "Grilled Dover sole with lemon butter", "Goat cheese salad with walnuts", "Poached turbot with beurre blanc", "Sushi and sashimi"]

name: Dogwood & Thistle Sauvignon Blanc 2023
description: A vibrant Virginia Sauvignon Blanc showcasing the cooler-climate characteristics of American terroir. This 2023 vintage captures the crisp, herbaceous notes typical of quality New World Sauvignon Blanc while maintaining the elegance associated with mid-Atlantic viticulture.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with bright citrus notes of grapefruit zest and Meyer lemon, layered with characteristic green aromatics of freshly cut grass and subtle bell pepper. Delicate tropical hints of passion fruit emerge alongside white floral notes reminiscent of elderflower. The aromatic profile shows methoxypyrazine influence typical of cooler-climate expressions, balanced with thiol-driven complexity.", "finish": "The finish is refreshingly tart with lingering citrus peel and a hint of wet stone minerality. Bright acidity persists, cleansing the palate with crisp green flavors that invite the next sip. Best enjoyed within 1-2 years of vintage to preserve aromatic vibrancy.", "palate": "On the palate, this wine delivers crisp, energetic acidity that frames flavors of lime, green apple, and white peach. The mid-palate reveals herbaceous notes of nettle and fresh basil, complemented by a subtle minerality suggesting limestone influence from Virginia terroir. The texture remains lean and focused, with tropical fruit undertones adding depth without heaviness. Clean varietal character shines through without oak influence, showcasing pure fruit expression."}

name: Remhoogte Honeybunch 2024
description: A delightful South African wine that lives up to its charming name with approachable sweetness and vibrant fruit character. Remhoogte's Honeybunch 2024 represents the estate's lighter, more playful offering, crafted to deliver immediate pleasure with its fresh, fruity profile and gentle sweetness that appeals to a wide range of palates.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose bursts with exuberant aromas of ripe peach, apricot, and honeyed pear. Tropical notes of lychee and guava add exotic appeal, while delicate floral hints of orange blossom and jasmine provide elegance. A subtle suggestion of honey and candied citrus peel reinforces the wine's sweet character without veering into cloying territory.", "finish": "The finish is clean and moderately sweet with lingering peach and honey notes. Bright acidity cuts through the sweetness, leaving the palate refreshed rather than cloyed. A gentle persistence of fruit and floral notes invites another sip.", "palate": "Off-dry to medium-sweet on the palate, with luscious flavors of stone fruits and tropical fruits in perfect harmony. White peach, nectarine, and mango dominate, supported by a core of honeyed sweetness that feels natural rather than added. Refreshing acidity balances the residual sugar beautifully, preventing heaviness and keeping the wine lively and food-friendly. The mouthfeel is smooth and rounded with a pleasant viscosity."}

name: Dominique Portet Sauvignon Blanc 2022
description: A Bordeaux-influenced Sauvignon Blanc from Australia's prestigious Yarra Valley, crafted by ninth-generation winemaker Dominique Portet. This was the first wine released under the Dominique Portet label in 2000 and represents a distinctive approach to the variety, employing barrel fermentation with lees stirring to create complexity and texture reminiscent of white Bordeaux. Executive winemaker Ben Portet continues his father's legacy of producing elegant, food-friendly wines.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents a sophisticated blend of citrus and white stone fruits, particularly lemon, lime, and white peach, that provide the aromatic foundation. White blossom and delicate floral notes add elegance and lift, while subtle hints of dry grass and fresh herbs reflect classic Sauvignon Blanc character. What distinguishes this wine is the presence of honeycomb and subtle gunflint notes from barrel fermentation and lees contact, adding layers of complexity beyond typical varietal expression. Light toasty nuances emerge as the wine opens, speaking to the Bordeaux-influenced winemaking approach. The aromatic profile is refined and integrated, balancing fruit purity with textural complexity.", "finish": "Long and refined, with persistent citrus notes and a distinctive mineral quality. The creamy texture continues through the finish, with honeycomb and stone fruit flavors lingering gracefully. The wine's bright acidity ensures a fresh, clean conclusion while the barrel influence adds length and sophistication. A subtle flinty quality returns on the tail, adding a final layer of complexity.", "palate": "The palate reveals exceptional structure and roundness unusual for Sauvignon Blanc, with the barrel fermentation and lees stirring creating a creamy, delicate mouthfeel that sets this wine apart. Citrus and stone fruit flavors dominate—particularly white peach, lemon, and lime—supported by bright natural acidity that provides framework and energy. The texture is notably creamy and textural, with subtle weight and body that make this wine more substantial than typical Sauvignon Blanc. Honeycomb and light mineral notes add complexity, while the oak influence remains perfectly integrated, enhancing rather than masking the varietal character. This is a wine that emphasizes elegance, balance, and food compatibility over overt fruit or herbaceous character."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled white fish with beurre blanc", "Oysters and fresh shellfish", "Roasted chicken with lemon and herbs", "Creamy pasta or seafood risotto", "Fresh goat cheese and herb salad"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Brief aeration in glass helpful to integrate oak and enhance creaminess", "glassware": "Bordeaux-style white wine glass to appreciate complexity and texture", "temperature": "10-12°C (50-54°F) - slightly warmer than typical Sauvignon Blanc to appreciate texture"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Barrel-Fermented, Textural Sauvignon Blanc", "region": "Yarra Valley, Victoria, Australia - Coldstream", "vintage": "2022", "ageability": "Can develop 2-4 years; the barrel fermentation provides structure for short-term aging through 2026", "grapeVariety": "100% Sauvignon Blanc"}

name: Trespass Merlot 2021
description: A well-crafted Merlot from the excellent 2021 vintage, a year that produced powerful performers across California wine regions. This wine represents the modern renaissance of Merlot, showcasing the variety's ability to deliver both approachability and complexity when thoughtfully vinified.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with lush aromas of ripe black cherry and plum, complemented by notes of dark chocolate and mocha. Subtle hints of cedar and dried herbs add complexity, while a touch of vanilla from oak aging integrates seamlessly. The aromatics are inviting and generous, showing the variety's naturally expressive character.", "finish": "Medium to long finish with soft tannins and lingering dark fruit flavors. Subtle notes of chocolate and toasted oak carry through to the end, leaving a pleasant, satisfying impression.", "palate": "Smooth and velvety on the palate with supple tannins that provide structure without astringency. Flavors of blackberry, cherry, and plum dominate the mid-palate, supported by notes of cocoa, espresso, and baking spices. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit richness and savory elements, with integrated oak adding depth rather than overwhelming the fruit. The texture is round and mouth-coating, characteristic of well-made Merlot."}

name: Dogwood & Thistle Shenandoah Cabernet Franc 2024
description: An expressive Virginia Cabernet Franc from the prestigious Shenandoah Valley AVA, America's first established AVA in Virginia. This 2024 vintage captures the elegant, early-ripening characteristics of Cabernet Franc thriving in the limestone-rich soils and protected mountain valley climate ideal for this noble Bordeaux variety.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet presents classic Cabernet Franc aromatics with bright red fruit notes of raspberry and wild strawberry, intertwined with distinctive violet and iris florals. Subtle herbaceous qualities emerge with hints of fresh tobacco leaf and green peppercorn, while a characteristic vegetal strike adds complexity without overwhelming—ranging from bell pepper to leafy garden herbs. The cooler Shenandoah climate preserves the variety's signature freshness and aromatic intensity.", "finish": "The finish is medium-length with persistent red fruit character and a gentle peppery spice. Fine-grained tannins provide structure without astringency, while the wine's natural brightness leaves the palate refreshed. Subtle herbal notes of dried sage linger alongside raspberry essence, showcasing Cabernet Franc's characteristic finesse and varietal purity.", "palate": "The palate delivers medium-bodied elegance with flavors of bright red currant, crushed raspberry, and blackcurrant complemented by graphite minerality reflecting the limestone terroir. The wine shows refined tannic structure—softer and more approachable than Cabernet Sauvignon—with balanced acidity typical of cooler-climate Virginia viticulture (Region V classification). Mid-palate notes of pencil shavings and dried herbs add savory complexity, while the fruit-forward character remains vibrant and expressive without excessive ripeness."}
foodPairings: ["Herb-roasted chicken with root vegetables", "Grilled salmon with dill and lemon", "Mushroom risotto with Parmigiano-Reggiano", "Charcuterie board featuring prosciutto and salami", "Roasted pork tenderloin with cranberry reduction"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Brief 15-20 minute decanting recommended to soften tannins and open aromatics; young vintage benefits from aeration", "glassware": "Bordeaux-style glass or medium-sized red wine glass to highlight floral aromatics and fruit complexity", "temperature": "60-65°F (15-18°C), slightly cool"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Medium-bodied, elegant red wine with herbaceous character", "region": "Shenandoah Valley AVA, Virginia", "vintage": "2024", "ageability": "Drink now through 2029. name: Echevarria Propuesta 2017
description: An elegant Chilean red blend from the Curicó Valley, showcasing the Echeverria family's dedication to Old World winemaking techniques applied to Chile's exceptional terroir. The 2017 vintage benefits from extended barrel aging and represents the winery's special selection tier.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Classic Cabernet Sauvignon leads the aromatic profile with notes of ripe blackcurrant, cedar, and tobacco leaf. The blend's Petit Verdot component adds floral violet notes and spice, while Cabernet Franc contributes an herbal complexity. With age, secondary aromas of leather and dried herbs have developed, adding sophistication to the bouquet.", "finish": "The finish is smooth and persistent, with ripe fruit flavors extending through a framework of fine-grained tannins. Oak influence from 10-12 months in new French barrels provides subtle vanilla and spice notes that complement rather than dominate the fruit.", "palate": "Elegant and balanced, the palate delivers juicy ripe fruit flavors framed by well-integrated French oak. The 85% Cabernet Sauvignon base provides structure and cassis fruit, while 10% Petit Verdot adds density and dark fruit concentration. 5% Cabernet Franc brings aromatic lift and refined tannins. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit ripeness and freshness, avoiding over-extraction despite Chile's intense sunlight."}

name: Endhardt Vineyards Golden Turkey Red 2021
description: A bold red blend from award-winning Endhardt Vineyards in Purcellville, Virginia's Loudoun County. This proprietary blend of Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Tannat earned a gold medal at the prestigious 2025 Virginia Governor's Cup state-wide wine competition. The winery, opened in Fall 2021 by Hannes and Sarah Endhardt, has quickly established itself as one of Virginia's premier producers.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is bold and expressive, announcing its multi-varietal complexity from the first swirl. Black cherry and blackberry dominate initially, characteristic of the Cabernet components, while the Merlot contributes plush red fruit and floral notes. Petit Verdot adds violet and lavender aromatics, creating an enticing floral dimension. Hints of graphite, dried herbs, and subtle oak spice from French oak aging add structure and sophistication to the aromatic profile.", "finish": "Long and structured, the finish demonstrates the wine's ageability with firm but ripe tannins that will soften with time. Dark fruit lingers alongside cedar, tobacco, and spice notes. The substantial structure ensures this wine will develop additional complexity over the next 5-8 years while remaining approachable now for those who enjoy bold reds.", "palate": "This is a powerful, structured wine that showcases Virginia's ability to produce world-class Bordeaux-style blends. Ripe black and red fruit flavors meld seamlessly, with each varietal contributing its signature characteristics while maintaining overall harmony. Cabernet Franc provides herbaceous complexity and bright acidity, Merlot offers mid-palate richness and plush texture, Petit Verdot contributes color and firm tannic structure, Cabernet Sauvignon supplies backbone and cassis fruit, while Tannat adds grip and aging potential. The oak aging is well-integrated, providing vanilla and toast notes without overwhelming the fruit."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled ribeye or strip steak", "Braised lamb shoulder with root vegetables", "Venison or other game meats", "Aged cheddar or Gruyère cheese", "Mushroom and beef Wellington"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 45-60 minutes to allow this structured blend to open and soften. The wine will continue to evolve favorably in the glass over several hours.", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux-style glass to allow the wine's complexity to fully express itself", "temperature": "60-65°F (15-18°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Bold Virginia Bordeaux-style blend with structure and complexity", "awards": "Gold Medal - 2025 Virginia Governor's Cup; Loudoun Wine Awards", "region": "Loudoun County, Virginia (Purcellville)", "vintage": "2021", "producers": "Hannes and Sarah Endhardt", "ageability": "Drink now through 2031. The wine is approachable now but will develop additional complexity over the next 5-10 years as the tannins soften and tertiary characteristics emerge. Peak window: 2026-2029.", "grapeVariety": "Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Tannat (exact percentages not disclosed)", "wineryEstablished": "Fall 2021"}

name: Endhardt Vineyards Chardonnay 2022
description: Endhardt Vineyards, one of Virginia's rising star wineries in Purcellville, crafted this Chardonnay from their second harvest after planting in 2021. This young estate has already earned recognition, with their 2023 vintage securing a silver medal at the Virginia Governor's Cup, marking them as a producer to watch in Loudoun County's burgeoning wine scene.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with bright orchard fruit aromatics of crisp green apple and Asian pear, layered with subtle notes of Meyer lemon zest and honeysuckle. There's a delicate minerality reminiscent of wet stone, characteristic of Virginia's terroir, alongside hints of vanilla and toasted hazelnut from restrained oak influence. Fresh acidity lifts the aromatics, creating an inviting and elegant bouquet.", "finish": "The finish is clean and moderately long, with lingering notes of citrus zest and a pleasant mineral quality. There's a refreshing acidity that leaves the palate cleansed and ready for another sip, with just a whisper of oak spice on the very end. The wine's youthful energy shines through, suggesting it will develop additional complexity with 1-2 years of bottle age.", "palate": "Medium-bodied with refreshing acidity that drives flavors of ripe Bartlett pear, golden apple, and citrus across the palate. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit expression and structure, with a creamy mid-palate texture that doesn't overwhelm the bright fruit character. Subtle notes of brioche and butter emerge, suggesting partial malolactic fermentation, while maintaining the crisp, clean profile that defines quality Virginia Chardonnay."}

May benefit from 10-15 minutes of breathing time in the glass", "glassware": "Medium-sized white Burgundy glass or standard Chardonnay glass to concentrate aromatics", "temperature": "48-52°F (9-11°C) - moderately chilled to preserve freshness"}

name: Eulila Red Blend (DC - MD ONLY) 2022
description: Eulila's Red Blend represents accessible, fruit-forward winemaking designed for immediate enjoyment. The 2022 vintage is youthful and vibrant, showcasing fresh fruit character and approachable structure. This is a versatile red blend that offers excellent value and food-pairing flexibility, perfect for everyday drinking.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with exuberant aromas of ripe blackberry, dark cherry, and plum, complemented by notes of vanilla, mocha, and sweet spice from oak aging. Hints of dried herbs, black pepper, and subtle floral notes add complexity. The youthful 2022 vintage shows bright, primary fruit character with a touch of jammy richness. Subtle earthy undertones and a whisper of tobacco provide depth without detracting from the wine's approachable, fruit-forward profile.", "finish": "The finish is smooth and moderately long, with lingering dark fruit notes, soft tannins, and subtle oak-derived vanilla and spice. The wine concludes with a clean, slightly sweet fruit character that makes it highly approachable. This is an easy-drinking red blend that delivers immediate pleasure.", "palate": "On the palate, the wine displays medium to full body with soft, approachable tannins and balanced acidity. Flavors of blackberry jam, black cherry, and cassis dominate, supported by notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and toasted oak. The blend's composition likely includes Merlot or similar softening varieties, giving the wine a plush, rounded mouthfeel. Mid-palate richness is balanced by fresh acidity that prevents the wine from feeling heavy. Touches of spice, leather, and dried fruit add interest and depth to the fruit core."}

name: Finca Buenaventura Aureo Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
description: A super-premium Cabernet Sauvignon from Argentina's prestigious Uco Valley, sourced from high-altitude vineyards at 3,680 feet that drink pristine Andes snowmelt and bask under intense mountain sun. The exceptional ripeness and concentration achievable at this elevation create a Cabernet of remarkable intensity and character, aged in a combination of French and American oak.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose showcases the wine's outstanding fruit ripeness with intense aromas of ripe raspberries, fresh cherries, and concentrated dark berry fruit. Layers of vanilla and sweet baking spice from oak aging intertwine with the fruit, while subtle notes of black pepper, cocoa, and violet add complexity. High-altitude character reveals itself through bright, pure fruit expression.", "finish": "The flavor ends sweet in the mouth with lingering jam-like fruit character and persistent vanilla notes. The finish is smooth and approachable with well-integrated tannins and good length. Subtle spice and chocolate notes provide complexity through the conclusion, making this an indulgent, crowd-pleasing Cabernet.", "palate": "Rich and opulent on the palate with flavors that emphasize the ripeness of the fruit. Red fruit aromas translate to intense raspberry and cherry flavors on the tongue, complemented by notes of blackberry jam and cassis. The wine is full-bodied with smooth, integrated tannins and excellent concentration from the high-altitude fruit. Vanilla and sweet oak notes provide support without overwhelming the pure fruit core."}
foodPairings: ["Argentine grilled beef (asado) with chimichurri", "Grilled ribeye with Malbec reduction sauce", "Braised short ribs with root vegetables", "Aged Parmesan or sharp aged Cheddar", "Dark chocolate desserts with berry compote"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 45-60 minutes to open the concentrated fruit and allow oak to integrate; enhances complexity", "glassware": "Large Cabernet Sauvignon glass or Bordeaux balloon glass", "temperature": "16-18°C (61-64°F), room temperature or slightly cooler"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Full-bodied, fruit-forward super-premium Cabernet from high-altitude vineyard", "region": "Uco Valley, Mendoza, Argentina", "vintage": "2018", "ageability": "Drink now through 2030; the concentration and structure support extended aging", "grapeVariety": "100% Cabernet Sauvignon"}

Lueria Terrace  (MD & DC) 2023
description: A distinguished kosher red blend from Israel's Upper Galilee, crafted from grapes grown on unique volcanic terraces at 850 meters elevation. This wine showcases the exceptional terroir of the region, combining the structured elegance of Bordeaux varietals with the spiced richness characteristic of Mediterranean viticulture.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The wine displays a deep purple hue in the glass, revealing an aromatic profile of ripe red berries and dark plum. Initial notes of blackcurrant and cherry mingle with subtle spice elements, while the volcanic terroir contributes distinctive mineral undertones. Hints of toasted oak and vanilla from barrel aging add complexity without overwhelming the fruit.", "finish": "The finish is long and pleasant, characterized by persistent fruit notes and well-integrated tannins from 12 months of French oak aging. The conclusion is warm and satisfying, with lingering spice and dark fruit notes that demonstrate the wine's aging in separate varietals before final blending.", "palate": "Full-bodied with notable richness, the palate delivers concentrated flavors of red currant, blackberry, and plum skin, enhanced by integrated spice notes. The volcanic rock, limestone, and Terra Rossa soil composition imparts a distinctive minerality that threads through the wine's structure. The 60% Cabernet Sauvignon provides the backbone, while 25% Shiraz adds peppery spice and 15% Cabernet Franc contributes aromatic lift and finesse."}

name: Fledge and Co Riesling 2018
description: A distinctive dry Riesling from South Africa's Western Cape, crafted by husband-and-wife winemaking team Leon Coetzee and Margaux Nel. Sourced from characterful, lesser-known regions across the Cape, this wine showcases expressive aromatics with razor-sharp acidity despite containing 5 grams of residual sugar.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is immediately striking and unconventional, opening with unusual notes of rubber boots and petrol that are hallmarks of aged Riesling. Bright lemon peel and pink grapefruit provide citrus backbone, while delicate white flowers—jasmine and orange blossom—add elegance. There's an intriguing mineral edge with wet stone and slate characteristics that speak to the terroir.", "finish": "The finish is long and vibrant, maintaining that characteristic dry sensation despite the residual sugar. Citrus zest and mineral notes persist, with lingering acidity that cleanses the palate completely. The petrol character reappears subtly, adding complexity to the aftertaste.", "palate": "Despite the presence of 5 grams of residual sugar, the wine feels bone dry on the palate thanks to razor-sharp acidity that cuts through with precision. Intense citrus flavors of lemon, lime, and grapefruit dominate, balanced by green apple and subtle tropical hints. The mouthfeel is crisp and focused with electric energy, showing the winemakers' skill in balancing sweetness with acidity. Light to medium body with exceptional purity and tension."}
foodPairings: ["Thai green curry with chicken", "Vietnamese spring rolls with fish sauce", "Seared scallops with mango salsa", "Spicy pork schnitzel", "Aged Gouda or Gruyère cheese"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed; the wine benefits from cool service to maintain acidity", "glassware": "Riesling glass with narrow bowl to concentrate aromatics", "temperature": "8-10°C (46-50°F)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Off-dry Riesling with high acidity and expressive aromatics", "region": "Western Cape, South Africa", "vintage": "2018", "ageability": "Drinking beautifully now through 2030. Riesling develops petrol notes and honey complexity with age.", "grapeVariety": "100% Riesling"}

name: Fledge and Co Red NV
description: A characterful red blend from The Fledge & Co, based in Calitzdorp in South Africa's Klein Karoo region. This winery specializes in wines from lesser-known, characterful regions, creating blends that showcase personality and terroir. The non-vintage format allows for consistency and blending of multiple harvests for optimal quality.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents a melange of red and black hedgerow fruits including blackberry, raspberry, and wild berries. Meaty undertones add savory complexity, while exotic spice notes - cardamom, black pepper, and coriander - create intrigue. Aromas of fynbos (indigenous South African flora) add a distinctive regional character. Subtle notes of cocoa nibs, leather, and earth provide depth, while hints of dried herbs contribute to the wine's complexity.", "finish": "The finish is long with persistent fruit and spice notes. Firm but refined tannins provide structure, while the wine's savory character and bright acidity leave the palate intrigued and ready for food.", "palate": "On the palate, the wine delivers bright red and black fruit flavors with excellent concentration. Blackberry, black cherry, raspberry, and plum create a juicy, fruit-forward core. The wine shows good structure with powdery yet firm tannins that provide framework without astringency. A savory twist adds complexity to the fruit, while a lilt of acidity keeps everything fresh and balanced. Mid-palate reveals layers of spice, earth, and subtle oak influence. The texture is medium to full-bodied with good weight and presence."}
foodPairings: ["Braai (South African barbecue) meats", "Bobotie (South African spiced meat dish)", "Grilled lamb sosaties with apricot chutney", "Venison or game stews", "Aged hard cheeses"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 30-45 minutes to allow the wine to integrate and soften", "glassware": "Medium to large bowl red wine glass", "temperature": "16-18°C (60-64°F) - cool room temperature"}

name: Croix Narrow Gauge Pinot Noir
description: A regional expression of Russian River Valley Pinot Noir from select vineyard sites, this wine represents the fuller, broader style of the appellation while maintaining the aromatic complexity and balanced acidity that defines great California Pinot. Consistently scoring 92 points, it offers exceptional value for the quality delivered.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is distinctively earthy, opening with black tea, baking spice, and aromatic potpourri alongside warm black cherry. Layers of cinnamon, peppercorn, dried leaves, and rose water create complexity, while subtle notes of sweet earth, crushed red berries, and allspice add depth. The aromatics showcase classic Russian River Valley Pinot character with expressive intensity.", "finish": "The finish demonstrates excellent length with fine tannins and persistent acidity keeping the wine vibrant. Lingering notes of baked cherry, black tea, and subtle spice fade gracefully, with earthy undertones providing a grounded, satisfying conclusion.", "palate": "Medium-bodied with a silky, refined texture, the palate delivers focused flavors of crisp rhubarb, red cherry, and pomegranate, complemented by dark notes of black currant and mulberry. The wine shows concentrated fruit balanced by tongue-curling acidity and a stemmy freshness that provides structure. Earthy elements of black earth and hints of smoked cherry intermingle with cardamom and sweet spice, creating a multi-dimensional tasting experience."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled salmon with pinot noir reduction", "Duck confit with wild mushrooms", "Roasted pork tenderloin with cherry compote", "Mushroom and truffle risotto", "Aged Comté or Gruyère cheese"]

name: Frico Rose (NOVA only) 2023
description: Scarpetta's Frico Rosato is a light-bodied Italian rosé crafted from indigenous Tuscan grape varieties including Sangiovese, Canaiolo, and Ciliegiolo. This approachable wine showcases the natural high acidity and bright fruit character of these traditional varieties, creating a versatile rosé perfect for casual occasions and warm-weather drinking.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The wine presents a delicate salmon-pink color with brilliant clarity. The nose opens with vibrant aromas of fresh cherry and wild strawberry, complemented by subtle red currant notes. Herbaceous undertones add complexity, featuring hints of fresh basil, Mediterranean herbs, and a touch of white pepper. The wine's natural aromatic purity reflects minimal intervention winemaking, with no oak influence to obscure the varietals' inherent characteristics.", "finish": "The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering tart cherry and herbal notes. The wine's crisp acidity leaves the palate cleansed and ready for food, while subtle mineral notes add interest. Medium-length with no heaviness or sweetness, the conclusion invites another sip with its pure, straightforward character.", "palate": "Crisp and refreshing on the palate, the wine delivers bright tart cherry flavors at its core, supported by strawberry and cranberry notes. The herbaceous character from the nose carries through, adding savory complexity to the fruit-forward profile. Natural high acidity creates excellent structure and makes this an incredibly food-friendly wine. Light-bodied and clean, the wine shows no residual sweetness, instead offering a bone-dry profile that emphasizes freshness and drinkability. The texture is smooth and uncomplicated, perfect for casual enjoyment."}
foodPairings: ["Margherita pizza with fresh basil", "Prosciutto and melon", "Grilled vegetable platter with balsamic", "Caprese salad with heirloom tomatoes", "Light pasta with cherry tomatoes and olive oil"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting necessary; serve directly from the bottle", "glassware": "Standard white wine glass or all-purpose wine glass", "temperature": "45-48°F (7-9°C), well chilled"}

name: Gavioli Lambrusco  Emilia Semisweet NV
description: A traditional sparkling red Lambrusco from Emilia-Romagna, Italy's heartland of this distinctive style. This semisweet expression balances effervescence, fruit-forward character, and gentle sweetness, making it perfect for casual enjoyment and surprisingly versatile food pairing.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose bursts with fresh, vibrant red berry aromatics that immediately signal the wine's approachable, festive character. Dominant notes of ripe strawberry and raspberry create an intensely fruity profile, accented by hints of wild forest berries and delicate florals. The aromatic intensity is remarkable for a sparkling wine, developing an almost irresistible berry-forward character that promises pleasure. Light spice notes and subtle earthy undertones add just enough complexity to keep the wine interesting without compromising its joyful exuberance.", "finish": "The finish is clean and moderately persistent, with lingering red berry fruit, gentle bubbles, and refreshing acidity that balances the residual sugar. The wine concludes on a fresh, fruity note that invites another glass, leaving the palate cleansed despite the semisweet profile.", "palate": "On the palate, this Lambrusco delivers exactly what the style promises - fresh, sparkling, fruity pleasure with a light, refreshing attack. The effervescence is gentle and creamy rather than aggressive, creating a pleasant mousse that carries the fruit flavors beautifully. Strawberry and raspberry dominate with additional notes of red cherry and wild berries, while the semisweet style provides balance without cloying. The sweetness level is carefully judged - enough to soften the wine's natural acidity and enhance fruit expression, but restrained enough to maintain food-friendliness. The wine shows surprising freshness and vibrancy, with the bubbles providing lift and making each sip feel celebratory."}
foodPairings: ["Traditional Emilian charcuterie - prosciutto di Parma, mortadella, salami", "Pizza and casual Italian fare", "Parmigiano-Reggiano and other aged Italian cheeses", "Grilled sausages or porchetta", "Surprisingly good with spicy Asian cuisine or BBQ"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting; serve directly from a chilled bottle to preserve bubbles", "glassware": "Flute or tulip glass to concentrate aromatics and maintain effervescence", "temperature": "Serve well-chilled at 45-50°F (7-10°C) to enhance refreshment and balance sweetness"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Sparkling Red - Frizzante, Semisweet, Fruit-forward", "region": "Emilia-Romagna IGT, Italy", "vintage": "Non-Vintage", "ageability": "Best enjoyed fresh within 1-2 years; no aging potential or needed", "grapeVariety": "Lambrusco (specific sub-variety not specified)"}

name: Frico Sangiovese IGT Toscana (NOVA only) 2022
description: A vibrant expression of Tuscan Sangiovese showcasing the accessible charm of the IGT classification. This 2022 vintage captures the essence of central Italy's signature grape with bright acidity and authentic regional character, offering exceptional value for everyday enjoyment.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with bright red cherry and wild strawberry notes, complemented by hints of dried Mediterranean herbs including oregano and thyme. Subtle earthy undertones of terracotta and dried rose petals add complexity, while a whisper of black tea and tobacco leaf emerges with air. The aromatic profile speaks to the warm Tuscan sun and the traditional winemaking approach.", "finish": "The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering notes of red fruit and a subtle bitter almond character typical of Sangiovese. Fine-grained tannins provide a gentle grip, while bright acidity encourages another sip. A touch of herbal minerality persists, making this an ideal companion to rustic Italian cuisine.", "palate": "Medium-bodied with lively acidity that defines classic Sangiovese, the palate delivers flavors of tart red cherry, cranberry, and pomegranate. The wine's natural freshness is balanced by gentle tannins that provide structure without heaviness. Mid-palate notes of orange zest and sun-dried tomato add savory complexity, while the characteristic Sangiovese acidity keeps the wine energetic and food-friendly throughout."}
foodPairings: ["Margherita pizza with fresh basil and San Marzano tomatoes", "Pasta alla puttanesca with olives, capers, and anchovies", "Grilled Italian sausages with roasted peppers", "Medium-aged Pecorino Toscano cheese", "Eggplant parmigiana with marinara sauce"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "30 minutes of breathing recommended to soften tannins and open aromatics", "glassware": "Medium-sized Burgundy or universal wine glass", "temperature": "60-65°F (15-18°C) - slightly cool to showcase the bright fruit"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Dry red wine - medium-bodied, fruit-forward Tuscan style", "region": "Toscana IGT, Central Italy", "vintage": "2022", "ageability": "Drink now through 2026. Best enjoyed young to preserve fresh fruit character and vibrant acidity.", "grapeVariety": "100% Sangiovese"}

name: Galea Red Sangria NV
description: An organic red sangria from Barcelona, Spain, crafted from Tempranillo, Merlot, and Syrah grapes with natural orange and cassis essences. This ready-to-drink sangria showcases deep fruit flavors with a refreshing frizzante touch and only 7% alcohol, making it perfect for casual gatherings. Organic, gluten-free, and vegan-friendly.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with juicy, deep notes of dark cherry and black cherry, enhanced by natural orange essence that adds bright citrus character. Cassis provides blackcurrant intensity, while subtle cocoa notes add richness. An earthy, rustic quality emerges with hints of Mediterranean herbs. A touch of fresh ginger adds an unexpected and delightful spice element. The organic fruit character shines through with purity and authenticity.", "finish": "The finish is refreshing and clean with the frizzante carbonation maintaining vibrancy through the aftertaste. Dark cherry and orange notes linger, along with subtle spice from the ginger. The lower alcohol content prevents any heaviness, leaving a mouthwatering sensation that invites another sip.", "palate": "The palate delivers concentrated dark fruit flavors with dark cherry and cassis dominating. Natural orange essence provides citrus brightness that balances the fruit sweetness, creating harmony between ripe and fresh elements. Subtle cocoa notes add depth mid-palate, while the hint of ginger provides warming spice. The frizzante touch—light carbonation—is very well integrated, giving special freshness and liveliness to the experience. Light-bodied at 7% alcohol, making it dangerously drinkable and perfect for extended enjoyment."}
foodPairings: ["Spanish tapas—patatas bravas, croquetas", "Grilled chorizo and manchego cheese", "Paella or seafood rice dishes", "Fresh fruit platters", "Light summer salads with citrus dressing"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed; serve directly from bottle over ice with fresh fruit garnish", "glassware": "Large wine glass or tumbler with ice, garnished with orange slices and berries", "temperature": "6-8°C (43-46°F), serve well chilled over ice"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Organic frizzante red sangria with natural fruit essences, 7% ABV", "region": "Barcelona, Catalonia, Spain", "vintage": "Non-Vintage", "ageability": "Enjoy immediately. Sangria is designed for fresh, immediate consumption.", "grapeVariety": "Organic blend: Tempranillo, Merlot, Syrah with natural orange and cassis essences"}

name: Tributo Malbec 2020
description: A concentrated Argentine Malbec showcasing the deep color and intense fruity character that has made this varietal Argentina's signature wine. The 2020 vintage delivers the velvety texture and plush fruit expression characteristic of quality Argentine Malbec, likely sourced from the renowned Mendoza region where this varietal achieves its greatest heights.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose explodes with ripe dark fruit aromas of blackberry, black plum, and cassis, accompanied by distinctive violet florals that define Argentine Malbec. Layers of dark chocolate and espresso emerge alongside sweet vanilla oak notes, while subtle hints of dried fig and raisin suggest concentrated fruit from warm-climate viticulture. The intense, perfumed aromatics showcase the variety's juicy fruit character enhanced by careful oak integration.", "finish": "The finish is long and satisfying with persistent dark fruit flavors and gentle tannins that coat the palate. Chocolate and coffee notes linger alongside the wine's signature violet character, while integrated oak adds vanilla sweetness without dominating. The 2020 vintage shows excellent aging potential similar to French Malbecs despite its softer tannic structure.", "palate": "On the palate, this wine delivers full-bodied richness with velvety, plush tannins characteristic of Argentine style—softer and more approachable than French Malbec counterparts. Flavors of ripe black cherry, boysenberry, and blackberry compote dominate, supported by notes of mocha, cocoa powder, and toasted oak. The texture is luxurious and mouth-filling without excessive weight, while maintained acidity (crucial in warm-climate Malbec) provides balance and prevents the wine from tasting flabby. Mid-palate complexity includes leather, tobacco, and subtle spice notes."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled Argentine ribeye steak with chimichurri", "Braised short ribs with red wine reduction", "Lamb chops with rosemary and garlic", "Aged Manchego or aged Gouda cheese", "Dark chocolate flourless cake"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 30-45 minutes to soften tannins and allow complex aromatics to fully develop; benefits significantly from aeration", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux or Malbec-specific glass with wide bowl to maximize aromatics and allow wine to breathe", "temperature": "62-68°F (17-20°C), cellar temperature to room temperature"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Full-bodied, fruit-forward red wine with oak influence", "region": "Mendoza, Argentina (likely high-altitude Luján de Cuyo or Uco Valley)", "vintage": "2020", "ageability": "Drink now through 2030. The 2020 vintage is approaching optimal drinking window with 4+ years of bottle age. Argentine Malbecs show aging potential of 8-12 years, developing tertiary complexity while maintaining fruit intensity. Peak drinking 2025-2028.", "grapeVariety": "100% Malbec"}

name: Endhardt Rose 2021
description: An elegant European-style rosé crafted using traditional skin-contact methods to achieve delicate color and refined flavor profile. This 2021 vintage captures the fresh, fruity character essential to quality rosé while offering subtle complexity from careful winemaking techniques.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents delicate aromas of wild strawberry, white peach, and watermelon rind, complemented by subtle floral notes of rose petal and orange blossom. Bright citrus hints of pink grapefruit emerge alongside thiol-driven aromatics of passion fruit and lychee, derived from carefully controlled skin contact temperatures. The pale, onion-skin hue suggests gentle extraction focusing on aromatic complexity over color intensity.", "finish": "The finish is clean and bright with lingering red berry flavors and refreshing acidity that cleanses the palate. Subtle citrus notes of grapefruit zest persist alongside delicate floral hints. Best consumed within 1-2 years of vintage to maximize aromatic freshness before volatile thiol compounds diminish.", "palate": "The palate delivers refreshing acidity with crisp flavors of red currant, Rainier cherry, and nectarine. Light-bodied and vibrant, the wine shows minimal phenolic structure from brief skin contact, creating an accessible, easy-drinking style. Mid-palate notes of fresh melon and raspberry add depth, while subtle minerality provides backbone. The wine's low tannin profile and bright fruit character reflect classic rosé production focusing on immediate drinkability and aromatic freshness."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled shrimp with lemon and herbs", "Niçoise salad with fresh tuna", "Soft cheeses like Brie or fresh chèvre", "Mediterranean mezze platter", "Strawberry and arugula salad with balsamic"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting required; serve directly chilled to preserve delicate aromatics and fresh fruit character", "glassware": "Medium white wine glass or tulip-shaped rosé glass to concentrate subtle aromatics", "temperature": "45-50°F (7-10°C), well-chilled"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Dry, pale rosé with delicate fruit character", "region": "European origin (likely French or Italian based on style)", "vintage": "2021", "ageability": "Drink now. At 4 years of age, this wine is past its ideal consumption window. Rosés should be consumed within 1-2 years of production to preserve aromatic freshness, as key aroma compounds drop to half their fermentation level within the first year. This bottle may show some oxidative character.", "grapeVariety": "Traditional rosé blend (likely Grenache, Syrah, or Pinot Noir base)"}

name: Getariako Txakolina Basa Lore Igartzeta 2023
description: A crisp, coastal Basque white from the historic Basa Lore winery, one of the six founding estates of the Getariako Txakolina DO. This entirely women-owned and operated estate has been crafting traditional Txakolina near San Sebastian since 1925.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Vibrant aromas of fresh lemon zest and green apple skin dominate the nose, accompanied by zesty green herbs reminiscent of the nearby forests. Bright citrus notes of lime and grapefruit add complexity, while a distinct maritime minerality hints at the winery's proximity to the Atlantic Ocean. Subtle white flower notes and a touch of salinity complete this inviting aromatic profile.", "finish": "Clean, zesty finish with lingering citrus and sea salt notes. The mineral character persists beautifully, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for the next bite or sip.", "palate": "Light-bodied and lemony on the palate with gorgeous salinity that serves as a constant reminder of the sea. The wine is wonderfully crisp and bright, featuring fresh mineral notes and vibrant citrus fruits that dance across the tongue. Lime and green apple flavors are complemented by a pronounced saline character that adds depth and interest. The refreshing acidity is perfectly balanced, making this an incredibly food-friendly wine."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled anchovies or fresh sardines", "Basque-style seafood pintxos", "Oysters on the half shell with mignonette", "Salt cod in pil pil sauce", "Grilled octopus with paprika and olive oil"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed; serve immediately from an ice bucket", "glassware": "Traditional Txakolina glass or white wine glass; pour from height for slight effervescence", "temperature": "Well chilled at 45-50°F (7-10°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Light-bodied, high-acid coastal white with slight spritz", "region": "Getariako Txakolina DO, Basque Country, Spain", "vintage": "2023", "ageability": "Drink young within 1-2 years to enjoy the fresh, vibrant coastal character", "grapeVariety": "Primarily Hondarrabi Zuri with possible Hondarrabi Beltza"}

name: Korde Pinea Rose 2023
description: A contemporary rosé showcasing bright fruit character and modern winemaking precision. The 2023 vintage delivers fresh, vibrant aromatics with balanced structure, crafted for immediate enjoyment at optimal freshness.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet offers enticing aromas of fresh raspberry, cranberry, and pink grapefruit, layered with delicate notes of white flowers and honeysuckle. Subtle tropical hints of guava and lychee suggest thiol development from controlled-temperature skin contact above 20°C (68°F). The vibrant aromatics indicate recent bottling with key volatile compounds still at peak intensity, showcasing the wine's youthful exuberance.", "finish": "The finish is crisp and clean with persistent red berry notes and refreshing citrus acidity. A subtle saline minerality emerges, adding complexity and length. The wine's bright, juicy character lingers pleasantly, inviting another sip. As a 2023 vintage consumed in 2025, this rosé is at its peak drinking window with full aromatic expression intact.", "palate": "The palate presents lively acidity with flavors of pomegranate, blood orange, and ripe strawberry. Medium-light body with subtle textural weight suggests slightly extended skin contact compared to pale rosés, providing enhanced flavor extraction without heaviness. Notes of watermelon, white cherry, and citrus zest create a refreshing, fruit-forward profile. The wine shows minimal phenolic grip, maintaining the soft, approachable character essential to quality rosé while offering enough structure for food pairing versatility."}

name: Getariako Txakolina Basa Lore Rose 2022
description: A traditional Basque txakoli rosé from one of the oldest producers in the D.O. Getariako Txakolina, making wine since 1930. The 'Sarea' rosé showcases indigenous Basque grapes Hondarrabi Beltza and Hondarrabi Zuri from vineyards on the slopes above Zarautz beach. With characteristic light effervescence and bright salinity, this wine captures the essence of Basque coastal winemaking.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Pale pink with shades of fuchsia, presenting a bright, elegant appearance. The fine and elegant bubble creates visual appeal. The nose offers traditional txakoli aromatics with bright strawberry leading alongside prickly pear and apricot. Fresh mint adds herbal complexity and coastal character. The aromatic profile is clean, fresh, and inviting.", "finish": "Clean and invigorating with persistent mineral and fruit notes. The salinity lingers alongside the gentle effervescence, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for food.", "palate": "Light to medium-bodied with lively acidity and a touch of fizz characteristic of txakoli. Flavors of strawberry, prickly pear, and apricot dominate, showing pure fruit expression. The wine displays undeniable salinity from the coastal influence, adding a savory mineral edge that enhances food-pairing potential. Hints of mint provide herbal freshness. The texture is crisp and refreshing."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh seafood tapas", "Grilled octopus", "Basque pintxos", "Oysters and shellfish", "Light fish preparations"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed; serve very cold", "glassware": "Txakoli glass or white wine glass", "temperature": "40-45°F (4-7°C)"}

name: Noble Hill Simonskop Chenin Blanc 2022
description: An organically farmed, barrel-aged Chenin Blanc from a single vineyard planted in 1987 on mountainous granite soils in South Africa's Simonsberg region. This wine demonstrates the textural complexity and mineral precision achievable with old-vine Chenin Blanc, balancing richness with vibrant acidity in the finest Cape tradition.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with aromas of quince, white peach, and honeysuckle, beautifully accented by subtle almond and wet stone minerality. Plump notes of honeyed apple and apricot emerge, while hints of baking spice from oak integration add complexity. The aromatic profile suggests both fruit ripeness and cool-climate minerality in harmonious balance.", "finish": "The finish is long and clean, marked by refreshing citrus-mineral acidity that balances the wine's textural richness. Lingering notes of peach, citrus zest, and wet stone provide a satisfying, food-friendly conclusion. The almond and honeyed elements fade gracefully, leaving a mineral impression.", "palate": "The palate shows exceptional texture with a creamy mid-palate derived from barrel aging, balanced by crisp orchard fruit flavors of green apple and pear. Zesty citrus notes provide lift, while layers of white peach and apricot add richness. A distinctive chalky minerality from the granite soils threads through the wine, providing structure and precision. The dry-farmed, organic vineyard character contributes purity and intensity to the fruit expression."}
foodPairings: ["Roasted chicken with lemon and herbs", "Grilled line fish with citrus beurre blanc", "Butternut squash ravioli with brown butter", "Cape Malay curry with mild spicing", "Aged farmhouse goat cheese"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Brief 15 minutes in decanter or glass allows oak to integrate; serve slightly warmer than typical whites to appreciate texture", "glassware": "White Burgundy glass or medium-bowled white wine glass", "temperature": "50-54°F (10-12°C)"}

name: Domaine des Perrelles Moulin a Vent 2021
description: A distinguished Moulin-à-Vent from one of Beaujolais's most prestigious Cru appellations, produced from Gamay grown on granitic acidic soils. This 2021 vintage from Domaine des Perrelles showcases the structured, age-worthy character that distinguishes Moulin-à-Vent as the 'King of Beaujolais,' offering complexity beyond typical carbonic maceration styles.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose reveals concentrated aromas of sour cherry, black pepper, and dried cranberry characteristic of Gamay from acidic granite soils. Mineral notes of fresh-cut stone and chalk emerge alongside subtle rose petal and violet florals. Unlike lighter Beaujolais styles, this wine shows darker fruit concentration with hints of dried plum, graphite, and forest floor, suggesting traditional fermentation methods emphasizing structure over primary fruit exuberance. The aromatic complexity reflects the appellation's reputation for producing Beaujolais's most serious, Burgundian wines.", "finish": "The finish is persistent with firm tannins and mineral-driven complexity. Sour cherry and black pepper notes linger alongside chalky minerality and subtle spice. The wine's structure suggests good aging potential—Moulin-à-Vent's reputation as one of few Gamay-based wines capable of extended cellaring. At 4 years of age, the 2021 is entering its prime drinking window with integrated tannins and developing tertiary complexity.", "palate": "The palate delivers medium body with firm acidity and structured tannins unusual for Gamay, showcasing Moulin-à-Vent's distinctive tannic grip from granitic terroir. Flavors of tart cherry, raspberry preserve, and blackcurrant combine with savory notes of black pepper, crushed stone, and dried herbs. The wine shows earthy complexity with mushroom and forest floor nuances, while maintained acidity provides freshness and balance. Unlike carbonic maceration styles emphasizing bright strawberry, this wine offers depth and seriousness befitting a Cru Beaujolais."}
foodPairings: ["Coq au vin with pearl onions and mushrooms", "Grilled duck breast with cherry reduction", "Boeuf bourguignon with root vegetables", "Aged Comté or Gruyère cheese", "Roasted game birds with wild mushroom sauce"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 30 minutes to soften tannins and reveal aromatic complexity; benefits from aeration unlike lighter Beaujolais styles", "glassware": "Burgundy glass with wide bowl to maximize aromatics and allow wine to breathe, showcasing structural complexity", "temperature": "58-62°F (14-17°C), cellar temperature to slightly cool"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Structured, age-worthy Cru Beaujolais with mineral complexity", "region": "Moulin-à-Vent AOC, Beaujolais, France (border of Rhône and Saône-et-Loire)", "vintage": "2021", "ageability": "Drink now through 2028. Moulin-à-Vent is one of few Gamay-based wines with significant aging potential of 7-10 years. The 2021 vintage is currently in its prime drinking window (4 years of age), showing integrated tannins and developing complexity. Will continue to evolve gracefully through 2026-2028.", "grapeVariety": "100% Gamay grown on granitic acidic soils"}

name: Giustini Patu Primitivo 2023
description: A rich and enveloping Primitivo from Salento, Puglia, crafted by Tenuta Giustini as a homage to the Papadopoli family's Greek roots. Their ancestors settled in the heart of Salento to devote themselves to peasant life and viticulture. This wine offers exceptional value and has increased in popularity, delivering the warmth and generosity characteristic of Southern Italian reds.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is immediately expressive, revealing ripe fruit aromas of dark cherry, blackberry jam, and plum, complemented by notes of dried fig and raisin. A distinctive fine note of milk chocolate adds richness and depth, while subtle hints of sweet spice—cinnamon and vanilla—emerge from the wine's oak influence. Undertones of dried Mediterranean herbs and a whisper of black pepper add complexity to this generous bouquet.", "finish": "The finish is medium to long, with persistent dark fruit and chocolate flavors gradually transitioning to notes of espresso, dried fig, and sweet spice. The wine's harmonious balance ensures a satisfying conclusion that is both rich and refined.", "palate": "Round, well-balanced, and harmonious on the palate, this Primitivo delivers concentrated flavors of ripe dark fruit—blackberry, black cherry, and plum—alongside notes of dark chocolate and espresso. The wine's medium to full body is supported by soft, velvety tannins that provide structure without heaviness. Mid-palate notes of caramel, vanilla, and toasted oak blend seamlessly with the fruit core, while a touch of dried herbs and balsamic adds savory depth. The wine's natural warmth and generous alcohol lend a comforting, enveloping character."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled beef steaks with peppercorn sauce", "Braised venison with red wine and juniper berries", "Hearty pasta with wild boar ragù", "Aged Pecorino Romano or Parmigiano-Reggiano", "Eggplant and ricotta lasagna"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 20-30 minutes to allow the wine's generous fruit and chocolate notes to fully develop", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux or Burgundy-style glass to capture the wine's rich aromatics and warming character", "temperature": "Serve at 16-18°C (61-64°F)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Rich, intense, full-bodied Southern Italian red wine", "region": "Salento IGP, Puglia, Southern Italy", "vintage": "2023", "ageability": "Drink now through 2028. name: Les Hauts de Riquets Le Mignon 2020
Raywood Moscato 2022
description: A refreshingly sweet Moscato from California's Central Coast, crafted through long, cool stainless-steel fermentation to preserve the grape's distinctive aromatic character. This wine balances sweetness with bright acidity, creating a light, approachable style perfect for casual enjoyment and versatile food pairing.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Intense floral aromas dominate the nose, featuring white blossoms, honeysuckle, and orange blossom. A beautiful bouquet of fresh fruit aromas follows, with forward notes of ripe peach, apricot, and tropical lychee. The aromatics are vibrant and inviting, showcasing the Moscato grape's natural perfume.", "finish": "The finish is smooth and mouth-watering, with lingering peach and floral notes fading gracefully. The conclusion is clean and refreshing, leaving a pleasant sweetness that invites another sip without overwhelming the palate.", "palate": "Amazingly fresh, fruity, and smooth on the palate, with concentrated flavors of white peach, nectarine, and juicy pear. The wine is sweet yet light and crisp, with enough natural acidity to prevent any cloying heaviness. The texture is refreshing rather than thick, demonstrating skilled winemaking that balances residual sugar with bright acidity. Subtle hints of honey and citrus add complexity to the fruit-forward core."}

name: Grand Marchand Reserve Bordeaux Left Bank 2020
description: A distinguished Left Bank Bordeaux from the excellent 2020 vintage, awarded Gold at the Concours de Bordeaux Vins d'Aquitaine. This wine represents classic Bordeaux blending and structure, showcasing the elegant fruit expression and refined tannins characteristic of Left Bank viticulture in an outstanding vintage.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose reveals a sophisticated bouquet of black and red fruits, with prominent cassis, blackberry, and ripe plum. Aromatic complexity emerges with notes of exotic spices, sandalwood, and subtle cedar from oak aging. Hints of graphite and tobacco leaf add classic Left Bank character, while the fruit remains pure and focused, reflecting the exceptional quality of the 2020 vintage.", "finish": "The finish extends gracefully with persistent fruit notes and well-integrated oak influence. Fine tannins provide structure through the long conclusion, while subtle spice and mineral elements add complexity. The wine demonstrates excellent balance and the aging potential characteristic of quality Left Bank Bordeaux from the stellar 2020 vintage.", "palate": "The palate is friande (appealing and inviting), delivering concentrated dark fruit flavors balanced by elegant structure. Fine-grained tannins provide grip without astringency, while the wine's beautiful architecture demonstrates classic Left Bank composition. Flavors of blackcurrant and plum intermingle with notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and subtle baking spices. The wine shows medium to full body with integrated acidity maintaining freshness."}

name: Haut Espoir Cloudfall 2020
description: This South African white blend from Haut Espoir represents the estate's commitment to showcasing the unique terroir of their high-altitude vineyards. The Cloudfall designation evokes the misty conditions that moderate the vineyards, creating ideal conditions for elegant white wine production.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet is beautifully aromatic and complex, revealing notes of white peach, pear, and citrus blossom, complemented by subtle floral hints of jasmine and honeysuckle. A distinctive mineral quality speaks to the vineyard's elevation and cool growing conditions, while nuances of lemongrass, green tea, and wet stone add layers of complexity. Judicious oak use contributes subtle vanilla and hazelnut notes without overwhelming the pure fruit expression.", "finish": "The finish is long and refined, with citrus and mineral notes lingering alongside subtle oak influence. The wine's freshness persists through the finish while maintaining texture and depth.", "palate": "Elegant and medium-bodied on the palate, this blend shows excellent balance between richness and freshness. Flavors of stone fruits—particularly white peach and nectarine—mingle with citrus elements of lemon and grapefruit zest, while the cool-climate origins provide crisp, energizing acidity. The texture is silky with a subtle creamy quality from lees aging, and the mineral backbone provides structure and persistence. A touch of tropical fruit suggests warm days balanced by cool nights."}

name: Abadia de Acon Reserva 2018
description: A distinguished Spanish Reserva from Rioja, this wine exemplifies traditional winemaking with its minimum 36 months of oak and bottle aging. The 2018 vintage showcases the region's expertise with Tempranillo-based blends, offering complexity and structure refined through patient maturation.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with inviting layers of ripe plum and strawberry fruit, enhanced by warm vanilla and sweet spice from extended oak aging. Secondary notes of dried tobacco leaf, subtle leather, and Mediterranean herbs emerge with aeration, while hints of cedar and toasted oak provide an elegant backdrop. The aromatic intensity reflects the wine's careful barrel selection and traditional Rioja craftsmanship.", "finish": "The finish is persistent and elegant, with lingering notes of dried fruit, vanilla, and subtle leather. Soft tannins and balanced acidity carry through, leaving a clean, harmonious impression that invites another sip. The wine's traditional aging regime is evident in the refined, cohesive conclusion.", "palate": "Medium to full-bodied with well-integrated tannins softened by aging, the palate reveals concentrated red berry flavors interwoven with vanilla bean and baking spices. The Tempranillo character shines through with notes of cherry and plum, complemented by earthy undertones and a touch of tobacco. The oak influence is balanced and refined, adding complexity without overwhelming the fruit. Bright acidity provides structure and ensures freshness despite the wine's maturity."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled lamb chops with rosemary", "Manchego cheese and charcuterie", "Roasted duck with cherry reduction", "Beef empanadas", "Mushroom risotto with truffle oil"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 30-45 minutes to allow the wine to open and reveal its complexity; older Reservas benefit from gentle aeration", "glassware": "Bordeaux or large-bowled red wine glass", "temperature": "60-65°F (15-18°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Traditional Rioja Reserva - oak-aged red", "region": "Rioja DOCa, Spain", "vintage": "2018", "ageability": "Ready to drink now; can age for 5-8 more years in proper cellar conditions. Reserva classification ensures minimum 36 months aging before release.", "grapeVariety": "Primarily Tempranillo with traditional Rioja blending grapes (Garnacha, Mazuelo, Graciano)"}

name: Hendry Cabernet Sauvignon Magnum 2019  1.5 l
description: Hendry Vineyard's 2019 Cabernet Sauvignon in magnum format represents benchmark Napa Valley winemaking from their estate vineyards. The larger bottle format promotes slower, more graceful aging and is perfect for special occasions and extended cellaring.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The magnum format has preserved remarkable freshness and vibrancy in this 2019 expression. The nose bursts with pure blackberry, cassis, and dark cherry fruit, accented by exotic spices like star anise and cardamom. Underlying notes of pencil shavings, crushed rock, and forest floor add earthy complexity. French oak contributes refined touches of vanilla pod, toasted hazelnut, and a hint of cigar box that integrates beautifully with the fruit.", "finish": "The finish is remarkably long, easily exceeding a minute with persistent notes of black fruit, baking chocolate, and sandalwood. The tannins are fine and chalky, gripping gently without astringency. A beautiful minerality emerges on the fade, along with hints of black tea and dried Mediterranean herbs. This wine will continue to evolve magnificently.", "palate": "Powerful yet refined, the palate showcases Napa Valley Cabernet at its finest. Concentrated flavors of blackcurrant, black cherry, and mulberry are enriched by layers of dark chocolate, espresso, and sweet pipe tobacco. The wine's structure is formidable but not aggressive—firm, dusty tannins provide excellent backbone while remaining supple. The mid-palate depth is impressive, with waves of fruit, earth, and spice rolling across the tongue. Acidity is well-integrated, providing energy without sharpness."}
foodPairings: ["Dry-aged New York strip with truffle butter", "Venison medallions with juniper berry sauce", "Beef Wellington with wild mushroom duxelles", "Grilled lamb chops with herb crust", "Aged cheddar or cave-aged Comté"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 90-120 minutes given the wine's youth and the magnum format; can handle extended aeration", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux glass to maximize aromatic expression", "temperature": "60-64°F (15-18°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Estate Napa Valley Cabernet - full-bodied", "region": "Napa Valley, California", "vintage": "2019", "ageability": "Drinking well now but will improve through 2040; optimal 2028-2038", "grapeVariety": "Cabernet Sauvignon"}

name: Hendry Blocks 7 & 22 Zinfandel Magnum 2019  1.5 l
description: This special magnum bottling showcases fruit from two distinct vineyard blocks on the Hendry estate in Napa Valley. Blocks 7 and 22 produce concentrated, expressive Zinfandel that captures the variety's bold character while maintaining balance and finesse. The larger format ensures slower aging and enhanced development.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Exuberant and richly perfumed, the nose explodes with ripe blackberry, raspberry jam, and black cherry liqueur. Baking spice notes of cinnamon, clove, and allspice are prominent, joined by vanilla and caramel from oak aging. Underlying notes of black pepper, dried herbs, and a hint of eucalyptus add complexity. As the wine opens, darker elements emerge—dried fig, raisin, and mocha—creating a multi-layered aromatic experience. A subtle floral note of rose petals adds elegance to the powerful fruit.", "finish": "Long and warming, with persistent berry fruit and spice flavors. The alcohol is well-integrated but provides a gentle heat that complements the wine's richness. Soft tannins and lingering notes of dark chocolate, espresso, and dried fruit create a satisfying, complete conclusion.", "palate": "Full-bodied and rich with concentrated flavors of wild blackberry, strawberry preserves, and dark cherry. The texture is plush and generous, with soft, ripe tannins that provide structure without astringency. Mid-palate weight is impressive, showing the concentration typical of old-vine Zinfandel. Flavors of black pepper, anise, and dark chocolate intermingle with the ripe fruit, while toasted oak contributes caramel and mocha notes. Despite its power, the wine maintains balance through fresh acidity and doesn't tip into jammy territory. The large magnum format has allowed for slower, more graceful integration of all elements."}
foodPairings: ["Barbecue ribs with spicy dry rub", "Grilled Italian sausages with peppers and onions", "Smoked brisket with tangy barbecue sauce", "Wild boar ragu over pappardelle", "Dark chocolate brownies with sea salt"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 45-60 minutes, especially given the magnum format. The larger bottle size means the wine may need more time to open than standard 750ml bottles.", "glassware": "Large-bowled red wine glass to capture the aromatic intensity", "temperature": "16-17°C (61-63°F)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Rich, full-bodied Napa Zinfandel", "region": "Napa Valley, California", "vintage": "2019", "ageability": "Drinking beautifully now through 2029. The magnum format will age more slowly and gracefully than standard bottles. Peak drinking from 2024-2027.", "grapeVariety": "100% Zinfandel from Blocks 7 & 22"}
