The strong tannic structure suggests good aging potential.", "grapeVariety": "Grenache (majority), Syrah (25%), Mourvèdre (10%)"}

name: Bodegas Veiga Naum Rias Baixas Albarino 2024
description: A textbook Albariño from Rías Baixas, Galicia's premier white wine region. Produced by Bodegas Riojanas under the M. Victoria Dovalo label, this wine is aged briefly in tank to maintain the varietal's characteristic tension, clarity, and coastal freshness.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "A pale yellow color with green-gold highlights in the glass. The nose sparkles with clear citrus, floral hints, and tropical overtones. The aromatic intensity nicely combines fruit and floral notes with good concentration. Lime, lemon, and tropical fruit aromas are accented by delicate white flowers.", "finish": "There's a distinctive saline note on the finish along with mouthwatering acidity that reflects the wine's Atlantic coastal origins. The finish lingers with citrus and mineral impressions.", "palate": "Crisp and refreshing, the palate bursts with lime, lemon, greengage, and tropical fruit flavors. The wine maintains excellent tension and clarity, with a light yellow straw color and green-gold nuances. Vibrant acidity drives the flavor profile while maintaining elegance."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh oysters", "Grilled octopus", "Seafood paella", "Ceviche", "Grilled white fish with lemon"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed; serve directly from the bottle", "glassware": "White wine glass to capture the aromatic intensity", "temperature": "8-10°C (46-50°F)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Coastal White - Crisp and mineral-driven", "region": "Rías Baixas DO, Galicia, Spain", "vintage": "2024", "ageability": "Drink now through 2026. Best enjoyed young to preserve freshness and aromatic intensity.", "grapeVariety": "100% Albariño"}

name: Raywood Moscato 2023
description: A fresh, aromatic semi-sweet Moscato from California's Central Coast, showcasing the Moscato grape's intensely floral and fruity character. Crafted through long, cool fermentation with a touch of natural effervescence, this wine offers an accessible, refreshing style at excellent value.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Intense floral aromatics burst from the glass with honeysuckle, orange blossom, and jasmine notes dominating. Fresh fruit aromas of ripe peach, apricot, and strawberry add sweetness and appeal. Hints of lychee and rose water contribute exotic elements, while subtle citrus notes of mandarin orange provide brightness. The wine's natural effervescence carries the aromatics beautifully.", "finish": "Clean, fruity finish with lingering peach, honeysuckle, and strawberry notes. The light bubbles refresh the palate beautifully.", "palate": "Amazingly fresh, fruity, and smooth on the palate with a light, approachable body. Sweet peach and apricot flavors take center stage, balanced by bright strawberry and citrus notes. The slight carbon dioxide from fermentation creates gentle effervescence that adds liveliness and prevents the sweetness from becoming heavy. Sufficient acidity balances the residual sugar perfectly, making the wine light and refreshing rather than cloying. The smooth, almost creamy texture enhances drinkability."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh fruit salad with mint", "Lemon sorbet or fruit-based desserts", "Spicy Thai or Vietnamese cuisine", "Prosciutto-wrapped melon", "Mild blue cheese with honey"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed; serve directly to preserve the delicate bubbles and fresh aromatics", "glassware": "Flute or white wine glass", "temperature": "42-46°F (6-8°C) - serve well chilled"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Semi-sweet, lightly sparkling white wine", "region": "Central Coast, California", "vintage": "2023", "ageability": "Best enjoyed young within 1-2 years to maximize fresh fruit and floral aromatics. Drink 2023-2025.", "grapeVariety": "100% Moscato (Muscat Blanc)"}

name: Clementine Carter Larner Syrah 2023
description: A recently launched Syrah from the acclaimed Larner Vineyard in Ballard Canyon, Santa Barbara County. Clementine Carter, known for producing 'Pinot Noir lover's Grenache,' has added Syrah from this legendary Rhône-focused vineyard, bringing the same attention to detail and elegant winemaking style to this powerful variety.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Deep purple color signals the wine's youth and concentration. The nose opens with classic cool-climate Syrah aromatics—black olive, smoked meat, and cracked black pepper lead the savory profile. Dark fruits of blackberry and black plum provide a ripe fruit core. Floral notes of violet and iris add elegance, while subtle garrigue herbs (thyme, lavender) speak to the variety's Rhône heritage. Hints of graphite and wet stone minerality add complexity.", "finish": "Long finish with persistent dark fruit, pepper spice, and chalky tannins. The savory elements linger beautifully, showing excellent complexity for a young wine.", "palate": "The palate balances power with elegance in Clementine Carter's signature style. Concentrated dark fruit flavors—blackberry, plum, and black cherry—fill the mid-palate with intensity while maintaining freshness. Savory elements of black olive, cured meat, and black pepper add complexity and prevent the wine from being overly fruit-forward. Medium to full body provides substance, while bright acidity and fine-grained tannins ensure balance and drinkability. The Larner Vineyard's limestone soils contribute mineral backbone and structure."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled lamb chops with herbs de Provence", "Duck confit with olive tapenade", "Beef bourguignon", "Charcuterie board with aged salami", "Mushroom and truffle risotto"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant 45-60 minutes to allow the young wine to open and integrate; will benefit from aeration", "glassware": "Large Burgundy or Syrah-specific glass to showcase aromatics", "temperature": "60-64°F (16-18°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Cool-climate, elegant Syrah with savory character", "region": "Ballard Canyon, Santa Barbara County, California (Larner Vineyard)", "vintage": "2023", "ageability": "Can be enjoyed young but will develop beautifully with 5-10 years of cellaring. Best 2025-2033.", "grapeVariety": "100% Syrah"}

name: Queiron Mi Lugar 2019
description: A distinctive Rioja from the village of Quel in Rioja Oriental, bearing the prestigious 'Vino de Pueblo' (Village Wine) classification. This 90% Tempranillo, 10% Garnacha blend showcases the unique terroir of a specific village, representing a more focused expression than traditional regional Rioja blends. Scored 91/100 by critics.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Luminous black cherry color with radiant intensity and purple-ruby nuances at the rim. The nose is pronounced and complex with ripe black fruits dominating—blueberries, blackcurrants, and blackberries lead. Red fruits of cherries, redcurrants, and plums add brightness. Spice notes of cinnamon and clove combine with mocha, fig, and balsamic complexity. The oak integration is excellent, contributing subtle vanilla without overwhelming the fruit.", "finish": "Extensive finish with tight-grained tannins, spiced plums, cherries, and subtle minerals. The succulent fruit and balanced structure linger beautifully.", "palate": "A vigorous, lively attack greets the palate with pleasant balance and nice smoothness. Generous, complex flavors of bramble berries and dark plums fill the mouth with concentrated fruit character. Well-integrated oak adds structure and subtle spice without dominating. Bright acidity maintains freshness throughout and lifts the fruit. Medium to full body provides satisfying weight. The wine is structured yet elegant, showing both power and finesse. Fabulous length extends the flavor experience."}
foodPairings: ["Slow-roasted suckling pig (cochinillo)", "Chorizo and bean stew", "Grilled lamb chops with romesco sauce", "Aged Manchego and Idiazábal cheese", "Paella mixta"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant 45-60 minutes to allow the wine to breathe and reveal its complexity", "glassware": "Large Burgundy or Rioja-specific glass", "temperature": "60-64°F (16-18°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Village-level Rioja, structured and elegant with modern winemaking", "region": "Vino de Quel (Village Wine), Rioja Oriental DOCa, Spain", "vintage": "2019", "ageability": "Drinking beautifully now through 2028-2030. The structure suggests 8-10 years total aging potential from vintage.", "grapeVariety": "90% Tempranillo, 10% Garnacha"}

name: Campus Oaks Chardonnay 2016
description: A mature California Chardonnay from Campus Oaks that has developed additional complexity and richness with bottle age. This wine represents classic California Chardonnay style with oak influence and full-bodied character, now showing evolved tertiary notes from its aging potential.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Evolved aromatic profile showing layers of baked apple, ripe pear, and honey mingling with buttery notes and toasted oak. The bouquet reveals mature characteristics including hazelnut, butterscotch, and crème brûlée from extended oak aging and bottle development. Subtle hints of vanilla bean, baking spices, and a touch of caramel add richness, while whispers of dried apricot and fig emerge with aeration.", "finish": "Long, luxurious finish with persistent notes of oak, butter, and ripe fruit. The wine's creamy texture lingers pleasantly while subtle spice and nut notes emerge on the fade.", "palate": "Full-bodied and rich on the palate with creamy texture from malolactic fermentation and extended lees contact. Flavors of golden apple, poached pear, and tropical notes of pineapple blend seamlessly with oak-derived elements of vanilla, toasted almond, and butter. The mid-palate shows impressive depth and viscosity with notes of lemon curd, caramel, and a subtle mineral quality. Balanced acidity prevents the wine from feeling heavy despite its richness."}
foodPairings: ["Lobster with drawn butter", "Roasted chicken with herbs and lemon", "Creamy pasta with wild mushrooms", "Brie and triple-cream cheeses", "Pan-seared scallops with beurre blanc"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Brief decanting of 15-20 minutes can help the wine open, though not essential. Allow to warm slightly in glass to appreciate full aromatic complexity", "glassware": "Large-bowled Chardonnay or Burgundy glass", "temperature": "50-55°F (10-13°C), lightly chilled"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Full-bodied, oak-aged California Chardonnay with butter and tropical fruit character", "region": "California (specific AVA unknown)", "vintage": "2016", "ageability": "Drinking in its mature window now. The 2016 vintage has developed secondary and tertiary complexity. Drink now through 2026 before further evolution.", "grapeVariety": "100% Chardonnay"}

name: Sutherland Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
description: A cool-climate Cabernet from Thelema's Sutherland Vineyards in Elgin Valley, positioned just 9km from the Atlantic Ocean at 140-250m elevation. This maritime-influenced expression showcases Gyles Webb's vision for elegant, balanced Cabernet that emphasizes finesse over power, offering exceptional value at around $14.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents ripe, concentrated aromatics with plummy dark fruit and glossy black cherry leading the way. Undertones of cassis and blackcurrant reflect the Cabernet varietal character, while spice notes—cinnamon, clove, and black pepper—add complexity from oak integration. Distinctive cigar box and cedar aromas emerge with air, creating a classic Cabernet profile with admirable restraint and elegance rather than overripe intensity.", "finish": "The finish emphasizes spice and oak character, with cigar box notes becoming more prominent alongside dark chocolate and espresso. Tannins remain present but polished, suggesting 5-7 years of positive evolution ahead.", "palate": "Ripe, sweet, and succulent black fruit fills the palate with generous fruit expression—think blackberry compote, dark cherry preserves, and cassis liqueur. The cool-climate origins reveal themselves in the wine's supple texture and bright underlying acidity that keeps the concentrated fruit in balance. Oak influence is present but integrated, contributing vanilla, mocha, and subtle toast without dominating. Mid-palate juiciness gives way to structured tannins that provide grip without astringency, showcasing the wine's impressive concentration within an elegant framework."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled ribeye steak with peppercorn sauce", "Braised short ribs with red wine reduction", "Roasted portobello mushrooms with blue cheese", "Aged cheddar and dried cherries", "Rack of lamb with rosemary and garlic"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant 1 hour to soften tannins and integrate oak notes with fruit", "glassware": "Large Cabernet/Bordeaux glass to showcase aromatic complexity", "temperature": "16-18°C (61-64°F)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Cool-climate Cabernet Sauvignon, medium to full-bodied", "region": "Elgin Valley, Cape South Coast, Western Cape, South Africa", "vintage": "2019", "ageability": "Drink 2024-2029; peak drinking 2025-2027", "grapeVariety": "100% Cabernet Sauvignon"}

name: Black Elephant Vintners Back Roads Petite Sirah 2019
description: A powerhouse Petite Sirah from Black Elephant Vintners' Back Roads series, celebrating off-the-beaten-path vineyard sources and bold California winemaking. This wine embodies the intensity and deep color that defines the Petite Sirah varietal, crafted for lovers of big, structured reds.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Dense, almost opaque aromas of blackberry jam, black plum, and crushed blueberries dominate the bouquet with impressive concentration. Layers of violet, graphite, and black pepper add complexity, while notes of charred oak, espresso, and dark chocolate from barrel aging create a brooding, powerful aromatic profile. Hints of leather and dried herbs emerge with aeration.", "finish": "Extraordinarily long finish with gripping tannins and persistent dark fruit that seems to last minutes. Notes of espresso, dark chocolate, and black pepper linger powerfully while the wine's structure slowly softens on the palate.", "palate": "Massive and full-bodied with grip and intensity characteristic of top Petite Sirah. Flavors of black fruit preserves, blackberry liqueur, and cassis flood the palate with remarkable power. The mid-palate shows excellent depth with notes of mocha, black licorice, and a savory, almost meaty quality. Substantial, chewy tannins provide serious structure while ripe fruit concentration balances the wine's formidable presence."}
foodPairings: ["Slow-braised beef brisket with BBQ sauce", "Smoked pork ribs with spicy dry rub", "Wild game stew with root vegetables", "Blue cheese burger with caramelized onions", "Aged cheddar and dark chocolate pairing"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Strongly recommended to decant 2-3 hours before serving to tame the wine's powerful tannins and unlock its full aromatic complexity. Can benefit from aggressive aeration", "glassware": "Large-bowled red wine glass to allow ample aeration", "temperature": "62-68°F (17-20°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Bold, tannic, full-bodied Petite Sirah with intense concentration", "region": "California (likely Paso Robles, Lodi, or Sierra Foothills)", "vintage": "2019", "ageability": "Built for the long haul. Drink now with substantial decanting through 2035. Has the structure and concentration to develop beautifully over 10-15 years, softening tannins while gaining complexity.", "grapeVariety": "100% Petite Sirah"}

name: Boplaas Alvarinho 2024
description: A fresh expression of Alvarinho (Albariño) from South Africa's renowned Boplaas Estate, a six-generation family winery in Calitzdorp. This wine showcases the estate's expertise with Portuguese varietals and represents South Africa's growing excellence with this aromatic white grape in their unique terroir.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Bright and aromatic nose bursting with white peach, apricot, and honeydew melon alongside zesty citrus notes of lime, lemon zest, and orange blossom. Floral elements of jasmine and acacia add elegance, while subtle mineral and saline notes hint at the wine's depth. A whisper of fresh herbs and white pepper provides additional complexity.", "finish": "Medium-length finish with persistent citrus zest and stone fruit notes. The wine's bright acidity leaves the palate refreshed while subtle mineral elements linger pleasantly.", "palate": "Crisp and refreshing on the palate with vibrant acidity that defines the Alvarinho style. Flavors of ripe stone fruit including nectarine and yellow peach mingle with citrus elements of grapefruit and Meyer lemon. The mid-palate shows nice weight and texture with a slight viscosity that adds richness without heaviness. Mineral notes and a subtle salinity create an intriguing savory dimension that balances the fruit."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled prawns with lemon and garlic", "Fresh oysters and seafood platters", "Ceviche with citrus and cilantro", "Grilled calamari with aioli", "Light summer salads with citrus vinaigrette"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed. Serve directly chilled to preserve the wine's bright fruit and aromatic freshness", "glassware": "White wine glass with medium bowl", "temperature": "45-50°F (7-10°C), well chilled"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Fresh, aromatic white wine with vibrant acidity and stone fruit character", "region": "Calitzdorp, Klein Karoo, South Africa", "vintage": "2024", "ageability": "Best enjoyed within 1-3 years of vintage to capture the wine's bright fruit and aromatic intensity. Drink now through 2027.", "grapeVariety": "100% Alvarinho (Albariño)"}

name: Poggio Scudieri Chianti Classico Riserva 2019
description: A Chianti Classico Riserva from the historic Tuscan winemaking family Poggio Scudieri, whose roots in the region date back to 1890. Made from Sangiovese as required by DOCG regulations, this wine underwent extended aging before release. The 2019 vintage received a CellarTracker score of 87 based on consumer reviews.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents classic Sangiovese aromatics with raspberry as the dominant note, expressing the grape's characteristic red fruit profile. The wine shows moderate intensity with a focus on purity of fruit expression rather than overwhelming complexity. Subtle oak influence is present, adding a gentle vanilla and spice background that supports rather than dominates the fruit. As the wine opens, hints of dried cherry and subtle earthy notes begin to emerge, adding dimension to the aromatic profile.", "finish": "The finish is moderate in length with the light berry character fading gracefully. Oak influence is most noticeable on the finish, adding a gentle toasted quality without bitterness. The soft tannins persist just long enough to provide structure, while the overall conclusion is clean and approachable, making this an excellent wine for pairing with a wide range of foods.", "palate": "Light to medium-bodied with an approachable, easy-drinking character that makes this wine perfect for casual occasions. The raspberry fruit from the nose carries through to the palate, joined by light berry flavors that remain fresh and vibrant. Low acidity makes the wine softer and more immediately appealing, though this also means it should be enjoyed relatively young. A bit of tannin provides structure without making the wine aggressive, while the oak influence adds subtle complexity and a light spicy note. The overall impression is one of balance and drinkability rather than power or concentration."}
foodPairings: ["Classic margherita pizza or pasta pomodoro", "Grilled vegetables with olive oil and herbs", "Roasted chicken with rosemary and garlic", "Mild to medium-aged Tuscan cheeses", "Mushroom risotto or pasta with porcini"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Brief decanting of 20-30 minutes helpful to allow the wine to breathe and integrate; the relatively soft structure means extended decanting is unnecessary", "glassware": "Standard red wine glass or Chianti glass to concentrate the delicate aromatics", "temperature": "16-18°C (61-64°F), standard red wine serving temperature"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Light to medium-bodied Chianti Classico Riserva with approachable tannins and soft acidity", "region": "Chianti Classico DOCG, Tuscany, Italy", "vintage": "2019", "ageability": "Drink now through 2025; the wine's softer structure suggests it's ready for enjoyment and won't benefit significantly from extended cellaring", "grapeVariety": "Sangiovese (as required by Chianti Classico DOCG regulations)"}

name: Well Crafted Prosecco Freschissimo Keg NV  20000 ml
description: A large-format keg Prosecco designed for on-tap service and events. While specific producer information for this brand is limited, this wine follows the classic Prosecco style from the Veneto region. The 20-liter keg format ensures maximum freshness and is ideal for entertaining or commercial service.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents classic Prosecco aromatics with fresh green apple and ripe pear leading the way, creating an immediately appealing and accessible bouquet. Delicate white floral notes add elegance and lift, reminiscent of acacia blossoms or white flowers. Citrus hints of lemon zest provide brightness and energy, while the overall aromatic profile emphasizes freshness and vibrancy. The keg format helps preserve these delicate aromatics by protecting the wine from oxygen exposure until service.", "finish": "The finish is clean and refreshing with the fine bubbles persisting pleasantly. Light fruit notes fade gracefully without becoming cloying, while the wine's natural acidity provides a crisp conclusion. The off-dry style means the finish is approachable and never austere, making this an excellent choice for aperitivo or celebrations.", "palate": "Light-bodied and refreshing with persistent fine bubbles that create a creamy mousse on the palate. The primary fruit flavors mirror the nose, with crisp green apple and pear dominating, supported by subtle citrus notes that add zest. A hint of almond characteristic of quality Prosecco provides subtle complexity, while the overall flavor profile remains clean and focused on freshness. The wine is off-dry with just enough residual sweetness to balance the bright acidity, creating an appealing, crowd-pleasing style. The keg format ensures the wine tastes as fresh with the last pour as the first."}
foodPairings: ["Classic aperitivo with prosciutto and melon", "Light seafood appetizers and fried calamari", "Fresh fruit salad or fruit-based desserts", "Soft, mild cheeses like fresh mozzarella or Robiola", "Sushi and sashimi"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Not applicable for keg service; the keg system provides optimal serving conditions directly from the tap", "glassware": "Prosecco flute or white wine glass to showcase the bubbles and concentrate aromatics", "temperature": "6-8°C (43-46°F), well-chilled to emphasize freshness and maintain bubbles"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Light-bodied sparkling wine; off-dry; Charmat method; 20-liter keg format for on-tap service", "region": "Veneto, Italy (traditional Prosecco region)", "vintage": "Non-vintage (NV)", "ageability": "Consume immediately; Prosecco is designed for fresh, immediate enjoyment and the keg format is ideal for events and gatherings", "grapeVariety": "Glera (the primary grape for Prosecco DOC)"}

name: Chateau Maris Rose Cans NV  250 ml
description: An innovative organic rosé from Languedoc's pioneering Chateau Maris, presented in convenient 250ml cans perfect for outdoor enjoyment. This wine earned 90-91 points from Wine Enthusiast, showcasing elegant fruit expression and the estate's commitment to biodynamic viticulture and sustainable packaging.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is delicate yet expressive, opening with subtle aromas of fresh peonies and pressed carnations that provide an elegant floral lift. Ripe summer berries dominate—particularly strawberry, wild strawberry, and watermelon—alongside hints of fresh raspberry. Delicate garrigue notes add a touch of Mediterranean herb character, with whispers of thyme and lavender. The aromatics are fresh, inviting, and beautifully balanced between fruit and floral elements.", "finish": "The finish is clean and crisp, with lingering notes of summer berries and citrus. A subtle hint of acidity provides energy and freshness, making this rosé ideal for warm weather enjoyment. The wine concludes with delicate herbal notes that add complexity.", "palate": "Light and refreshing on the palate, the wine features juicy peach and wild strawberry flavors that meet vibrant, zesty acidity. The texture shows both roundness and freshness, creating an appealing balance that makes the wine highly drinkable. Orange zest and raspberry notes add brightness and complexity, while subtle mineral undertones provide depth. Nice minerality balances the fruit-forward character, keeping the wine lively and food-friendly. The wine is powerful yet refined, with concentrated fruit that never becomes heavy."}
foodPairings: ["Summer salads with goat cheese and strawberries", "Grilled shrimp skewers", "Picnic charcuterie with prosciutto", "Barbecued chicken with herbs", "Fresh mozzarella and tomato caprese"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed; serve directly from can", "glassware": "Can be enjoyed from can or poured into stemless wine glass", "temperature": "Serve well chilled at 8-10°C (46-50°F)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Light-bodied, fresh rosé", "region": "IGP Pays d'Oc, Languedoc, France", "vintage": "Non-Vintage", "ageability": "Drink fresh; best enjoyed within 1-2 years of purchase", "grapeVariety": "Grenache Gris, Pinot Noir, Grenache"}

name: Maison Ventenac Cuvee Marie 2024
description: A Loire-inspired white wine crafted in the Languedoc from Vermentino and Colombard grapes. This refreshing blend earned 92/100 points for its purity and finesse, offering exceptional value as a sophisticated aperitif wine with Mediterranean character.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "An expressive and complex nose bursts with tropical pineapple and bright citrus fruits, accented by a delicate touch of honey that adds richness without heaviness. The aromatic profile is clean and lifted, with fine floral notes emerging as the wine opens in the glass. The Vermentino contributes elegant Mediterranean herbs while Colombard brings characteristic aromatic citrus intensity.", "finish": "A tapered, saline finish with persistent citrus and a lovely acid line that cleanses the palate. The conclusion is pure and fine, with lingering grapefruit notes and mineral undertones that invite another sip.", "palate": "Crisp and dynamic on entry, the palate delivers fresh, pure citrus fruit with excellent textural interest. The wine shows lovely acid structure that keeps everything lively and precise, while subtle saline notes add complexity and a sense of place. Grapefruit and lemon dominate the flavor spectrum, supported by white peach and a hint of tropical fruit. The blend achieves wonderful harmony - Vermentino provides delicacy and smoothness while Colombard adds pop and aromatic freshness."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh sushi and sashimi", "Mediterranean grilled prawns with lemon", "Summer aperitif with light appetizers", "Goat cheese crostini with honey", "Ceviche or crudo preparations"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting required; best enjoyed fresh and cool", "glassware": "Medium-sized white wine glass to capture aromatic complexity", "temperature": "Serve well-chilled at 46-50°F (8-10°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Crisp, Aromatic White - Loire-inspired style from Languedoc", "region": "Languedoc-Roussillon, Southern France (Vin de Pays d'Oc)", "vintage": "2024", "ageability": "Best enjoyed young within 1-2 years to preserve freshness and aromatics", "grapeVariety": "Vermentino (Rolle) and Colombard blend"}

name: Libertine Gradient Vineyard Chardonnay 2022
description: An extraordinarily limited production Chardonnay from Oregon's Willamette Valley that defies convention. With only 66 cases produced, this wine embraces a minimalist winemaking philosophy with native yeast fermentation in neutral oak and zero additions beyond minimal sulfites. The style is more Chablis than California, emphasizing minerality and precision over richness.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Lemon pulp and lime zest burst from the glass in a delightful citrus-driven bouquet that immediately signals the wine's fresh, precise style. Subtle background notes reminiscent of marine fossils and chalky minerals dance around the rim, evoking ancient seabeds. The neutral oak barrel fermentation allows these pure aromatics to shine without any oak influence, creating a nose that is both intense and refined, with an earthy undertone that adds complexity.", "finish": "The finish is long and mineral-driven, with chalky notes persisting alongside bright citrus. The wine's natural acidity ensures a clean, refreshing conclusion that leaves the palate energized. Flinty, saline notes emerge at the very end, making this an ideal oyster wine and demonstrating remarkable precision.", "palate": "The palate showcases racy acidity that provides a vibrant backbone to concentrated citrus flavors of lemon and lime. This wine emphasizes its earthy side, with mineral notes more prominent than fruit, creating a Chablis-like character that prioritizes tension and energy. The texture is lean and precise, with the neutral oak providing subtle structure without adding flavor. Native vineyard yeasts contribute complexity and a distinctive sense of place that commercial yeasts cannot replicate."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh Pacific oysters on the half shell", "Seared scallops with brown butter and capers", "Grilled Dover sole with lemon and herbs", "Dungeness crab with drawn butter", "Fresh chevre with crusty bread"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Brief aeration in the glass recommended; allow 10-15 minutes to open and reveal full mineral complexity", "glassware": "Burgundy glass or premium white wine glass to capture delicate aromatics and minerality", "temperature": "10-12°C (50-54°F), slightly warmer than typical white wines to appreciate complexity"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Lean, mineral-driven, Chablis-style Chardonnay; unfined, unfiltered", "region": "Gradient Vineyard, Willamette Valley, Oregon", "vintage": "2022", "ageability": "Drink now through 2028; the mineral structure and acidity suggest good aging potential despite the minimalist winemaking", "grapeVariety": "100% Chardonnay"}

name: Vina Albina Verdejo 2023
description: A classic expression of Rueda's signature white grape from the respected Bodegas Riojanas. This 100% Verdejo showcases the grape's characteristic freshness and aromatic intensity. The 2023 vintage received 87 points from the Peñín Guide, while previous vintages earned 90 points from James Suckling, demonstrating consistent quality.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "High intensity aromatics burst from the glass with elegant complexity that is immediately engaging. The bouquet combines pronounced white fruit notes of crisp apple and juicy pear with exotic tropical hints that add intrigue. Herbal aromas of fennel and chamomile provide an authentic varietal signature, while a balsamic background adds depth and sophistication. The bright straw yellow color with greenish iridescence signals the wine's youth and freshness.", "finish": "The finish is clean and refreshing, with that signature Verdejo bitterness providing structure and encouraging another sip. The wine's natural acidity ensures the finish doesn't linger heavily but fades gracefully. Subtle herbal notes echo from the nose, while the overall impression is one of brightness and vitality perfect for warm weather enjoyment.", "palate": "Bright, fresh, and crisp on the palate, this Verdejo shows classic varietal character with light to medium body. Golden berries and blanched almonds provide subtle complexity beneath the primary fruit flavors. The wine maintains excellent balance between its fruity taste and refreshing acidity, with light flavors that never become heavy. A characteristic hint of bitterness at the finish is typical of quality Verdejo and adds interest, preventing the wine from being one-dimensional."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled white fish with lemon and olive oil", "Seafood paella or arroz negro", "Fresh mozzarella and tomato with basil", "Fried calamari with aioli", "Marcona almonds and Spanish olives"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed; serve directly from the bottle to preserve the wine's bright, crisp character", "glassware": "Standard white wine glass to capture the aromatic intensity", "temperature": "6-8°C (43-46°F), well-chilled to emphasize freshness"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Crisp, aromatic dry white wine with characteristic varietal bitterness", "region": "Rueda DO, Castilla y León, Spain", "vintage": "2023", "ageability": "Best consumed within 1-2 years of vintage while the wine retains its fresh, vibrant character", "grapeVariety": "100% Verdejo"}

name: Sun Break Idyll Acres Perfection Cider   500 ml
description: An exceptionally dry, wine-like cider crafted by Sun Break from 100% heritage cider apple varietals sourced from Idyll Acres Orchard in Oregon's Willamette Valley. Bottle-conditioned using méthode champenoise with extended lees contact, this small-batch, unfiltered cider showcases the sophistication of artisan American cidermaking.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Beautifully aromatic and wine-like in character, the nose opens with complex aromas of caramelized apple and baked apple tart. White tea and dried herbs add elegance and sophistication, moving this cider beyond simple fruit character. Subtle notes of bread dough and lees from the bottle conditioning provide depth and complexity. The aromatics are refined, layered, and inviting, showcasing the heritage cider apple varieties used in production.", "finish": "The finish is bone dry and refreshing, with lingering notes of white tea and subtle apple character. Clean and crisp, the wine concludes with sophisticated herbal notes and persistent natural carbonation that cleanses the palate.", "palate": "Remarkably dry on the palate—this cider truly \"doesn't even understand the concept of sugar.\" The attack features concentrated caramel apple flavors that develop into more nuanced characteristics. White tea and herbal notes provide a sophisticated, wine-like quality that distinguishes this from commercial ciders. The natural carbonation from bottle conditioning creates a fine, persistent mousse that adds texture and elegance. The unfiltered nature contributes to a fuller mouthfeel and more complex flavor profile. Small-batch production ensures attention to detail and quality throughout."}
foodPairings: ["Pork chops with apple chutney", "Sharp cheddar and aged Gouda cheese", "Roasted chicken with herbs", "Autumn salads with walnuts and blue cheese", "Apple galette with crème fraîche"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed; pour carefully to avoid sediment", "glassware": "Champagne flute or white wine glass", "temperature": "Serve well chilled at 6-8°C (43-46°F)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Dry, bottle-conditioned cider", "region": "Willamette Valley, Oregon", "vintage": "Non-Vintage", "ageability": "Drink now through 2026; bottle conditioning allows for some aging", "grapeVariety": "100% heritage cider apple varietals from Idyll Acres"}

name: Sun Break Liberty Red Cider   500 ml
description: A heritage-style artisan cider from Oregon's Willamette Valley, featuring Liberty apples among heirloom varieties. Crafted using méthode traditionnelle and bottle-conditioned for complexity, this cider represents Sun Break's commitment to small-batch, orchard-based production using heritage apple varietals.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Bright and zesty red apple aromatics pop from the glass, accompanied by distinctive rose petal and floral notes characteristic of Liberty apples. The heritage apple blend contributes subtle orchard blossom and fresh-picked fruit complexity. Natural bottle conditioning adds a layer of bread dough and subtle lees character that enhances depth.", "finish": "The finish is clean and dry with lingering red apple and subtle floral notes. Bright acidity keeps the palate refreshed, while the natural effervescence continues to enliven the finish.", "palate": "Crisp and refreshing with vibrant acidity, the palate showcases bright red apple fruit with Liberty apples contributing their signature aromatic quality. The dry profile is food-friendly and complex, with heritage apple varieties adding layers of flavor beyond simple sweetness. Natural carbonation from bottle conditioning creates a fine, persistent mousse. Unfiltered character provides additional texture and authentic orchard expression."}
foodPairings: ["Pork chops with apple compote", "Sharp cheddar or aged Gruyère", "Roasted chicken with herbs", "Fresh oysters or seafood", "Apple galette or tarte tatin"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Pour carefully to leave sediment in bottle; natural yeast is present due to bottle conditioning", "glassware": "White wine glass or Champagne flute to preserve carbonation", "temperature": "40-45°F (4-7°C), well-chilled"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Heritage dry cider, méthode traditionnelle, unfiltered, naturally sparkling", "region": "Willamette Valley, Oregon", "vintage": "Non-vintage", "ageability": "Best consumed within 1-2 years to enjoy fresh apple character and optimal carbonation", "grapeVariety": "Heritage apple blend featuring Liberty apples (45%), Frequin Rouge, and other heirloom varieties"}

name: Hertelendy Signature Mountain Blend (12 pk) 2017
description: Hertelendy's Signature Mountain Blend represents a carefully crafted expression from high-elevation vineyards, showcasing the intense concentration and structural complexity that mountain-grown grapes provide. This 2017 vintage displays remarkable depth and integration, with the seven years of development bringing forward tertiary aromatics and silky tannin refinement.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with profound layers of dark berry compote, blackcurrant, and wild blueberry, interwoven with sophisticated notes of cedar box, tobacco leaf, and graphite minerality. As the wine breathes, nuanced hints of dried lavender, black tea, and sweet pipe smoke emerge, creating an aromatic tapestry that speaks to both mountain terroir and careful cellar aging. A subtle whisper of vanilla and baking spice from oak integration adds further complexity without overwhelming the fruit.", "finish": "The finish extends impressively, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually giving way to savory notes of dried herbs, black pepper, and crushed stone minerality. Fine-grained tannins provide texture through the long conclusion, while a refreshing lift of acidity ensures the wine finishes clean and inviting for another sip.", "palate": "On the palate, this wine delivers concentrated flavors of ripe black plum, cassis, and dark cherry preserve, supported by a firm yet refined tannic backbone that provides excellent structure. The mid-palate reveals layers of cocoa powder, espresso, and forest floor earthiness, while bright mountain acidity keeps the wine vibrant and focused. The wine's full body is balanced by elegant restraint, showing the precision of mountain viticulture where cool nights preserve freshness even in ripe fruit."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled ribeye steak with herb compound butter", "Braised short ribs with root vegetables and red wine reduction", "Aged cheddar or aged Gouda cheese", "Wild mushroom risotto with truffle oil", "Roasted lamb rack with rosemary and garlic"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 45-60 minutes to allow the wine to open and integrate; the 2017 vintage has developed well but benefits from aeration to soften tannins and reveal aromatic complexity", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux or Cabernet-style glass to concentrate aromatics and provide ample surface area for aeration", "temperature": "60-65°F (15-18°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Full-bodied mountain red blend", "region": "Mountain AVA (specific appellation varies by vineyard source)", "vintage": "2017", "ageability": "Drinking beautifully now through 2030; the 2017 vintage is in its prime drinking window with potential for further development over the next 5 years", "grapeVariety": "Red blend (likely Cabernet Sauvignon-based with Merlot, Syrah, or Petite Sirah)"}

name: Dominio de la Abadesa Verdejo 2016
description: Dominio de la Abadesa produces this Verdejo from the renowned Rueda region, Spain's premier white wine appellation. The 2016 vintage offers a more mature expression of Verdejo, showing how this variety can develop complexity with bottle age while maintaining its characteristic freshness and vibrant aromatics.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents evolved aromatics with notes of Golden Delicious apple, ripe pear, and quince, alongside fresh citrus elements of grapefruit and lime zest. White flower notes of jasmine and orange blossom remain present despite the wine's age, while subtle hints of fennel, fresh grass, and wet stone add complexity. Some bottle age has introduced delicate notes of honeyed apricot and almond.", "finish": "The finish is clean and moderately long, with lingering citrus and mineral notes. A pleasant bitterness reminiscent of grapefruit pith adds complexity to the conclusion, while the wine's acidity leaves the palate refreshed.", "palate": "Medium-bodied with excellent freshness retained from the 2016 vintage, the palate delivers flavors of orchard fruits, citrus, and stone fruit. Verdejo's characteristic herbal notes of fennel and fresh-cut grass provide distinctive personality, while bright acidity keeps the wine lively despite its age. A subtle glycerin richness has developed with time, adding textural interest without compromising the wine's essential crispness. Mineral and saline notes carry through the mid-palate, speaking to Rueda's chalky soils."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled white fish with lemon and herbs", "Shrimp in garlic sauce (gambas al ajillo)", "Manchego cheese with quince paste", "Caesar salad with anchovies", "Asparagus with hollandaise sauce"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed; serve chilled directly from the bottle", "glassware": "Medium-sized white wine glass", "temperature": "8-10°C (46-50°F)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Mature, mineral-driven Spanish white with retained freshness", "region": "Rueda, Castilla y León, Spain", "vintage": "2016", "ageability": "Drinking at its peak now; best consumed soon to preserve remaining fruit character", "grapeVariety": "100% Verdejo"}

name: Chateau Josephine Merlot  Mevushal (MD & DC) 2023
description: A kosher Merlot from Spain's Yecla region, this wine represents excellent value from high-altitude vineyards where ideal ripening conditions develop concentrated fruit character. Mevushal certified under OU and Rabbi Padwa supervision, offering traditional kosher certification with accessible Mediterranean styling.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with reserved aromatics that benefit from gentle coaxing, revealing layers of gravel minerality and concentrated blackberry juice. With patience, earthy notes emerge alongside dark fruit, characteristic of Yecla's warm climate and calcareous soils. Subtle hints of dried Mediterranean herbs add complexity to the bouquet.", "finish": "The finish is clean and moderately long, with lingering notes of dark fruit and subtle earthy minerality. Mild tannins fade gracefully, leaving a pleasant impression of sun-ripened Mediterranean fruit.", "palate": "Medium-bodied with approachable tannins, the palate shows ripe cherry and blackberry fruit supported by dusty mineral notes. The warm Spanish growing season translates to generous fruit expression while maintaining food-friendly structure. Soft tannins and balanced acidity create an easy-drinking profile suitable for everyday occasions."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled lamb kebabs with herbs", "Beef brisket with red wine reduction", "Mushroom risotto", "Hard aged cheeses like Manchego", "Roasted eggplant with tahini"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Brief aeration of 15-20 minutes helps open the reserved aromatics", "glassware": "Standard Bordeaux or universal red wine glass", "temperature": "60-65°F (16-18°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Dry Red, Kosher Mevushal", "region": "Yecla, Spain", "vintage": "2023", "ageability": "Drink now through 2027; best consumed young to enjoy fresh fruit character", "grapeVariety": "100% Merlot"}

name: Paso Robles Pomar Junction Merlot 2013
description: A mature Merlot from Paso Robles' renowned Pomar Junction estate, this wine has developed additional complexity with age. The 2013 vintage showcases the warmth of Paso Robles while maintaining varietal character and food-friendly structure.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The aromatics are initially reserved, requiring patience and aeration to fully express themselves. With time, the nose reveals gravel minerality, concentrated blackberry juice, and subtle earthy notes. Ruby in color, the wine shows some evolution appropriate to its age, with hints of dried cherry and leather emerging alongside the fruit.", "finish": "The finish is clean and moderate in length, with cherry fruit and soft tannins fading gradually. Secondary characteristics of dried herbs and earth linger gently, reflecting the wine's maturation.", "palate": "The mouthfeel is moderately light, with gentle, well-integrated tannins that have softened considerably since release. Ruby red cherry fruit dominates, supported by subtle earth and mineral notes characteristic of the Pomar Junction vineyard. Full-bodied for the somewhat delicate structure, the wine delivers accessible fruit flavors without heaviness. Acidity remains fresh despite the wine's age."}
foodPairings: ["Herb-roasted pork tenderloin", "Duck confit with wild mushrooms", "Tomato-based pasta dishes", "Grilled portobello mushrooms", "Medium-aged Gouda or Gruyère"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 30 minutes to help open the reserved aromatics and ensure the wine is fully expressive", "glassware": "Burgundy glass to concentrate the subtle aromatics", "temperature": "60-63°F (16-17°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Dry red, estate-grown", "region": "Paso Robles, California", "vintage": "2013", "ageability": "Fully mature; drink now through 2026 as the wine is at peak development", "grapeVariety": "100% Merlot"}

name: Bodegas Tandem Inmune Garnacha 2023
description: A pure expression of mountain Garnacha from the cool-climate Yerri Valley in Navarra, made by leading winemakers José Maria Fraile and Alicia Eyaralar. This 100% Garnacha is crafted without oak influence, allowing the fresh, powerful character of high-altitude fruit to shine. Fermented with native yeasts and rested 10-12 months in cement tanks, the wine showcases the modern northern Spanish approach to Garnacha.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose displays powerful intensity with concentrated black fruit at its core, enhanced by distinctive Mediterranean scrubland aromatics. Subtle hints of thyme and rosemary weave through the ripe fruit, creating a compelling expression of terroir. The cool climate origins are evident in the wine's freshness and aromatic precision, with the mountain fruit showing remarkable purity and definition without any oak influence masking the varietal character.", "finish": "The finish is long and clean with lingering notes of black fruit, Mediterranean herbs, and a final touch of minerality. The super silky texture persists, making this a very good example of fresh, enjoyable Garnacha ideal for any occasion.", "palate": "Fresh and clean on entry, the palate reveals soft, subtle fruit with super silky texture that glides across the tongue. The gentle tannic structure provides just enough grip without overwhelming the wine's approachable nature. Broad and savoury flavors unfold with appealing texture and good volume, showcasing the powerfulness of cool-climate Garnacha balanced by refreshing acidity. The wine exemplifies cooler climate northern Spanish Garnacha at its finest—fruity yet structured, powerful yet elegant."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled lamb chops with rosemary", "Spanish chorizo and manchego tapas", "Roasted vegetable medley with herbs de Provence", "Iberico ham and aged sheep's milk cheese", "Grilled portobello mushrooms with garlic"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting necessary. The wine is ready to drink and benefits from its approachable, fresh style. A brief 15-minute breathing period in the glass is sufficient.", "glassware": "Medium-sized red wine glass to concentrate the aromatic herbs and fruit", "temperature": "60-62°F (15-17°C), slightly cool to preserve the wine's freshness"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Unoaked red wine, fresh and modern style", "region": "Yerri Valley, Navarra, Spain", "vintage": "2023", "ageability": "Drink now through 2027. This wine is designed for immediate enjoyment showcasing fresh fruit and is best consumed within 3-4 years to appreciate its vibrant, youthful character.", "grapeVariety": "100% Garnacha from mountain vineyards"}

name: Rioja Lar de Paula Reserva 2016
description: This award-winning Reserva from Lar de Paula represents classic Rioja craftsmanship with extended aging that develops remarkable complexity. Scoring 89/100 from critics and 92 points from Penin Guide, the wine has earned multiple accolades including Concours Mondial de Bruxelles Gold Medal and Decanter World Wine Awards Silver. The 2016 vintage showcases the winery's commitment to traditional Reserva production with modern precision.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose reveals bright, powerful aromatics with creamy oak seamlessly integrated with ripe red fruit. Spicy notes emerge alongside toasty characteristics and complex dry nut aromas, indicative of extended barrel aging. The oak influence is present but refined, complementing rather than dominating the fruit core. Classic Rioja aromas of tobacco, leather, and vanilla develop alongside red cherry and plum, creating a sophisticated, multi-layered bouquet that speaks to the wine's maturity.", "finish": "The long finish showcases the wine's excellent structure with persistent fine bitter notes, toasted oak, and lingering ripe fruit. The extended aging provides a smooth, refined conclusion that demonstrates the wine's quality and careful craftsmanship.", "palate": "Rich flavor dominates the palate with good structure providing a solid framework for the evolved fruit character. The wine shows remarkable integration of oak and fruit, with ripe red berries, spice, and toasty notes working in harmony. Good concentration and body create satisfying weight on the mid-palate, while balanced acidity keeps the wine fresh despite its age. Fine bitter notes add complexity and prevent the wine from becoming overly sweet or heavy, characteristic of well-made Reserva."}
foodPairings: ["Roasted lamb shoulder with garlic and herbs", "Aged Manchego cheese with quince paste", "Slow-cooked beef stew with Rioja peppers", "Grilled pork tenderloin with mushroom sauce", "Traditional Spanish chorizo and bean stew (fabada)"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 30-45 minutes to allow the mature wine to breathe and the oak elements to integrate further. The wine is ready to drink but benefits from aeration.", "glassware": "Traditional Rioja glass or large Bordeaux-style glass to concentrate the evolved aromatics", "temperature": "62-64°F (17-18°C) to showcase the wine's complexity and integration"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Reserva with extended oak aging following traditional Rioja methods", "region": "Rioja DOCa, Spain", "vintage": "2016", "ageability": "Drink now through 2030. The 2016 vintage is in its prime drinking window, showing excellent integration of oak and fruit. Will hold well for another 5 years but is fully developed and ready to enjoy.", "grapeVariety": "Primarily Tempranillo with traditional Rioja blending grapes"}

name: Aratas Veneration Red Blend 2019
description: Aratas Veneration is an award-winning proprietary red blend earning 98 points and 'Best in Class' Double Gold Medal from the 2022 North Coast Wine Challenge. Crafted as a fruit-forward ensemble showcasing Napa Valley's expression of Petite Sirah and Syrah, the wine reflects a softer, more approachable style than typical Petite Sirah-based blends. Barrel aged for 18 months in Hungarian and French oak, then bottled unfiltered and unfined, this is a homage to American Heritage Petite Sirah.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents a generous display of dark fruit aromatics with Petite Sirah's characteristic black plum and blueberry notes complemented by Syrah's exotic spice and violet nuances. Soft vanilla and toasted oak undertones from the 18-month barrel aging integrate seamlessly without overwhelming the fruit-forward character. Hints of black pepper, graphite, and dark chocolate add complexity while maintaining an approachable, inviting profile. The wine's unfiltered nature contributes to aromatic depth and textural richness.", "finish": "The finish is long and fruit-driven with persistent dark berry flavors, gentle spice, and smooth tannins. The wine's approachable style ensures a satisfying conclusion without aggressive tannins, making it enjoyable now while retaining aging potential.", "palate": "Fruit-forward and purposefully softer in style, the palate showcases ripe blackberry, black plum, and dark cherry flavors with velvety texture. The blend's design emphasizes accessibility and drinkability while retaining Petite Sirah's natural concentration and depth. Syrah adds mid-palate complexity with peppery spice and meaty notes that enhance the wine's savory character. The Hungarian and French oak provide subtle structure and vanilla notes without dominating, while the unfined bottling creates a rich, textured mouthfeel. Despite the softer approach, the wine maintains excellent balance and prevents heaviness."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled New York strip steak with chimichurri", "Braised lamb shanks with rosemary and garlic", "BBQ beef short ribs with smoky sauce", "Wild boar ragu over pappardelle", "Aged Gouda or sharp cheddar cheese"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 30-60 minutes to integrate the flavors and soften any grip from the Petite Sirah. As an unfiltered wine, careful decanting will also separate any natural sediment.", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux glass to allow the generous fruit aromatics to develop and the wine to breathe", "temperature": "62-65°F (17-18°C) to showcase the fruit-forward character and smooth tannins"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Fruit-forward red blend, aged 18 months in Hungarian and French oak, unfiltered and unfined", "region": "Napa Valley, California", "vintage": "2019", "ageability": "Drink now through 2032. While designed for approachable enjoyment now, the wine's structure and concentration suggest 8-12 years aging potential. The fruit-forward style is accessible young but will develop additional complexity with time.", "grapeVariety": "Petite Sirah and Syrah blend"}

name: Wonderment Wines Pritchett’s Peak Rockpile Zinfandel 2017
description: From Sonoma's elevated Rockpile AVA, this Zinfandel showcases winemaker Stephanie Cook's commitment to terroir-specific wines that express each vineyard's distinctive character. Founded in 2011, Wonderment focuses on Heritage Zinfandel from premier sites, with Pritchett Peaks Vineyard producing wines since at least 2012. The 2017 vintage displays an elegant, Claret-style approach to Zinfandel rather than the high-alcohol powerhouses sometimes associated with Rockpile.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents a pretty, refined expression of Zinfandel with red fruit aromatics taking center stage—bright cherry, raspberry, and cranberry create an inviting, elegant bouquet. Peach notes add an intriguing stone fruit dimension rarely found in Zinfandel, along with classic baking spices including cinnamon, nutmeg, and clove. The wine's purple hue suggests vibrancy and concentration, while the aromatics lean toward finesse rather than power, showcasing Rockpile's high-elevation terroir.", "finish": "The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering red fruit, subtle spice, and bright acidity. The elegant tannins and balanced alcohol create a harmonious conclusion that showcases the wine's Claret-inspired style.", "palate": "Medium-bodied with exquisite acidity, the palate delivers an elegant and charming Claret-style interpretation of Zinfandel at 14.8% ABV. Red fruits dominate with bright cherry, red plum, and raspberry flavors complemented by subtle baking spice notes. The wine's exceptional acidity provides lift and freshness, preventing the weight and heat sometimes found in Rockpile Zinfandels. The structure is refined rather than massive, with fine-grained tannins and excellent balance creating a wine of elegance and charm. This approach emphasizes drinkability and food compatibility over sheer power."}
foodPairings: ["Roasted duck with cherry glaze", "Grilled pork chops with stone fruit compote", "Mushroom and herb-crusted lamb rack", "Turkey meatballs in tomato sauce", "Medium-aged cheddar or Comté cheese"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Brief 30-minute decanting recommended to open the aromatics and integrate the red fruit with baking spice notes. The wine's elegant style doesn't require extended aeration.", "glassware": "Burgundy-style glass to showcase the refined aromatics and medium-bodied character", "temperature": "60-63°F (16-17°C), slightly cooler to emphasize the wine's elegance and acidity"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Elegant, Claret-style Zinfandel emphasizing finesse over power", "region": "Rockpile AVA, Sonoma County, California", "vintage": "2017", "ageability": "Drink now through 2029. The 2017 vintage is approaching maturity and showing well now. The wine's elegant structure and excellent acidity suggest it will hold for another 5-7 years, developing additional complexity while retaining its charming character.", "grapeVariety": "100% Zinfandel from Pritchett Peaks Vineyard"}

name: Monte Real Cepas Viejas  (6 pack) 2021 5001599
description: This limited edition expression from Bodegas Riojanas showcases old-vine Tempranillo from two small vineyards in Cenicero—Los Paletones and El Plantizo—planted in the late 1970s at 470 meters elevation. Part of the Monte Real Vanguardia range, this wine undergoes 12 months of oak aging to develop complexity while allowing the concentrated character of nearly 50-year-old vines to shine. Bodegas Riojanas has crafted wine since 1890, bringing over a century of experience to this modern interpretation of Rioja.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose reveals a beautiful cherry red color with a violet rim, followed by aromas of ripe red and black fruit that showcase the concentration of old-vine Tempranillo. Vanilla notes emerge from the 12-month oak aging, intermingling with sweet spices and toffee characteristics. The calcareous clay soils of the vineyards contribute subtle mineral undertones, while the elevation and maturity of the vines provide aromatic complexity and depth. The wine presents a harmonious integration of fruit, oak, and terroir-driven elements.", "finish": "A sweet aftertaste lingers with persistent notes of ripe fruit, vanilla, and spice. The good structure ensures a long, satisfying finish that balances sweetness with refreshing acidity and fine tannins.", "palate": "Good acidity greets the entry, providing freshness and lift to the ripe fruit core. Sweet tannins coat the palate with a pleasant, approachable texture that makes the wine immediately enjoyable despite its structure. The wine is well-structured with good volume and body, showcasing the concentration that old vines naturally provide. Ripe red and black fruit flavors dominate, complemented by vanilla, spices, and subtle toffee notes from oak aging. The calcareous clay terroir adds complexity and prevents the wine from becoming overly sweet or heavy."}
foodPairings: ["Roasted leg of lamb with rosemary and garlic", "Grilled chorizo with Piquillo peppers", "Manchego cheese aged 12-18 months", "Slow-cooked pork shoulder with Spanish spices", "Wild mushroom and Iberico ham croquettes"]

name: Free Spirits N/A Negroni Cans   250 ml
description: This ready-to-drink non-alcoholic Negroni from Free Spirits (less than 0.5% ABV) delivers the classic bitter-sweet complexity of Italy's iconic cocktail without the alcohol. Crafted with award-winning non-alcoholic alternatives that replicate bitter red aperitif, herbal gin botanicals, and sweet vermouth, the drink includes B-Vitamins (B3, B6, B12) and capsaicin to simulate the warming effect of alcohol. This represents a serious approach to alcohol-free cocktails for mindful drinking occasions.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents the distinctive aromatics of a classic Negroni with bitter herbal notes, botanical complexity, and subtle citrus undertones. Orange zest provides bright, uplifting aromatics while herbal elements reminiscent of gin botanicals add depth and interest. The bitter red aperitif character comes through clearly, creating an authentic Negroni nose that doesn't compromise on complexity despite the absence of alcohol. Subtle sweet vermouth notes round out the bouquet with hints of spice and vanilla.", "finish": "The finish is smooth and lingering with a pleasantly bittersweet aftertaste characteristic of a traditional Negroni. Botanical notes persist alongside orange zest, creating a satisfying conclusion that invites another sip. The warming effect from capsaicin continues gently through the finish.", "palate": "A harmonious blend of bitter and sweet notes greets the palate, delivering the perfectly balanced flavor profile that defines a well-made Negroni. Hints of botanicals including juniper, coriander, and angelica root provide the herbal complexity typically contributed by gin. Orange zest adds bright citrus notes that lift the palate, while subtle herbal undertones from the aperitif component create layers of flavor. The capsaicin provides a gentle warming sensation on the palate that mimics the heat of alcohol without any harshness. The drink maintains impressive complexity and depth for a non-alcoholic offering."}
foodPairings: ["Italian antipasti with cured meats and olives", "Prosciutto-wrapped melon or figs", "Marinated artichoke hearts and sun-dried tomatoes", "Aged Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese", "Smoked salmon crostini with capers"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No preparation needed. Pour cold directly from the can over ice with an orange twist garnish for the classic Negroni presentation. Best consumed fresh. Check production date on can and consume within shelf life for optimal flavor.", "grapeVariety": "N/A - Non-alcoholic spirits blend (bitter aperitif, botanical gin alternative, sweet vermouth alternative)"}

name: Monte Real Crianza 2022
description: Monte Real represents one of Rioja's most established and respected producers, and this 2022 Crianza showcases the house style of balance, elegance, and food-friendly structure. While unusually young for Crianza release (typically requiring minimum aging until the third year after harvest), this wine demonstrates the fresh, vibrant character of modern Rioja with classic oak aging.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose reveals quintessential Rioja characteristics with bright red cherry, wild strawberry, and cranberry fruit layered with classic American oak signatures of vanilla pod, coconut, and sweet tobacco. Floral notes of violet and dried rose petals add elegance, while earthy undertones of leather, tea leaf, and subtle balsamic hints speak to the region's traditional winemaking. A whisper of white pepper and Mediterranean herbs adds complexity to the youthful fruit expression.", "finish": "The finish is clean and refreshing with persistent red fruit character and a gentle grip of tannins that invite another sip. Subtle spice notes and a touch of bright acidity linger, while the oak influence provides structure without weight, exemplifying the elegant style Monte Real is known for throughout Rioja.", "palate": "On the palate, this Crianza displays medium body with lively acidity that makes it immediately accessible and food-versatile. Flavors of tart red cherry, pomegranate, and red plum dominate, supported by fine-grained tannins that show the polish of oak aging without excessive extraction. The oak influence brings notes of cinnamon stick, vanilla cream, and a hint of dill, beautifully integrated with the fruit. A savory thread of dried tomato and mineral salinity runs through the mid-palate, adding dimension."}
foodPairings: ["Jamón ibérico and aged Spanish cheeses", "Roasted lamb chops with rosemary and garlic", "Grilled chorizo with piquillo peppers", "Patatas bravas and Spanish tapas selection", "Mushroom and Manchego empanadas"]

wineDetails: {"style": "Crianza (aged minimum 12 months in oak, with at least 6 months in American oak barrels typical for Monte Real)", "region": "Rioja DOCa, Spain", "vintage": "2022", "ageability": "Drinking well now through 2028; Crianza-level Rioja is designed for near-term enjoyment while developing savory complexity over the next few years", "grapeVariety": "Tempranillo-dominant blend, likely with Garnacha and/or Graciano"}

name: Rueda Reina De Castilla Oak Aged Verdejo 2019
description: A distinctive expression of Verdejo from Spain's premier white wine region, Rueda, showcasing the grape's ability to develop complexity through oak aging. This wine represents the modern approach to Verdejo, balancing the varietal's characteristic freshness with added richness and texture from barrel fermentation and aging.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose reveals a sophisticated interplay between fresh fruit and oak-derived complexity. Opening with bright citrus notes of grapefruit and lemon zest, the aromatics evolve to include ripe stone fruit—particularly white peach and apricot. The oak aging contributes subtle vanilla and toasted hazelnut nuances, while a distinct mineral edge reminiscent of wet stone or flint adds terroir character. Delicate herbal undertones of fennel and fresh herbs provide additional complexity, while white flower notes (acacia, orange blossom) lend elegance to the bouquet.", "finish": "The finish is lengthy and refined, with lingering citrus and mineral notes supported by subtle oak influence. Bright acidity keeps the palate fresh through the close, while gentle vanilla and toasted nut flavors fade slowly. A slight bitter almond note adds sophistication, characteristic of well-made Verdejo.", "palate": "On the palate, the wine displays excellent balance between richness and freshness. The entry is clean with vibrant acidity characteristic of high-altitude Rueda vineyards, immediately refreshing the palate. Flavors of green apple, citrus fruits, and ripe pear dominate, enhanced by a creamy, slightly buttery texture from oak aging and possible lees contact. The mid-palate shows honeyed notes and hints of sweet spice, while maintaining the crisp, mineral-driven character that defines quality Verdejo. The oak integration is seamless, adding body and complexity without masking the varietal's natural brightness and herbal qualities."}
foodPairings: ["Pan-seared scallops with brown butter and herbs", "Grilled sea bass with lemon and olive oil", "Creamy risotto with mushrooms and parmesan", "Roasted chicken with garlic and white wine sauce", "Aged Manchego cheese or sheep's milk cheeses from Castilla"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Not necessary, but benefits from serving in a decanter or allowing 10-15 minutes in the glass to open up oak-derived aromas", "glassware": "White Burgundy glass or medium-sized white wine glass to allow aromatics to develop while maintaining freshness", "temperature": "10-12°C (50-54°F) to showcase both the fresh fruit character and oak complexity"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Oak-aged white wine with balanced richness and fresh acidity", "region": "Rueda DO, Castilla y León, Spain", "vintage": "2019", "ageability": "Best consumed within 2-4 years of vintage; drink 2019 now through 2025 to enjoy oak integration while maintaining freshness", "grapeVariety": "100% Verdejo (oak-aged)"}

name: Bierzo Pilgrim Mencia 2021
description: A vibrant red wine from Spain's Bierzo region, honoring the ancient pilgrimage route of El Camino de Santiago. Produced by Bodegas Godelia, this 100% Mencía showcases the grape's fresh, aromatic character and the unique terroir of Bierzo, where slate soils and continental climate create wines of elegance and minerality.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is intensely aromatic and wonderfully fresh, displaying the floral character that makes Mencía so distinctive. Cherry red in color with violet reflections, the wine opens with beautiful red fruit aromas of strawberry, raspberry, and bright red cherry. Floral notes of violet and rose petal provide elegance, while hints of pomegranate and wild berry add complexity. Subtle herbal nuances of Mediterranean scrubland and dried herbs emerge, along with delicate spice notes of black pepper and licorice. A mineral edge reminiscent of crushed slate or wet stone reflects the region's unique terroir, adding depth to the aromatic profile.", "finish": "The finish is clean and moderately long, with persistent red fruit and floral notes. The tannins are soft yet present, providing gentle grip without astringency. Mineral and spice notes linger, along with a refreshing acidity that invites another sip. The wine leaves a bright, fresh impression on the palate.", "palate": "Fresh and lively on the palate, this Mencía bursts with vibrant red fruit flavors that mirror the nose. Sour cherry, red currant, and pomegranate dominate, delivered with purity and precision. The wine's medium body provides enough substance to carry the fruit without feeling heavy, while bright acidity keeps everything fresh and energetic. Peppery spice notes weave through the mid-palate, adding interest and complexity. A characteristic bitter cherry pit flavor from the wine's fine-grained tannins provides structure and a slightly savory quality. The subtle minerality—described as crushed gravel or granite-like—adds texture and a sense of place, making this distinctly a wine of Bierzo."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled chorizo or Spanish charcuterie board", "Roasted game birds such as quail or partridge", "Veal scallopini with mushroom sauce", "Venison stew or deer tenderloin", "Aged sheep's milk cheese from León"]

wineDetails: {"style": "Fresh, aromatic red wine with vibrant fruit and mineral character", "region": "Bierzo DO, Castilla y León, Spain", "vintage": "2021", "ageability": "Best consumed within 3-5 years to enjoy primary fruit and floral character; 2021 drinking well now through 2026", "grapeVariety": "100% Mencía"}

name: Ontanon Tempranillo Blanco (White) 2023
description: A remarkable expression of Tempranillo Blanco, a rare white mutation of red Tempranillo found exclusively in Rioja. This 2023 vintage showcases the grape's elegant character with exceptional freshness and structure. Awarded 90 points by James Suckling and 91 by Planet Grape, it represents the innovative spirit of Bodegas Ontañón.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with inviting tropical notes of fresh pineapple and ripe banana, complemented by cooking apple aromas. White nectarine and green plum provide a stone fruit dimension, while delicate hints of white blossom and orange blossom add floral elegance. Subtle touches of sea spray and dried pineapple bring complexity, creating a multifaceted aromatic profile that is both vibrant and refined.", "finish": "Clean and structured with a medium to full length. The stone fruit flavors persist through a fresh, balanced conclusion marked by crisp acidity and a pleasant phenolic backbone that provides definition and staying power.", "palate": "Light to medium-bodied with remarkable texture and phenolic structure unusual for white wine. The palate delivers crisp lemon zest and apricot flavors alongside banana chip and ripe stone fruit characters. A creamy touch provides volume in the mouth, balanced by vital acidity that keeps the wine fresh and lifted. The wine shows both elegance and substance, with a slightly tannic quality that adds grip and interest."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled white fish with citrus herb butter", "Seared scallops with tropical fruit salsa", "Roasted chicken with apple and fennel", "Creamy seafood risotto", "Fresh goat cheese with stone fruit"]

name: Domaine du Vieux College Fixin Rouge Les Champs des Charmes 2021
description: A distinguished Burgundian Pinot Noir from the Fixin appellation, crafted from vines over 45 years old grown on clay-limestone soils. This 2021 vintage scored 91/100 from critics and represents the quality and terroir expression that Domaine du Vieux Collège consistently delivers from this special lieu-dit.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet opens with a beautiful array of summer flowers and sour cherries, creating an immediately appealing aromatic profile. Dark garnet with purple hues in the glass, the nose reveals sweet plum and red berry notes intertwined with delicate floral characteristics. Black fruit aromas of cherry and cassis emerge, accompanied by subtle herbal spiciness that adds complexity and intrigue.", "finish": "Long and supple with a velvety texture. The red berry flavors persist through the conclusion, supported by refined tannins and bright acidity that ensures the wine finishes clean and elegant with excellent length.", "palate": "Medium to full-bodied with impressive volume and texture. The palate is marked by crushed red berries and sweet plum flavors, structured with fine-grained tannins that provide grip without harshness. Fresh acidity deftly lifts the wine, maintaining balance and energy throughout. Mild herbal spice notes weave through the fruit, while the clay-limestone terroir imparts a mineral quality and well-kept freshness that is characteristic of quality Fixin."}
foodPairings: ["Coq au vin with pearl onions and mushrooms", "Duck breast with cherry gastrique", "Grilled lamb chops with herb crust", "Mushroom and truffle risotto", "Époisses or other washed-rind cheeses"]

name: Mate Mania Cabernet Sauvignon IGT Toscana 2022
description: Mate Mania's Cabernet Sauvignon represents a modern expression of this international variety in Tuscany's diverse terroir, where the variety thrives in warmer microclimates. This 2022 IGT Toscana offers approachable fruit-forward character with Tuscan personality, showcasing the region's ability to produce vibrant, contemporary wines alongside its traditional Sangiovese-based offerings.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose bursts with exuberant aromas of ripe blackberry, cassis, and black cherry, accented by characteristic Cabernet notes of green bell pepper and fresh mint that speak to the variety's herbaceous character. Underlying Tuscan influences emerge with scents of dried Mediterranean herbs, sun-warmed earth, and a hint of wild fennel. Subtle oak integration brings whispers of vanilla and mocha, while the youthful 2022 vintage shows vibrant floral notes of violet alongside the concentrated fruit.", "finish": "The finish shows good length with persistent dark fruit and a drying tannic grip that calls for food pairing. A pleasant herbal note of dried oregano and bay leaf lingers alongside the fruit, while bright acidity keeps the wine fresh and vibrant despite its full body.", "palate": "The palate is full and generous, showcasing the warmth of the 2022 Tuscan vintage with concentrated flavors of blackcurrant, ripe plum, and dark cherry compote. The wine's youth is evident in its fresh acidity and bright fruit character, while medium-plus tannins provide structure with a slightly grippy, textured mouthfeel. Tuscan terroir contributes earthy notes of dried sage, leather, and dusty minerality that complement the primary fruit, while judicious oak aging adds layers of sweet spice, cocoa, and a creamy mid-palate texture."}
foodPairings: ["Bistecca alla Fiorentina (Florentine T-bone steak)", "Wild boar ragu with pappardelle pasta", "Grilled portobello mushrooms with aged Pecorino", "Herb-crusted rack of lamb with roasted vegetables", "Aged Tuscan pecorino and salumi platter"]

name: Spicy Wings Tango with Me White NV
description: Spicy Wings Tango with Me White is a playful, food-focused non-vintage white blend designed specifically to complement spicy cuisine and casual dining. The whimsical branding suggests an approachable, fun wine that doesn't take itself too seriously while delivering refreshing acidity and aromatic character to pair with bold, spicy flavors.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is immediately engaging with bright aromatics of fresh lime zest, green apple, and white grapefruit, creating an invigorating citrus-forward impression. Tropical hints of pineapple and lychee add exotic appeal, while subtle floral notes of jasmine and orange blossom contribute perfumed elegance. A whisper of fresh-cut grass and wet stone minerality provides an earthy counterpoint to the exuberant fruit, suggesting possible Sauvignon Blanc or Riesling influence in the blend.", "finish": "The finish is clean and zippy with lingering citrus notes and bright acidity that leaves the palate refreshed and ready for another bite of spicy food. A subtle hint of sweetness persists alongside the citrus, while the wine's light body ensures it doesn't overwhelm lighter dishes.", "palate": "The palate delivers crisp, refreshing flavors with mouthwatering acidity that's perfectly calibrated to cut through spicy foods and refresh the palate. Primary flavors include tart green apple, Meyer lemon, and white peach, with a subtle tropical undertone of passion fruit and guava adding depth. The wine shows light body with a slightly off-dry character (likely 5-10 g/L residual sugar) that provides just enough sweetness to tame heat while maintaining refreshing balance. A mineral salinity runs through the mid-palate, adding texture and interest."}
foodPairings: ["Buffalo wings with blue cheese dressing (as the name suggests)", "Thai green curry with chicken or shrimp", "Korean fried chicken with gochujang sauce", "Spicy tuna or salmon poke bowls", "Jalapeño poppers and spicy appetizers"]
