name: Grateful Palate Bless Your Heart NV
description: The Grateful Palate's Bless Your Heart represents a southern-spirited wine with charm and character, designed to bring joy and approachability to everyday drinking. The playful name suggests a wine that doesn't take itself too seriously while delivering quality and personality, likely showcasing fruit-forward character and smooth drinkability.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet opens with welcoming aromas of ripe strawberry, fresh raspberry, and red cherry, creating an immediately approachable and friendly nose. Floral notes of rose petals and honeysuckle add southern charm, while subtle hints of watermelon candy and cotton candy suggest a slightly sweet profile. Underlying nuances of vanilla wafer and a whisper of white pepper add gentle complexity without diminishing the wine's easy-going nature.", "finish": "The finish is gentle and fruit-driven with lingering berry flavors and a touch of sweetness that makes the wine comfortable and crowd-pleasing. Soft acidity provides enough lift to keep the wine refreshing, while the absence of harsh tannins or sharp edges ensures a smooth, pleasant conclusion.", "palate": "On the palate, the wine delivers soft, fruit-forward flavors with gentle structure designed for broad appeal. Primary flavors include juicy red berries, sweet cherry, and hints of strawberry jam, balanced by modest acidity that keeps the wine from becoming cloying. A subtle sweetness (likely semi-sweet profile with noticeable residual sugar) makes this highly approachable for those new to wine or preferring softer styles. The texture is smooth and rounded with minimal tannins, creating a silky, easy-drinking mouthfeel."}

name: Zephaniah Rose 2024
description: Zephaniah Rose 2024 represents a fresh, vibrant expression of rosé winemaking with the exuberance and energy of a just-released vintage. This wine embodies the modern approach to rosé—crisp, aromatic, and designed for immediate pleasure, perfect for warm weather enjoyment and versatile food pairing.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose sparkles with vivacious aromas of fresh wild strawberries, watermelon, and white peach, creating an instantly appealing and summery bouquet. Delicate floral notes of rose petal, orange blossom, and white flowers add elegance, while subtle hints of fresh herbs like basil and tarragon provide a savory counterpoint. A whisper of pink grapefruit zest and crushed raspberries adds brightness, while underlying minerality suggests careful vineyard selection and gentle pressing techniques.", "finish": "The finish is clean and refreshing with persistent red berry notes and zingy acidity that leaves the palate invigorated. A subtle herbal quality and mineral edge linger alongside the fruit, while the wine's brightness invites another sip, making it dangerously easy to drink.", "palate": "On the palate, this rosé delivers refreshing, mouthwatering character with vibrant acidity that makes it exceptionally food-friendly and thirst-quenching. Primary flavors include crisp strawberry, raspberry, and cranberry with undertones of nectarine and citrus peel. The wine shows light to medium body with a dry to off-dry profile, likely with minimal residual sugar to maintain elegance. A mineral salinity runs through the mid-palate, adding complexity and structure, while the wine's fresh, youthful character speaks to the just-released 2024 vintage."}

name: Oceano Pinot Noir 2021
description: Oceano Pinot Noir captures the essence of coastal viticulture where ocean influences moderate temperatures and create ideal conditions for this finicky variety. The 2021 vintage showcases the elegant, aromatic character Pinot Noir achieves in maritime climates, with bright acidity, silky texture, and layers of red fruit complexity.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is quintessentially Pinot Noir with alluring aromatics of ripe red cherry, wild strawberry, and cranberry compote, accented by floral notes of rose petal and hibiscus tea. Coastal influences bring subtle maritime minerality and a whisper of sea salt, while earthy undertones of forest floor, mushroom, and damp soil add complexity. Subtle oak integration contributes hints of sandalwood, clove, and vanilla without overwhelming the delicate fruit, while a distinctive note of dried herbs and tea leaf speaks to the variety's savory side.", "finish": "The finish is persistent and refined with lingering red fruit flavors and a gentle grip of fine-grained tannins. A savory quality of dried herbs and umami richness appears in the conclusion, while the wine's natural acidity keeps everything fresh and balanced. The coastal terroir signature of mineral salinity extends through the finish, leaving a clean, elegant impression.", "palate": "The palate is elegant and medium-bodied with the silky texture that defines well-made Pinot Noir. Bright flavors of red cherry, raspberry, and pomegranate dominate, supported by vibrant acidity that provides lift and freshness throughout. The wine shows excellent balance between fruit intensity and earthy complexity, with flavors of beetroot, black tea, and subtle truffle emerging in the mid-palate. Coastal influence is evident in the wine's bright, focused character and distinctive saline minerality that adds dimension to the red fruit core."}
foodPairings: ["Pan-seared duck breast with cherry gastrique", "Grilled salmon with mushroom cream sauce", "Roasted chicken with root vegetables and herbs", "Mushroom and truffle risotto", "Soft-ripened cheeses like Brie or Camembert"]

wineDetails: {"style": "Medium-bodied, elegant coastal Pinot Noir emphasizing finesse over power", "region": "Coastal region (likely California Central Coast, Sonoma Coast, or similar maritime-influenced appellation)", "vintage": "2021", "ageability": "Drinking well now through 2028; the 2021 vintage is approaching its prime and will develop additional savory complexity over the next few years", "grapeVariety": "100% Pinot Noir"}

name: Domaine Chevallier Chablis 2022
description: Domaine Chevallier's Chablis exemplifies the pure, mineral-driven expression of Chardonnay that has made this northern Burgundy appellation world-renowned. The 2022 vintage captures Chablis' signature steely character, with the region's ancient Kimmeridgian limestone soils imparting distinctive chalky minerality and razor-sharp precision to unoaked or lightly oaked Chardonnay.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is characteristically restrained yet complex, opening with aromas of green apple, fresh lemon, and white peach alongside pronounced mineral notes of wet stones, crushed oyster shell, and chalk dust that define classic Chablis. Delicate floral hints of white flowers and acacia blossom add elegance, while subtle notes of fresh herbs, lemon verbena, and a whisper of honeycomb speak to the wine's complexity. The maritime influence of Chablis' northerly location is evident in the wine's saline quality and bracing freshness.", "finish": "The finish is long, clean, and mineral-focused with persistent citrus notes and a pronounced saline quality that leaves the mouth watering. The wine's high acidity ensures a refreshing conclusion, while the distinctive chalk and limestone minerality lingers impressively, inviting contemplation and food pairing.", "palate": "The palate is taut, focused, and intensely mineral-driven with flavors of Granny Smith apple, Meyer lemon, and unripe pear balanced by Chablis' signature flinty minerality. Razor-sharp acidity provides structure and energy, cutting through with precision while showcasing the 2022 vintage's freshness and tension. The wine shows medium body with excellent phenolic texture—a slightly chalky, almost saline mouthfeel that adds dimension beyond simple fruit. Subtle notes of wet stone, iodine, and sea spray reinforce the terroir-driven character."}
foodPairings: ["Freshly shucked oysters with mignonette", "Poached sole or turbot with beurre blanc", "Goat cheese crottin with honey and walnuts", "Grilled prawns with garlic and parsley", "Chicken in cream sauce with mushrooms (poulet à la crème)"]

name: Maison Ventenac Reserve de Jeanne 2020
description: A harmonious blend from the Cabardès appellation where Atlantic and Mediterranean influences converge. This approachable yet structured red showcases the estate's commitment to terroir-driven winemaking with high-density plantings yielding concentrated fruit. Tank-aged to preserve vibrant fruit character while developing complexity.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with restrained elegance, presenting fresh aromatics that convey a sense of vitality and purity. Initial scents of ripe red berries emerge alongside subtle floral undertones of violet and lavender. As the wine breathes, gentle whispers of aniseed and liquorice add complexity, while a delicate herbal note reminiscent of garrigue brings a Mediterranean character to the aromatic profile.", "finish": "The finish is clean and moderately persistent, with lingering notes of dark fruit and a gentle tannic grip. A subtle mineral edge emerges at the close, reflecting the terroir, while soft spice echoes fade gracefully. This is a wine that rewards both immediate enjoyment and short-term cellaring.", "palate": "More expressive than the nose suggests, the palate reveals a sunny disposition with flavors of blackberries and plums taking center stage. Pleasant sweetness balances the wine's tannic structure, which remains lively and requires patience to fully integrate. The medium body carries juicy fruit forward with finesse, while subtle spice notes weave through the mid-palate. Fine-grained tannins provide framework without overwhelming the fruit's natural generosity."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled lamb chops with herbes de Provence", "Cassoulet with duck confit and white beans", "Aged Manchego or Comté cheese", "Herb-crusted pork tenderloin", "Ratatouille with Italian sausage"]

wineDetails: {"style": "Medium-bodied red blend with fresh fruit character and structured tannins", "region": "Cabardès AOC, Languedoc-Roussillon, France", "vintage": "2020", "ageability": "Drinking window 2023-2027; best consumed within 5 years of vintage to preserve freshness while allowing tannins to integrate", "grapeVariety": "60% Cabernet Franc, 40% Syrah"}

name: Les Brebis Eola Hills Pinot Noir 2018
description: A bold expression of Oregon Pinot Noir from the esteemed Eola Hills region, where cool-climate conditions create wines of intensity and character. This wine showcases the Willamette Valley's ability to produce Pinot Noir with both power and elegance, aged in a combination of French and American oak barrels.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents an assertive and spicy character with prominent coffee bean aromatics intertwining with ripe dark fruit. Unlike subtle Burgundian expressions, this Oregon Pinot announces itself boldly with concentrated blackberry and cherry scents. The oak influence is evident but integrated, contributing vanilla and toasted notes. Underlying hints of forest floor, dried herbs, and a whisper of cola spice add layers of complexity to the aromatic profile.", "finish": "The finish is robust and persistent, with coffee and dark fruit flavors lingering alongside gentle oak-derived sweetness. Soft tannins provide structure without astringency, while balanced acidity keeps the wine from feeling heavy. The close echoes with dark chocolate and dried cherry notes, leaving a satisfying and mouth-coating impression.", "palate": "Big-shouldered and expansive on the palate, this is Pinot Noir with presence and structure. A wide seam of roasted coffee runs through the core, anchoring ripe and juicy flavors of blackberry and black cherry. The fruit expression leans toward the dark and concentrated rather than delicate red fruits. American oak contributes sweet vanilla and slight coconut notes, while French oak adds spice and subtle toast. The wine's generous body carries substantial flavor concentration, making this an everyday Pinot with plenty of character to enjoy."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled salmon with teriyaki glaze", "Roasted duck breast with cherry sauce", "Mushroom risotto with truffle oil", "Bacon-wrapped pork loin", "Oregon cheddar or aged Gouda cheese"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Not required but benefits from 15-20 minutes of aeration in the glass to soften oak influence and open aromatics", "glassware": "Burgundy-style glass with wide bowl to capture the wine's bold aromatics and allow for proper aeration", "temperature": "14-16°C (57-61°F) to balance fruit intensity with structural elements"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Bold, fruit-forward Oregon Pinot Noir with oak influence", "region": "Eola Hills AVA, Willamette Valley, Oregon (95% Willamette Valley fruit)", "vintage": "2018", "ageability": "Ready to drink now; best consumed within 2-4 years to enjoy primary fruit character and oak integration", "grapeVariety": "100% Pinot Noir"}

name: Barcelona Lolea White Spritz NV
description: A refreshing and artisan white sangria spritz crafted from quality Macabeo and Chardonnay wines blended with natural citrus juices and a hint of vanilla. This light-bodied, slightly sparkling beverage captures the vibrant spirit of Barcelona in a bottle, perfect for warm weather enjoyment and casual gatherings.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is immediately inviting with bright and charming aromatics of citrus and white flowers dominating the bouquet. Fresh lemon zest and orange blossom create a perfumed quality, while peach and pear notes add fruit character. A subtle herbal background provides depth, with hints of chamomile and lemon verbena adding complexity. The delicate vanilla accent contributes a sweet creaminess to the aromatic profile without overwhelming the fresh fruit and floral elements.", "finish": "Light and bubbly, the finish leaves a delicately sweet impression with lingering citrus essence and floral notes. The carbonation lifts the flavors, creating a clean close that invites the next sip. Subtle hints of vanilla and white fruit fade gently, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for more.", "palate": "Effervescent and refreshing on the palate, the wine delivers a sparkling experience with fine, gentle bubbles that dance across the tongue. The entry is crisp with vibrant acidity balanced by natural fruit sweetness from the citrus juices. Flavors of white peach, ripe pear, and juicy orange segments combine with the wine's inherent character. The Macabeo and Chardonnay base provides structure and body, while the vanilla adds a soft, rounded quality. The sweetness level is moderate—present but not cloying—with enough acidity to maintain freshness and drinkability."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh fruit platters with citrus and melon", "Grilled shrimp tapas with garlic and lemon", "Light Caesar salad or mixed greens", "Spanish tortilla or patatas bravas", "Soft cheeses like fresh mozzarella or young manchego"]

Serve within 1 year of purchase for optimal freshness", "grapeVariety": "Macabeo and Chardonnay blend with natural orange and lemon juice, vanilla extract"}

name: Darms Lane Chardonnay, Oak Knoll District 2023
description: A classically styled Napa Valley Chardonnay from the cool-climate Oak Knoll District, where morning fog and afternoon breezes create ideal conditions for balanced, elegant wines. Sourced primarily from the estate Bon Passe Vineyard, this wine exemplifies California Chardonnay at its most expressive, with generous oak treatment balanced by natural acidity.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is immediately captivating and multifaceted, opening with an exotic array of tropical fruits including fresh pineapple, ripe passion fruit, and honeycomb. These vibrant tropical notes are beautifully complemented by orchard fruits—particularly yellow peaches, apricots, and ripe Bartlett pears. The generous oak regime contributes layers of complexity with toasted hazelnut, butterscotch, and vanilla bean aromas. A streak of lemon meringue adds brightness, while subtle hints of crème brûlée and baking spice round out the opulent aromatic profile.", "finish": "The finish is crisp, clean, and surprisingly refreshing despite the wine's opulent style. Citrus notes persist alongside creamy vanilla and toasted oak flavors, while the wine's natural acidity provides lift and balance. The close is long and satisfying, with gentle fruit sweetness and oak spice fading harmoniously. A subtle mineral edge emerges at the very end, a signature of the Oak Knoll terroir.", "palate": "Rich and creamy on entry, the palate delivers the buttery character prized in California Chardonnay while maintaining remarkable balance thanks to the Oak Knoll District's cool climate. Full malolactic fermentation creates a luxurious, velvety texture that coats the palate. Flavors of ripe pear, creamy lemon curd, and fresh pineapple dominate, supported by the wine's medium-plus body. The oak influence is evident but well-integrated, providing structure and vanilla-tinged sweetness without overwhelming the fruit. Bright acidity cuts through the richness, preventing the wine from becoming heavy or cloying, while mineral undertones add complexity and length."}
foodPairings: ["Lobster with drawn butter and lemon", "Roasted chicken with herb butter under the skin", "Seared halibut with beurre blanc sauce", "Butternut squash ravioli with sage brown butter", "Creamy brie or triple-cream cheese with crackers"]

Can be poured 10 minutes before serving to allow aromatics to open", "glassware": "White Burgundy glass or large-bowled Chardonnay glass to showcase the wine's complex aromatics and allow for proper aeration", "temperature": "11-13°C (52-55°F) to balance the wine's richness with refreshing acidity"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Rich, creamy, oak-influenced Chardonnay with full malolactic fermentation", "region": "Oak Knoll District AVA, Napa Valley, California", "vintage": "2023", "ageability": "Best enjoyed young to appreciate primary fruit and oak integration; drink 2024-2028", "grapeVariety": "100% Chardonnay (primarily from Estate Bon Passe Vineyard)"}

name: ZaHa El Corte 2019
description: An exceptional red blend from the high-altitude Toko Vineyard in Paraje Altamira, Mendoza, crafted by TeHo winery. This wine showcases the elegance and complexity achievable at 1,200 meters elevation, where dramatic temperature variations and calcareous soils create wines of remarkable depth, finesse, and aging potential.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is sophisticated and multifaceted, opening with intense floral aromas of orange peel, rose petal, and violet that provide elegance and lift. Dark fruit notes of blackberry and black cherry emerge, complemented by red fruit nuances of cranberry that add brightness. The wine's complexity reveals itself through scents of tar and char from the oak aging, along with subtle eucalyptus that adds a cooling, herbal dimension. Mineral undertones reflect the unique terroir, while hints of graphite and crushed stone add further depth. Spice notes of black pepper, licorice, and sweet baking spice round out the aromatic profile.", "finish": "The finish is long and elegant, with persistent flavors of dark fruit, spice, and minerality. Subtle hints of mint and eucalyptus emerge at the close, providing a refreshing quality. The tannins remain soft and integrated, while the wine's balanced acidity ensures a clean, refined finish. Notes of dark chocolate and licorice linger, along with the wine's distinctive mineral character.", "palate": "Linear in structure yet full in expression, the palate displays remarkable depth and excellent balance that defines this wine's quality. The entry is silky and refined, with a texture that feels luxurious yet never heavy. Flavors of red and dark fruits dominate—black cherries, ripe blackberries, and cranberry—delivered with purity and intensity. Soft, fine-grained tannins provide framework without aggression, integrated seamlessly into the wine's structure. Harmonious acidity balances the fruit richness, ensuring the wine remains fresh and lively despite its concentration. Nuanced flavors of spice, licorice, and dark chocolate emerge in the mid-palate, while creamy notes add richness. The mineral edge persists throughout, adding complexity and a sense of place."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled Argentine ribeye steak with chimichurri", "Braised short ribs with red wine reduction", "Roasted lamb rack with herb crust", "Wild mushroom and truffle pasta", "Aged Manchego or hard sheep's milk cheese"]

wineDetails: {"style": "Elegant, high-altitude red blend with silky texture and mineral complexity", "region": "Paraje Altamira, Valle de Uco, Mendoza, Argentina (Toko Vineyard at 1,200m elevation)", "vintage": "2019", "ageability": "Excellent aging potential; drink 2024-2035. The 2019 vintage will continue to develop complexity over the next decade", "grapeVariety": "Malbec and Cabernet Sauvignon blend"}

name: Giustini Areale Primitivo di Manduria 2022
description: A powerful and generous Primitivo di Manduria from Tenuta Giustini's Areale line. This 2022 vintage reflects a challenging year where careful vineyard management resulted in a small, high-quality crop. Aged in French barrique before light filtration, the wine showcases the rich, warm character that has made Primitivo di Manduria famous.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Deep, intense aromas of ripe cherry and plum compote dominate the bouquet, creating an immediately appealing fruit-forward impression. Damson plum adds darker fruit tones, while tobacco and sweet spices provide complexity and sophistication. Fine roasted aromas from barrel aging complement the fruit, adding layers of vanilla and toasted oak. The overall aromatic profile is generous and shamelessly powerful, yet maintains elegance and balance.", "finish": "Long and warming with persistent cherry and plum fruit. Sweet tannins carry through the conclusion alongside roasted oak notes, creating a satisfying, full-bodied finish that showcases the wine's power while maintaining balance and drinkability.", "palate": "Big, firm, and correct in structure with rich cherry and damson fruit at the core. The palate is velvety and dense with lots of ripe fruit presented in a lush, warm package characteristic of Puglian Primitivo. Sweet, spicy tannins provide structure without harshness, while the generous style delivers impressive power and concentration. Plum compote flavors dominate alongside fresh cherry, perfectly rounded off by fine roasted notes from oak influence. The texture is mouth-filling and opulent."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled porterhouse steak with peppercorn sauce", "Braised short ribs with red wine reduction", "Pasta with wild boar ragù", "Aged Pecorino Romano cheese", "Barbecued lamb with rosemary"]

name: Dogwood & Thistle Merlot 2019
description: A refined Merlot from the 2019 vintage that showcases the variety's characteristic softness and approachability. This wine balances ripe fruit character with moderate tannins and acidity, displaying the hallmark velvety texture that makes Merlot such a versatile and popular choice.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet opens with inviting aromas of black cherry and plum, core characteristics of quality Merlot. Subtle notes of blackberry and cassis add depth and complexity to the fruit profile. Secondary aromas of cedar and tobacco leaf suggest careful oak aging, while hints of dark chocolate and mocha provide richness. Delicate herbal notes of mint and eucalyptus add freshness and lift to the nose.", "finish": "The finish is smooth and persistent with soft tannins that coat the palate. Echoes of dark fruit linger along with subtle oak-derived notes of chocolate and coffee. The wine's balanced acidity ensures a clean conclusion while the plush tannins invite another sip.", "palate": "Medium to full-bodied with the soft, lush tannins that define quality Merlot. The palate reveals flavors of ripe black plum, black cherry, and blackberry, showing excellent fruit concentration from the 2019 vintage. The wine's moderate alcohol and balanced acidity create a harmonious structure that's neither too heavy nor too light. Oak influence is well-integrated, adding complexity through notes of vanilla and spice without dominating the fruit. The velvety texture provides immediate pleasure while maintaining enough structure for short-term aging."}

Enhances aromatic complexity.", "glassware": "Medium to large red wine glass to allow proper aeration and aroma concentration", "temperature": "16-18°C (61-64°F) to showcase fruit while maintaining structure"}

name: Shabo Sparkling Classic Brut NV
description: A classic Brut sparkling wine crafted in the traditional method, offering crisp acidity and refined elegance. This non-vintage cuvée showcases the precision and balance that defines quality sparkling wine production, with fewer than 12 grams of residual sugar per liter ensuring a distinctly dry profile.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet reveals fresh aromas of green apple and citrus, hallmarks of quality Brut sparkling wines. Delicate notes of white flowers and brioche emerge, suggesting extended lees aging that adds complexity and depth. Subtle hints of almond and minerality provide additional layers of interest. The fine, persistent mousse releases these aromatics gradually, rewarding patient contemplation.", "finish": "The finish is clean, dry, and exceptionally refreshing with persistent fine bubbles. Citrus and apple notes linger along with a subtle mineral quality that cleanses the palate. The wine's bright acidity ensures a crisp conclusion perfect for stimulating the appetite.", "palate": "Crisp and refreshing on the palate with vibrant acidity that defines the Brut style. Flavors of lemon, green apple, and pear dominate the mid-palate, showing excellent purity of fruit. The wine's dry character—with fewer than 12 grams of sugar per liter—allows the natural acidity and fruit to shine without sweetness. Fine, persistent bubbles create a creamy texture that balances the wine's crisp structure. Subtle yeast-derived notes of bread and pastry add complexity from secondary fermentation and lees contact."}

name: Giustini Illuminato Fiano 2023
description: An aromatic and intensely flavored Fiano from Italy's Campania region. This 2023 vintage showcases the variety's hallmark characteristics of honey, spice, and floral notes, delivering the complexity and weight on the palate that makes Fiano one of southern Italy's most distinctive white varieties.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with intense, aromatic character that defines quality Fiano. Prominent honey notes lead the way, accompanied by delicate white flowers—jasmine and orange blossom—that add elegance and lift. Spice notes of white pepper and subtle nutmeg provide complexity, while hints of hazelnut suggest the wine's potential to develop with age. The aromatics are concentrated yet refined, showing the variety's hallmark intensity without heaviness.", "finish": "The finish is long and complex with lingering spice and nut flavors. Honey notes persist along with subtle mineral character. The wine's vibrant acidity ensures a clean conclusion while the intensity of flavor encourages contemplation.", "palate": "The palate delivers considerable weight and texture, a defining characteristic of well-made Fiano. Flavors of honey and ripe stone fruit—white peach and apricot—dominate the mid-palate, showing excellent fruit concentration from low-yielding vines. The wine's intense flavor profile is balanced by refreshing acidity that prevents any sense of heaviness. Hazelnut and almond notes add depth and complexity, while subtle mineral undertones speak to the wine's terroir. The texture is rich yet elegant, with a slight oily quality that enhances mouthfeel."}

Quality Fiano can develop for several years, with spicy and nutty notes intensifying with age. Can be enjoyed young or cellared for 5-7 years.", "grapeVariety": "Minimum 85% Fiano, possibly 100%"}

name: Conde Valdemar Balcon de Pilatos Maturana 2020
description: An exceptional single-varietal expression of Maturana, an almost-extinct grape variety that the Valdemar family rescued and revived beginning in 2001. Awarded 96 points by Wine Enthusiast as a "Hidden Gem" and named Best Spanish Red Wine of 2024 at the International Wine Challenge Industry Awards, this wine demonstrates the tremendous potential of this rare varietal grown at 500 meters elevation on limestone soils.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Complex and intense aromatics lead with black currant, pomegranate, and vibrant blackberry. Dried sage and Mediterranean herbs provide savory complexity, while orange zest adds citrus brightness. Slightly brambly dark berry aromas intermingle with sophisticated notes of cocoa, vanilla, and coconut from oak influence. Blueberry and black currant fruit is pure and concentrated, with subtle hints of aniseed adding an intriguing herbal dimension.", "finish": "Long and satisfying with plush tannins carrying through dark fruit, chocolate, and herbal notes. The fresh acidity keeps the finish vibrant while the fleshy texture and silky tannins provide a luxurious conclusion with excellent persistence.", "palate": "Tremendously fleshy texture defines the palate experience, with fantastically fresh and lively character driven by vital fruit acidity. Slightly brambly dark berry flavors open generously, followed by layers of bittersweet chocolate, cedar, and dried Mediterranean herbs. The wine is smooth and silky with impressive depth, wrapped in a layer of plush, velvety tannins that provide structure without heaviness. Notes of blackcurrant, blueberry, and pomegranate maintain fruit purity throughout, balanced by complex savory and spice elements."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled ribeye steak with herb butter", "Braised lamb shoulder with rosemary", "Wild mushroom and truffle pasta", "Aged Manchego cheese with quince paste", "Roasted duck with blackberry reduction"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "1-2 hours recommended to fully open the complex aromatics and soften the plush tannins", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux-style glass or generously bowled red wine glass", "temperature": "16-18°C (61-64°F)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Full-bodied, complex red with fleshy texture and vital acidity", "region": "Rioja DOCa, Spain (500m elevation limestone estate)", "vintage": "2020", "ageability": "Excellent aging potential; drink now through 2035 with proper cellaring", "grapeVariety": "100% Maturana (rare rescued varietal)"}

name: Adir Malbec
description: An Argentine Malbec showcasing the classic characteristics of this signature grape variety. While specific producer information is limited, this wine expresses the bold fruit character and structured tannins that have made Argentine Malbec internationally renowned, particularly from high-altitude vineyards where the varietal thrives.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with concentrated dark fruit aromas of blackberry and black plum, characteristic of quality Argentine Malbec. Ripe black cherry provides additional depth, while subtle notes of violet and dark chocolate add complexity. A touch of vanilla and sweet spice from oak aging integrates seamlessly with the fruit. The overall aromatic profile is bold and inviting with concentrated fruit purity.", "finish": "Long and smooth with persistent dark fruit flavors. Velvety tannins carry through alongside chocolate and oak notes, creating a satisfying conclusion with good length and a soft, approachable texture typical of Argentine Malbec.", "palate": "Full-bodied with rich, jammy dark fruit flavors dominating the palate. Blackberry, plum, and black cherry create a core of ripe fruit intensity, supported by moderate acidity that maintains freshness. Velvety tannins provide structure without aggressive grip, while notes of cocoa, mocha, and toasted oak add layers of complexity. The wine shows the characteristic smooth, round texture of well-made Malbec with good fruit concentration and balanced oak influence."}

name: Wonderment Wines Bacigalupi Petit Sirah 2014
description: An exceptional Petite Sirah from the renowned Bacigalupi Vineyard in Russian River Valley. This 2014 vintage was aged in Burgundy oak barrels and praised by Wine Enthusiast for its refinement and balance. Sourced from a sustainably farmed half-acre block of dry-farmed, hand-picked Foppiano clone vines aligned east to west along Westside Road, this wine represents California Petite Sirah at its most elegant.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose reveals refined aromatics with strawberry preserve at the forefront, an unusually delicate expression for Petite Sirah. Toasty oak integrates seamlessly, contributing notes of leather, cigar box, and cedar that add sophistication and complexity. The aromatic profile is layered and nuanced, showing excellent balance between fruit and oak influence while maintaining elegance rather than overwhelming power.", "finish": "Long and complex with strawberry fruit persisting alongside toasty oak, leather, and cedar. The soft, fulsome texture carries through the conclusion, while refined tannins provide structure without heaviness, creating a balanced and sophisticated finish.", "palate": "Refined and balanced rather than brutishly extracted, showcasing a more elegant style of Petite Sirah. Strawberry preserve flavors are wrapped in toasty oak, creating a harmonious marriage of fruit and wood. The texture is soft and fulsome, with richly layered mouthfeel that coats the palate. Leather, cigar box, and cedar notes from oak aging add complexity to the core fruit flavors. Despite Petite Sirah's reputation for massive structure, this wine achieves power through concentration and depth rather than aggressive tannins, making it ultimately delicious and approachable."}

name: Wooden Gift Box Monte Real Gran Reserva 1998
description: An exceptional limited edition Gran Reserva from Bodegas Riojanas, presented in a wooden gift box. This 1998 vintage was the first Monte Real made from 100% Tempranillo and remained in barrels for 40 months before release. With multiple 90+ point scores including 94 from Wine Enthusiast (Editors' Choice), 93 from Josh Raynolds, and 93 from Decanter, this wine represents the pinnacle of traditional Rioja craftsmanship. Only 23,000 bottles were produced.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Elegant and mature with classic primary Tempranillo aromas of bright, ripe black cherry complemented by licorice undertones and leathery hints. Floral cherry and raspberry notes emerge alongside aged wood aromas that are beautifully integrated. Pungent and spicy, the nose shows pure redcurrant and plum, succulent herbs, and vanillin oak spice. A hint of dried flowers adds delicacy, while toasty oak and traditional Rioja spice notes complete the complex aromatic tapestry. The overall impression is one of regal maturity and sophisticated evolution.", "finish": "Long and refined with dried cherry and plum persisting through a smooth, integrated conclusion. Gentle tannins and balanced acidity carry the wine to a classic Rioja finish marked by vanilla, spice, and leather notes alongside enduring red fruit character.", "palate": "In regal condition with smooth, integrated tannins and perfectly balanced acidity that speaks to excellent aging potential realized. Dried cherry and red plum create the fruit core, supported by herbs and vanilla in a classic Rioja flavor profile. Supple and lush with impressive depth, the palate shows sweet red fruit flavors framed by gentle, harmonious tannins. Fleshy and sweet on the mid-palate with impressive concentration and focus, while maintaining elegance throughout. The wine demonstrates how well this vintage has aged, with primary fruit still vibrant but enhanced by tertiary complexity."}
foodPairings: ["Roasted milk-fed lamb with herbs", "Aged Ibérico ham with Manchego", "Duck confit with cherry gastrique", "Wild mushroom and truffle dishes", "Aged sheep's milk cheeses"]

name: Domaine Bizet Sancerre Blanc 2023
description: A classic expression of Loire Valley Sauvignon Blanc from a family domaine managed since 2005 by Thibault Bizet and his mother Maryline. Crafted from vines averaging 25 years old across 7.25 hectares of diverse Sancerre terroirs, this wine embodies the mineral-driven, crystalline purity that defines the region's finest whites.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with vibrant aromas of grapefruit and gunflint, accompanied by enticing notes of tropical fruits, candied apricot, and ripe melon. Fresh wild herbs mingle with delicate floral nuances and soft minerality, while a distinctive crushed gravel character adds complexity. Subtle hints of coriander, sage, and palo santo bring an herbaceous dimension to this expressive bouquet.", "finish": "The finish is lively and intense, characterized by excellent minerality and good persistence. Aromatic notes resurface with a touch of spice, while the clean salinity and bright acidity leave the palate refreshed and invigorated. The balanced conclusion showcases both elegance and depth.", "palate": "On the palate, this medium-bodied wine displays a supple attack with notable body and structure. Waves of citrus, particularly lemon and lime, blend seamlessly with white-fleshed fruits including ripe yellow apple, pear, and melon rind. The wine's high acidity provides a tart, crisp backbone, while crushed gravel and clean salinity emerge mid-palate, reinforcing the terroir's mineral signature. The generous mouthfeel balances freshness with concentration."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh oysters and seafood platters", "Grilled sea bass with lemon and herbs", "Chavignol goat cheese (local specialty)", "Pan-seared scallops with citrus beurre blanc", "Asparagus and spring vegetable risotto"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting necessary; serve directly from the bottle to preserve freshness and aromatic intensity", "glassware": "Standard white wine glass or tulip-shaped Sauvignon Blanc glass to concentrate the mineral and citrus aromas", "temperature": "Serve fresh at 10°C (50°F)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Dry, mineral-driven Loire Valley white wine", "region": "Sancerre AOC, Upper Loire Valley, France", "vintage": "2023", "ageability": "Drink now through 2027. This wine is best enjoyed within 2-4 years of vintage to capture its vibrant fruit and crystalline minerality, though quality examples can develop additional complexity with careful cellaring.", "grapeVariety": "100% Sauvignon Blanc"}

name: Scheid Vineyards Rocklin Ranch Chardonnay 2023
description: A Monterey County Chardonnay from Scheid Family Wines' Rocklin Ranch, balancing cool-climate elegance with judicious oak influence. The wine receives partial barrel fermentation and malolactic fermentation, creating a style that bridges Old World restraint with New World fruit expression.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with bright yellow apple and crisp pear aromas, complemented by citrus notes of lemon zest and subtle grapefruit. Partial barrel fermentation contributes gentle hints of vanilla and salted butter, while subtle caramel undertones add richness without heaviness. The oak influence is measured and integrated, allowing the fresh fruit character to remain front and center. Subtle floral notes and a hint of toasted almond add aromatic complexity.", "finish": "Long and complex with persistent citrus and stone fruit flavors, finishing with vanilla notes and refreshing acidity that cleanses the palate.", "palate": "Medium-bodied with a vibrant acid structure that provides lift and energy, the palate showcases ripe orchard fruits—think baked apple, Asian pear, and white peach—balanced by bright citrus flavors. The malolactic fermentation adds creamy texture and subtle buttery notes without creating excessive richness, while smooth oak integration contributes vanilla, light toast, and gentle spice. The cool-temperature fermentation preserves freshness and natural acidity, creating a wine that feels balanced between fruit purity and subtle complexity. Minerality emerges mid-palate, adding dimension."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled halibut with lemon butter sauce", "Roasted chicken with herbs de Provence", "Lobster risotto with saffron", "Creamy pasta carbonara", "Aged Comté or Gruyère cheese"]

name: Bitch Bubbly (187ml) NV  187 ml
description: A playful sparkling rosé from Spain created by renowned winemaker Chris Ringland, who personally selects unoaked Chardonnay and Grenache from high-altitude, cool-climate vineyard sites. Grown on alluvial red-brown loams and white limestone mixed with rocky slate, this fun, party-ready bubbly delivers sweet fruit character and lively effervescence in a convenient mini-bottle format.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents an inviting bouquet of sweet red berries and strawberry mousse, accented by vibrant strawberry and citrus notes. Dark cherry and raspberry aromas add depth and complexity, while small, persistent bubbles release waves of fresh fruit character. The overall aromatic profile is bright, fruity, and immediately appealing.", "finish": "The finish is light, delicate, and medium in length, with persistent sweet raspberry flavors. Tart raspberry and black cherry notes transition to a unique grapefruit-with-sugar character that balances the wine's inherent sweetness with refreshing acidity. The conclusion is playful and satisfying.", "palate": "Sweet and exuberantly fruity on the palate, this sparkling rosé bursts with flavors of raspberries, sweet strawberries, and strawberry jam. Citrus notes of lemon and tart apple provide refreshing counterpoints to the red fruit core, while undertones of dark cherries and currants add dimension. A juicy yet balanced core reveals subtle spicy pepper and anise nuances that elevate the wine beyond simple sweetness."}

name: Sky Devil Malbec 2019
description: A robust Malbec showcasing the variety's characteristic dark fruit intensity and structured tannins. While Sky Devil Wines is primarily known for their California Bordeaux varietals from Knights Valley, Sonoma, and Napa Valley, this expression demonstrates the winery's ability to craft compelling wines with depth and character from Malbec grapes.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose reveals concentrated aromas of ripe blackberry, dark plum, and black cherry, complemented by notes of blueberry compote. Subtle hints of violet and lavender add floral elegance, while undertones of cocoa, espresso, and sweet baking spices—vanilla, cinnamon, and clove—emerge from oak influence. A whisper of leather and tobacco leaf adds complexity.", "finish": "The finish is long and satisfying, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually giving way to notes of espresso, dark chocolate, and subtle smoke. Firm but polished tannins lend grip and structure, suggesting excellent aging potential. The conclusion is both powerful and refined.", "palate": "Rich and full-bodied on the palate, this Malbec delivers bold flavors of blackberry jam, dark plum, and cassis. The wine's velvety texture is supported by ripe, well-integrated tannins that provide structure without harshness. Mid-palate notes of dark chocolate, mocha, and toasted oak blend seamlessly with the fruit core. A touch of black pepper and dried herbs adds savory complexity, while the wine's generous alcohol provides warmth and weight."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled ribeye steak with chimichurri sauce", "Braised short ribs with red wine reduction", "Lamb chops with rosemary and garlic", "Mushroom and truffle risotto", "Aged Manchego or sharp cheddar cheese"]

This wine is enjoyable upon release but will reward cellaring for 5-10 years, during which the tannins will soften and tertiary flavors of leather, tobacco, and dried fruit will emerge.", "grapeVariety": "100% Malbec"}

name: Zephaniah Cabernet Franc 2017
description: A bold, full-bodied Cabernet Franc from the oldest vines at Zephaniah Farm Vineyard, a third-generation working farm in Loudoun County, Virginia. This wine represents the estate's commitment to crafting wines with skill and passion, earning recognition including silver medals at the 2014 and 2015 Governor's Cup competitions.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is both powerful and elegant, opening with aromas of ripe blackberry and dark cherry, accented by notes of cassis and black plum. Layers of dried herbs—thyme, oregano, and bay leaf—mingle with subtle hints of green bell pepper, a hallmark of the variety. Undertones of cedar, tobacco leaf, and graphite add complexity, while a delicate floral note of violet provides lift.", "finish": "The finish is long and satisfying, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually transitioning to earthy notes of graphite, dried herbs, and subtle leather. The wine's balanced structure and lively acidity ensure a clean, refreshing conclusion that invites the next sip.", "palate": "Medium to full-bodied with a supple texture, the palate showcases vibrant flavors of blackberry, black cherry, and soft red fruit. The wine's structure is defined by fine-grained tannins that provide grip without astringency. Mid-palate notes of dried herbs and just a dusting of spice—black pepper and clove—add savory complexity. A refreshing edge of crisp acidity balances the ripe fruit, while subtle oak influence contributes nuances of vanilla and toasted wood."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled lamb chops with herb crust", "Roasted duck breast with cherry gastrique", "Mushroom and herb-stuffed pork tenderloin", "Aged Gruyère or sharp white cheddar", "Eggplant parmesan with fresh basil"]

name: Scarpetta Pinot Grigio DOC Friuli (NOVA only) 2023
description: A distinctive Pinot Grigio from Friuli-Venezia Giulia that transcends the variety's reputation for simplicity. Sourced from two distinct terroirs—the Grave and Colli Orientali zones—this wine showcases Pinot Grigio's ability to deliver both elegance and complexity. The combination of soil types yields a wine with body, bright acidity, and exceptional minerality.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with enticing aromas of ripe white peach, lychee, and ripe melon, complemented by notes of crisp apple and ripe pear. Citrus accents of lemon and lime zest add brightness, while delicate floral notes—white flowers and acacia—provide lift. A distinctive mineral character of wet stones and crushed gravel emerges, along with subtle hints of guava, coriander, sage, and palo santo that add herbal complexity. A faint salmon-pink hue in the glass hints at the wine's textural depth.", "finish": "The finish is clean and persistent, with lingering flavors of citrus, stone fruit, and minerals. The wine's bright acidity ensures a refreshing conclusion that leaves the palate invigorated and ready for the next bite or sip.", "palate": "Light on its feet yet surprisingly complex, the palate reveals flavors of stone fruits—white peach and apricot—and melon, balanced by crisp apple and citrus notes. The wine's medium body is supported by bright, refreshing acidity that provides structure and vibrancy. Mid-palate minerality—crushed gravel and saline notes—adds textural interest and reinforces the wine's terroir-driven character. The overall impression is one of elegance and precision, with each element in perfect harmony."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh crab cakes with lemon aioli", "Grilled calamari with herbs and olive oil", "Light seafood risotto with saffron", "Prosciutto di San Daniele with melon", "Fresh mozzarella and tomato salad with basil"]

This wine is best enjoyed within 2-3 years of vintage to capture its vibrant fruit, crisp acidity, and crystalline minerality.", "grapeVariety": "100% Pinot Grigio"}

name: Thelema Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
description: An elegant, complex Cabernet Sauvignon from one of Stellenbosch's leading producers. This wine showcases Thelema Mountain Vineyards' commitment to crafting world-class wines with meticulous attention to detail. The 2015 vintage earned a critics' score average of 91/100, with professional reviewers praising its balance of power and refinement.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is complex and inviting, revealing aromas of crème de cassis, dark blackcurrant, and ripe black plum, complemented by notes of red currant and dark cherry. Distinctive green leaf and bell pepper aromas add classic Cabernet character, while subtle hints of cigar wrapper spice, cedar, and tobacco leaf emerge. Undertones of graphite, dark chocolate, and espresso reflect the wine's 18 months in barrel, 45% of which was new French oak.", "finish": "The finish is long and satisfying, with persistent dark fruit flavors gradually transitioning to notes of espresso, dark chocolate, and cedar. Fine tannins lend grip and structure, suggesting excellent aging potential. The conclusion is both powerful and refined, leaving a lasting impression.", "palate": "Plush yet wonderfully elegant on the palate, this wine delivers concentrated flavors of cassis, blackcurrant, and dark plum, balanced by vibrant red currant and cherry notes. The wine's full body is supported by fine, silky tannins that provide structure without harshness, creating a very fresh and elegant style of Cabernet. Mid-palate notes of dark chocolate, mocha, and subtle oak spice add depth, while a touch of green bell pepper and dried herbs adds savory complexity. The wine's excellent balance ensures that power and finesse coexist harmoniously."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled ribeye steak with herb butter", "Braised lamb shanks with red wine reduction", "Roasted venison loin with juniper berry sauce", "Aged Gouda or sharp cheddar cheese", "Mushroom and truffle Wellington"]

wineDetails: {"style": "Elegant, complex, full-bodied Cabernet Sauvignon with excellent balance and aging potential", "region": "Stellenbosch, Coastal Region, Western Cape, South Africa", "vintage": "2015", "ageability": "Drink now through 2035. This wine is currently in its prime drinking window but will reward cellaring for another 10 years or more. With age, expect the development of tertiary flavors of leather, tobacco, dried fruit, and earthy complexity.", "grapeVariety": "100% Cabernet Sauvignon"}

name: Fledge and Co Hoeksteen 2016
description: A svelte and contemplative Chenin Blanc from old bush vines rooted in decomposed granitic soils of the Bottelary Hills, Stellenbosch. The dry land vines, planted in the early 1980s with epic vistas of Table Mountain, weathered the tempestuous 2016 vintage to produce small clusters of intensely concentrated fruit. Barrel fermented and matured in old French oak, this wine is intentionally Loire-like in style and benefits greatly from bottle maturation.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is delicate and nuanced, opening with a combination of citrus blossom and yellow fruits—golden apple and ripe pear. Green apple and red pear notes add freshness, while subtle hints of toasted almond and gentle ginger provide complexity. Distinctive aromas of honey, rooibos tea, and a tell-tale chalky minerality emerge, adding layers of interest to this contemplative, shy expression of Chenin Blanc.", "finish": "The finish is long and mineral-driven, characterized by a tell-tale chalky texture and bright acidity. Lingering flavors of citrus blossom, yellow fruits, and toasted almond persist, while the wine's Loire-like structure ensures a clean, refreshing conclusion.", "palate": "Svelte and medium-bodied with a lovely pithy texture, the palate reveals flavors of green apple, golden apple, and yellow fruits, balanced by bright acidity. Subtle notes of toasted almond, honey, and rooibos tea add richness without heaviness, while a distinctive chalky, mineral texture reinforces the wine's terroir-driven character. The wine's old-vine concentration and barrel fermentation contribute to its complex, layered profile, while restraint and elegance define the overall impression."}
foodPairings: ["Seared scallops with brown butter and capers", "Roasted chicken with herbs de Provence", "Creamy lobster bisque", "Fresh goat cheese and honey on crostini", "Grilled white fish with lemon and almonds"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting necessary, but allow the wine to breathe in the glass for 10-15 minutes to reveal its complex aromatics", "glassware": "White Burgundy or Chenin Blanc glass with a generous bowl to showcase the wine's aromatic complexity and textural depth", "temperature": "Serve slightly chilled at 10-12°C (50-54°F)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Barrel-fermented, mineral-driven Chenin Blanc with Loire-like elegance and complexity; unintentionally Loire-like in style", "region": "Stellenbosch, Western Cape, South Africa (Bottelary Hills, decomposed granitic soils)", "vintage": "2016", "ageability": "Drink now through 2028 and beyond. This wine benefits greatly from bottle maturation and is currently entering its prime drinking window. With careful cellaring, it will continue to develop additional complexity, with evolving notes of honey, beeswax, and dried fruits over the next 5-10 years.", "grapeVariety": "100% Chenin Blanc (old bush vines from the early 1980s)"}

name: Remhoogte First Light Chenin Blanc 2024
description: A vibrant expression of South African Chenin Blanc from the Stellenbosch region, Remhoogte's First Light showcases the variety's versatility and food-friendly nature. This wine captures the essence of cool-climate viticulture with its crisp acidity, pure fruit expression, and mineral complexity that Stellenbosch is renowned for.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose bursts with fresh aromas of green apple, pear, and white peach, complemented by bright citrus notes of lime and grapefruit. Delicate floral hints of honeysuckle and acacia blossom add elegance, while subtle undertones of wet stone and chalk speak to the wine's terroir. A suggestion of ripe quince and honey emerges with air, adding a touch of richness without sacrificing the wine's essential freshness.", "finish": "The finish is remarkably long and precise, with lingering citrus zest and mineral notes. A subtle hint of almond and white flowers persists, while the wine's vibrant acidity leaves the palate refreshed and eager for food or another sip.", "palate": "On the palate, this Chenin Blanc is medium-bodied with electric acidity that brings the wine to life. Flavors of crisp green apple and Asian pear dominate the initial attack, followed by juicy white peach and hints of tropical guava. A distinctive mineral seam runs through the core, providing structure and length. The wine's texture is both creamy and refreshing, with a subtle waxy quality characteristic of well-made Chenin. Notes of fresh herbs and a touch of beeswax add complexity without detracting from the wine's purity."}
foodPairings: ["Pan-seared scallops with citrus beurre blanc", "Fresh oysters with mignonette", "Thai green curry with chicken", "Grilled prawns with lemon and garlic", "Goat cheese salad with roasted beets and walnuts"]

name: Jeremy Nickel Cellars Chardonnay 2019
description: A distinctive California Chardonnay from Jeremy Nickel Cellars, this wine reflects the winemaker's commitment to crafting balanced, terroir-driven wines with restraint and precision. The 2019 vintage showcases the beautiful interplay between ripe fruit, judicious oak influence, and refreshing acidity that defines high-quality California Chardonnay.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet presents a harmonious blend of ripe yellow apple, white peach, and hints of pineapple, complemented by subtle notes of lemon curd and melon. Oak influence is evident but well-integrated, contributing aromas of vanilla bean, toasted hazelnut, and a whisper of crème brûlée. Floral hints of orange blossom add lift, while a touch of minerality and wet stone provides complexity and depth to the aromatic profile.", "finish": "The finish is long and satisfying, with lingering notes of baked apple, vanilla, and subtle spice. A hint of caramel and toasted oak persists alongside refreshing citrus notes, while the wine's balanced acidity ensures a clean, appetizing conclusion.", "palate": "Medium to full-bodied with a silky, rounded texture, this Chardonnay delivers layers of flavor that unfold gradually. The palate showcases ripe orchard fruits including baked apple and pear, alongside tropical notes of ripe pineapple and mango. Well-judged oak aging adds complexity through flavors of butterscotch, toasted oak, and spiced nuts, while maintaining balance with the fruit. The wine's creamy mouthfeel is complemented by bright acidity that provides freshness and structure, preventing any sense of heaviness despite the wine's richness."}
foodPairings: ["Roasted chicken with herb butter and root vegetables", "Lobster risotto with saffron", "Grilled halibut with lemon-caper sauce", "Creamy pasta carbonara", "Brie or triple-cream cheese with crackers"]

name: Castoro Cellars Chardonnay Keg 2024  20 l
description: An innovative approach to wine packaging from Paso Robles' Castoro Cellars, this 20-liter keg format delivers fresh, fruit-forward Chardonnay perfect for events and gatherings. The keg preserves freshness while eliminating oxygen exposure, keeping the wine in optimal condition from first pour to last, making it ideal for restaurants and large-format service.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is bright and inviting, bursting with fresh aromas of crisp green apple, ripe pear, and citrus. Notes of white flowers and a hint of melon add aromatic interest, while subtle touches of vanilla and cream suggest gentle oak contact or lees aging. The overall impression is one of freshness and approachability, with clean fruit aromatics taking center stage.", "finish": "The finish is clean and moderately persistent, with lingering fruit flavors and refreshing acidity. A hint of citrus zest and apple skin provides a crisp conclusion that invites another sip, making this wine perfect for casual enjoyment and food pairing.", "palate": "Light to medium-bodied with a refreshing character, this Chardonnay emphasizes fruit purity and easy drinkability. Flavors of crisp apple, pear, and citrus dominate, supported by a creamy texture that adds appeal without weighing down the palate. Bright acidity keeps the wine lively and food-friendly, while subtle notes of vanilla and butter add a touch of richness. The wine's straightforward, fruit-focused profile makes it extremely versatile and accessible."}

name: Cienega Valley Cienega Valley Chardonnay 2023
description: A distinctive expression from California's historic Cienega Valley, one of the state's cooler viticultural regions located in San Benito County. This Chardonnay benefits from the area's limestone soils and significant diurnal temperature variation, resulting in wines with natural acidity, elegance, and mineral complexity that sets them apart from warmer-climate California Chardonnays.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose reveals layered aromas of ripe yellow apple, Asian pear, and white nectarine, accented by bright citrus notes of lemon zest and hints of grapefruit. Floral undertones of jasmine and orange blossom add elegance, while subtle mineral notes reminiscent of flint and wet stone speak to the region's unique limestone terroir. A delicate touch of oak contributes hints of vanilla and toasted almond without dominating the fresh fruit character.", "finish": "The finish is long and mineral-driven, with lingering notes of citrus, apple, and subtle spice. A distinctive chalky quality persists alongside refreshing acidity, creating a memorable conclusion that showcases the unique terroir of Cienega Valley.", "palate": "Medium-bodied with excellent structure, this Chardonnay showcases the balance between ripe fruit and refreshing acidity that defines quality cool-climate viticulture. Flavors of crisp apple, pear, and stone fruit are complemented by citrus notes and a pronounced mineral backbone that provides focus and length. The wine's texture is simultaneously creamy and vibrant, with integrated oak adding subtle richness through notes of vanilla and hazelnut. The natural acidity is bright and persistent, lending energy and ensuring the wine remains lively despite its richness."}
foodPairings: ["Pan-seared halibut with lemon and capers", "Roasted pork tenderloin with apple chutney", "Butternut squash ravioli with sage butter", "Grilled swordfish with herb salsa verde", "Aged Manchego or Gruyère cheese"]

name: Attwoods Vin de Folie Rouge 2024
description: A distinctive Australian red blend from cool-climate Victoria, combining 50% Cabernet Franc with 50% Aglianico in a minimal intervention style. This boutique producer operates across Ballarat, Macedon Ranges, and Geelong, crafting wines that express the elegant tension of cool-climate viticulture with Mediterranean varietals.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet opens with bright red berry aromatics—raspberry, wild strawberry, and red currant—layered with subtle green peppercorn and fresh-cut herbs characteristic of Cabernet Franc. The Aglianico contribution adds darker notes of black plum and violet, while 10 months in old French barriques contribute gentle baking spice and cedar undertones without overwhelming the vibrant fruit character.", "finish": "Clean and refreshing with persistent berry flavors and a hint of white pepper spice. The tannins are fine-grained and gentle, making this approachable now while suggesting 3-5 years of graceful evolution ahead.", "palate": "Medium-bodied with an engaging textural smoothness, the wine showcases crunchy berry flavors—think fresh cranberry and pomegranate—balanced by the Aglianico's darker fruit presence. The cool-climate origins shine through in the wine's natural acidity and lifted red fruit profile, while subtle herbal notes of oregano and dried thyme add savory complexity. The minimal intervention approach preserves freshness and terroir expression, creating a wine that feels alive and energetic on the palate."}
foodPairings: ["Herb-crusted rack of lamb with mint jus", "Wild mushroom risotto with truffle oil", "Charcuterie board with Italian salumi", "Grilled eggplant with tomato and mozzarella", "Duck confit with berry gastrique"]

wineDetails: {"style": "Cool-climate red blend, medium-bodied, minimal intervention", "region": "Central Victoria, Australia (Ballarat/Macedon Ranges/Geelong)", "vintage": "2024", "ageability": "Drink now through 2029; accessible young but will develop complexity", "grapeVariety": "50% Cabernet Franc, 50% Aglianico"}

name: Adir Plato Cabernet Sauvignon (MD & DC)
description: A distinguished kosher Cabernet Sauvignon from Israel's Upper Galilee, specifically from the acclaimed Kerem Ben Zimra Vineyards. This wine showcases the potential of Israeli viticulture at high elevation, combining Old World structure with New World fruit intensity in a wine of fascinating personality and elegant complexity.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The wine displays red-purple to dark blue visual shades, introducing a rich and complex bouquet. Red and black fruits dominate—think ripe raspberry, black plum, and dark cherry—with intriguing slightly sour notes that add freshness and tension. Mineral undertones speak to the terroir, while new oak contributes mocha, roasted coffee bean, and sweet baking spice. The aromatic profile suggests both power and refinement, with multiple layers that unfold gradually in the glass.", "finish": "The concentration of fruit combined with sharp tannins and alcohol creates a powerful, long finish that promises rewards for patient collectors. Mineral and coffee notes persist, with the tannins gradually softening to reveal the wine's inherent elegance.", "palate": "Medium to full-bodied at 14.5% alcohol, the palate delivers concentrated fruit expression balanced by firm tannins from both grape and oak. The combination of red raspberry brightness and black plum depth creates complexity, while the sharp, structured tannins provide ageworthy backbone. Coffee and mocha notes from oak aging add savory depth without overwhelming the fruit core. The wine shows outstanding and distinguished personality, with more harmony and elegance than earlier vintages, suggesting the producer's evolving mastery of this site."}
foodPairings: ["Peppered grilled ribeye steak", "Roast goose with berry sauce", "Roasted rack of lamb with herbs", "Beef brisket with red wine reduction", "Aged hard cheeses like Pecorino or aged Gouda"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant 1-2 hours to soften firm tannins and integrate oak notes", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux glass to allow the wine to breathe and develop", "temperature": "16-18°C (61-64°F)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Full-bodied kosher Cabernet Sauvignon, oak-aged", "region": "Kerem Ben Zimra, Upper Galilee, Israel", "vintage": "NV (current release)", "ageability": "Drink now through 2030; will benefit from 3-5 years cellaring", "grapeVariety": "100% Cabernet Sauvignon"}

name: Quinta do Mourao Tawny 20 Year Port
description: An exquisite 20-year aged tawny Port from the renowned Quinta do Mourão estate, positioned on the banks of the Douro opposite Régua. This wine showcases the estate's mastery of aged tawny production, receiving 92 points from Wine Advocate for its exceptional complexity and elegance that surpasses many tawnies in its category.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose reveals intense aromas of dried fruits—figs, apricots, and raisins—layered with butterscotch, bourbon vanilla, and Kraft caramels. Honeyed notes intertwine with orange peel and Christmas spices, creating a seductive aromatic tapestry. The wine displays medium dark amber-brown hues with luminous orange-red highlights, signaling its maturity and refinement.", "finish": "The finish is long and elegant, showcasing the wine's complexity with lingering notes of dried fruits, spice, and subtle oak. It seems remarkably full of life for its age, leaving an impression of maturity balanced with vibrant energy that speaks to the quality of the base wines and careful blending.", "palate": "Full-bodied and harmonious, the palate offers a rich, elegant mid-palate with intensity of fruit that distinguishes it from younger tawnies. Flavors of dried apricots hover between fresh and dried fruit character, accented by nuts, toffee, and subtle spices. The wine takes the spice and sugar foundation and adds layers of caramel with a touch of brandy warmth, delivering more complexity and serious character than typical 20-year tawnies. Fine balance between sweetness and structure creates exceptional drinking pleasure."}
foodPairings: ["Crème brûlée with candied orange peel", "Blue cheese with fig compote and walnuts", "Almond tart with butterscotch sauce", "Dark chocolate truffles with sea salt", "Foie gras terrine with dried apricots"]

Once opened, can be enjoyed over several weeks.", "grapeVariety": "Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz, Tinta Barroca, and Tinto Cão"}

name: Two Mountain Show Pony (WINE CLUB ONLY)
description: A specialty red blend exclusively available through Two Mountain Winery's tasting room and wine club, crafted from estate-grown grapes in Washington's Rattlesnake Hills AVA. Produced by brothers Matthew and Patrick Rawn at Washington's first certified-sustainable vineyards, this wine has become a favorite among friends, family, and equestrian enthusiasts.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet opens with rich aromas of perfectly baked cherry pie, exuding warmth and ripeness. A distinctive dash of coriander adds an intriguing spice note, while dried eucalyptus brings aromatic complexity and herbal lift. The interplay of ripe fruit and savory botanicals creates an inviting, multi-layered aromatic profile that reflects the Yakima Valley's unique terroir.", "finish": "The finish is smooth and moderately long, with lingering notes of cherry, subtle spice, and a whisper of eucalyptus. Soft tannins provide texture without astringency, making this an exceptionally easy-drinking wine that invites another sip.", "palate": "This red blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, and Merlot delivers a harmonious palate showcasing the best of each variety. Ripe red cherry and dark berry flavors form the core, supported by subtle oak influence and well-integrated tannins. The wine displays medium to full body with balanced acidity, offering both structure and approachability. Hints of dried herbs and spice echo the nose, adding savory complexity to the fruit-forward profile."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled ribeye steak with herb butter", "Roasted lamb chops with rosemary", "Mushroom and gruyère stuffed burgers", "BBQ pulled pork with tangy slaw", "Aged cheddar and charcuterie board"]

Drink now for optimal enjoyment.", "grapeVariety": "Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, and Merlot blend"}

name: Mauro Molino Langhe Dolcetto 2018
description: A textbook expression of Dolcetto from one of Piedmont's respected producers, the Mauro Molino Langhe Dolcetto 2018 showcases the approachable, food-friendly character that has made this variety beloved in Italy's northwest. With a Community Score of 90.3 on CellarTracker, this wine exemplifies exceptional value in Piedmontese red wine.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents a gracious bouquet of violet and red fruit—particularly fresh cherries—accompanied by delicate floral notes and subtle almond hints. The aromatic profile is bright and inviting, characteristic of well-made Dolcetto, with a touch of spice and mineral undertones. The wine's pale to medium ruby color signals its elegant, lifted style rather than heavy extraction.", "finish": "The finish is clean and moderately long, leaving impressions of fresh cherry, subtle almond, and a whisper of violet. The wine's gracious nature shines through to the end, making it a genuine pleasure to drink with its combination of brightness and gentle texture.", "palate": "Medium-bodied and refreshing, the palate delivers juicy dark cherries and red berry flavors with wonderful purity of fruit. Soft, elegant tannins provide gentle structure without any harshness, while medium-minus acidity keeps the wine lively and balanced. There's a pleasant simplicity to the taste that doesn't lack for charm—this is Dolcetto showing its food-friendly, everyday drinking appeal. Floral nuances persist through the mid-palate, adding refinement to the straightforward fruit expression."}
foodPairings: ["Pasta with Bolognese or meat ragù", "Vitello tonnato (veal with tuna sauce)", "Pizza with sausage and mushrooms", "Roasted chicken with herbs and root vegetables", "Antipasto platter with salumi and aged cheeses"]

wineDetails: {"style": "Dry red table wine - fresh and fruit-forward Piedmont style", "region": "Langhe DOC, Piedmont, Italy", "vintage": "2018", "ageability": "Best enjoyed within 2-4 years of vintage. The 2018 is at peak drinking now through 2025. Dolcetto is made for youthful enjoyment rather than long-term aging.", "grapeVariety": "100% Dolcetto"}

name: Toro Fighting Bulls 2018
description: The Abelis Carthago Fighting Bulls 2018 hails from ungrafted Tempranillo vines dating back 120 years in Spain's Toro region. This family-run estate produces wines of unparalleled power and complexity, drawing comparisons to Napa Cabernets at twice the price and setting the bar for outstanding craftsmanship in Toro.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The wine presents with the deep color of blueberry pie, introducing an intense aromatic profile. The bouquet reveals concentrated black currant and cassis, layered with violet florals and warming clove spice. These ancient, ungrafted vines produce Tempranillo with exceptional aromatic intensity and purity, capturing the essence of Toro's powerful terroir and continental climate.", "finish": "The finish is long and satisfying, dropping into notes of dark chocolate and espresso bean as the tannins gently recede. The espresso and chocolate elements provide a sophisticated conclusion that speaks to quality oak aging and the wine's overall maturity, leaving a lasting impression of power tempered by refinement.", "palate": "Full-bodied and structured, the palate showcases flavors of black plum, cassis, and anisette, accented by rich dark chocolate. The wine delivers substantial tannic grip initially, characteristic of Toro's bold style, but the tannins are well-integrated and steadily soften as the wine opens. The power of 120-year-old vines shines through in the depth and concentration of dark fruit, supported by careful winemaking that preserves complexity while taming the region's naturally robust character."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled Ibérico pork secreto with chimichurri", "Braised beef short ribs in red wine sauce", "Manchego cheese aged 12 months with quince paste", "Roasted leg of lamb with garlic and rosemary", "Wild mushroom and truffle risotto"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 1-2 hours before serving to soften tannins and open aromatics. This powerful wine benefits significantly from aeration.", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux glass or Cabernet-specific stemware to allow the wine to breathe", "temperature": "Serve at 16-18°C (61-64°F) to showcase structure and aromatics"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Full-bodied, age-worthy Toro Reserva with concentration and power", "region": "Toro DO, Castilla y León, Spain", "vintage": "2018", "ageability": "Peak drinking 2024-2035. Can age gracefully for 15-20 years from vintage. The 2018 is entering its drinking window now but will continue to develop complexity through 2040.", "grapeVariety": "100% Tempranillo (Tinta de Toro clone from 120-year-old ungrafted vines)"}

name: Nikolaou Ktima Nemea 2019
description: Produced by Domaine Nikolaou, one of Greece's pioneering organic wineries since 1984, this Nemea PDO wine represents the best of the Agiorgitiko variety from the renowned Peloponnese wine region. The estate's commitment to organic viticulture and traditional winemaking creates wines of authenticity and terroir expression.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with bright and fresh bramble fruits and bilberry, showcasing the pure fruit character that organic viticulture can achieve. Layers of ripe red and dark fruits emerge—red cherries, blackberries, and plums—accented by subtle Mediterranean herbs and a whisper of spice. The aromatic profile is inviting and clean, reflecting the wine's organic pedigree and careful winemaking.", "finish": "The finish is moderately long with lingering notes of dark fruit, vanilla, and warm spice. The wine's organic character shines through with pure, unadulterated fruit flavors and a mineral backbone that speaks to Nemea's limestone-rich soils.", "palate": "The palate starts with a light, fresh attack that gives way to a more substantial mid-palate rich with ripe black cherry and sloe berry. Firm yet well-rounded tannins provide structure without harshness, while balanced acidity keeps the wine lively. There's notable depth of fruit at the back of the palate, with additional sweetness of ripe fruit balanced by savory elements. The thick yet smooth texture shows vanilla and wood spice from 14 months in French oak barrels, integrated beautifully with cinnamon and baking spices."}
foodPairings: ["Moussaka with layers of eggplant and béchamel", "Grilled lamb souvlaki with tzatziki", "Slow-roasted pork shoulder with Greek herbs", "Stuffed grape leaves with rice and pine nuts", "Aged feta and Kalamata olive platter"]

wineDetails: {"style": "Organic Nemea PDO - medium to full-bodied with balanced oak aging", "region": "Nemea PDO, Peloponnese, Greece", "vintage": "2019", "ageability": "Peak drinking 2024-2028. Best enjoyed within 8-10 years of vintage to preserve fresh fruit character while allowing oak to integrate. The 2019 is in its prime drinking window now.", "grapeVariety": "100% Agiorgitiko (organic, estate-grown)"}

name: La Sala Red Sangria
description: A modern, fresh interpretation of traditional Spanish sangria from Bodega La Salá, crafted with carefully selected PDO red wine and natural Mediterranean aromatics. This ready-to-drink sangria emphasizes quality wine as its foundation rather than masking inferior base with sweetness, creating a sophisticated yet approachable expression of Spain's beloved beverage.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with vibrant aromas of ripe red fruits—strawberries and raspberries—alongside blackcurrant cassis. Natural aromatics of blood orange and lemon peel provide bright citrus lift, while subtle hints of cinnamon add warming spice. The bouquet is fresh and inviting, suggesting the quality red wine base and thoughtful addition of complementary flavors rather than artificial sweetness.", "finish": "The finish is long and gentle, leaving a pleasant aftertaste of red fruits, citrus, and subtle spice. Very low tannin and balanced sweetness make this exceptionally refreshing and versatile for warm weather enjoyment or casual entertaining.", "palate": "Full-bodied yet refreshing, the palate delivers concentrated red fruit flavors balanced by hints of orange, lime, and cinnamon. The wine maintains controlled acidity that keeps it lively rather than cloying, with very low tannin contributing to its smooth, easy-drinking character. The natural aromatics of lemon, blood orange, and cassis integrate seamlessly with the red wine foundation, creating harmonious complexity without overwhelming sweetness or artificial notes."}
foodPairings: ["Tapas spread with jamón ibérico and manchego", "Grilled chorizo and bell pepper skewers", "Paella with seafood and saffron rice", "Fresh fruit salad with mint", "Patatas bravas with spicy aioli"]

Pour over ice and garnish with fresh citrus slices, berries, and seasonal fruit for optimal presentation and flavor.", "glassware": "Large wine glass, tumbler, or traditional Spanish sangria pitcher", "temperature": "Serve very cold at 4-6°C (39-43°F) over plenty of ice"}

name: Vermouth Giardino Mediterranean Dry NV
description: Villa Massa's Vermouth Giardino Mediterranean Dry captures the essence of Italy's Amalfi Coast, crafted with the finest ingredients from Sorrento. Developed in collaboration with renowned US mixologists Chris Patino and Stacey Swenson, this vermouth was 'made for bartenders, by bartenders' to deliver bold citrus notes and refined complexity for cocktails.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose presents an elegant, refined bouquet led by lemon thyme and Mediterranean botanicals. Bright citrus notes—particularly lemon and bergamot—mingle with aromatic herbs including thyme, rosemary, and subtle sage. The profile is airy and bright, evoking the sun-drenched coastal gardens of Sorrento, yet reveals underlying depth that promises complexity on the palate.", "finish": "The finish is dry, delicate, and remarkably refined with good length. Lemon peel, thyme, and a whisper of pleasant bitterness linger, leaving the palate refreshed and ready for another sip. The balanced, slightly bitter conclusion makes this ideal for mixing in classic cocktails where it can shine without being overwhelmed.", "palate": "The palate offers a smooth, dry texture where the complexity of carefully selected botanicals harmonizes beautifully. Powerful spices emerge—including cardamom, coriander, and bitter orange peel—creating intricate layers against the citrus-forward profile. Notes of flowers and herbs weave through the mid-palate, with a subtle bitterness from wormwood and gentian root providing structure and balance. The vermouth shows tight structure and sophisticated integration of all components."}
foodPairings: ["Oysters on the half shell with mignonette", "Grilled white fish with lemon and capers", "Marinated olives and salted almonds", "Carpaccio with arugula and parmesan", "Best enjoyed as an aperitif or in cocktails (Dry Martini, Negroni variations)"]
