The magnum format and exceptional quality ensure long-term development.", "grapeVariety": "100% Tempranillo (Tinta del País) from 50-year-old vines"}

name: Mate Brunello di Montalcino 2018
description: Mate's 2018 Brunello di Montalcino exemplifies the elegance and power of Sangiovese Grosso from this legendary Tuscan appellation. Crafted from 100% Sangiovese grown in the warm, dry hills of Montalcino, this wine underwent extended aging to meet DOCG requirements and develop its characteristic complexity.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Classic Brunello aromatics unfold with time in the glass, revealing layers of red cherry, wild strawberry, and dried cranberry. Floral notes of violet and rose petal emerge alongside earthy tones of leather saddle, turned earth, and forest undergrowth. The oak influence is subtle and well-integrated, contributing whispers of vanilla, cinnamon, and sweet tobacco. With air, hints of balsamic, dried herbs, and orange peel add additional complexity characteristic of Sangiovese.", "finish": "Long and persistent, the finish showcases red fruit, leather, and a distinctive iron-like minerality. The tannins remain present and structured, indicating this wine needs several more years to reach its full potential. Notes of cherry pit, dried herbs, and a touch of coffee linger, with the wine's natural acidity keeping everything fresh and vibrant through the extended finish.", "palate": "The palate is both powerful and refined, showcasing Brunello's signature combination of elegance and structure. Bright red fruit flavors of sour cherry, raspberry, and pomegranate are complemented by savory notes of dried mushroom, truffle, and black tea. The wine's acidity is pronounced but beautifully balanced, providing lift and energy to the concentrated fruit. Tannins are firm and grippy—typical of young Brunello—but show fine grain and excellent quality. The mid-palate reveals layers of complexity with each sip, displaying terroir-driven minerality and subtle spice."}
foodPairings: ["Bistecca alla Fiorentina (grilled T-bone steak)", "Wild boar ragu with pappardelle", "Roasted game birds with sage and pancetta", "Pecorino Toscano aged cheese", "Mushroom and truffle risotto"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 2-3 hours given the wine's youth and firm tannins; benefits greatly from extended aeration", "glassware": "Large Burgundy glass to concentrate the delicate aromatics", "temperature": "64-68°F (18-20°C) - slightly warmer than typical reds to showcase aromatics"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Traditional Brunello - full-bodied with firm structure", "region": "Brunello di Montalcino DOCG, Tuscany, Italy", "vintage": "2018", "ageability": "Needs 5-10 years cellaring; optimal drinking 2028-2045", "grapeVariety": "100% Sangiovese Grosso"}

name: Noughty NA Rose Wine NV
description: Noughty Non-Alcoholic Rosé offers a sophisticated alcohol-free alternative that doesn't compromise on flavor or enjoyment. Crafted using gentle dealcoholization techniques, this rosé maintains the fresh, fruity characteristics that make rosé wines so appealing, perfect for health-conscious consumers or any occasion calling for a lighter option.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Delicate and refreshing, the nose presents classic rosé aromatics of fresh strawberries, watermelon, and white peach. Floral notes of rose petals and orange blossom add elegance and lift. Subtle hints of citrus zest—lemon and grapefruit—provide brightness. The overall impression is clean, fresh, and inviting, with no off-notes from the dealcoholization process.", "finish": "The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering notes of red berries and citrus. A gentle acidity keeps the palate lively while subtle floral notes provide elegance. The wine leaves you wanting another sip—exactly what you want in a rosé.", "palate": "Light-bodied and crisp, the palate delivers vibrant red berry flavors of raspberry, wild strawberry, and cranberry. A touch of stone fruit—nectarine and peach—adds depth and sweetness without making the wine sugary. The acidity is bright and refreshing, giving the wine excellent balance and making it highly drinkable. The mouthfeel is clean and slightly effervescent, with a whisper of minerality adding complexity. Despite being alcohol-free, the wine maintains good structure and doesn't taste thin or watery."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh summer salads with strawberries and goat cheese", "Grilled shrimp or seafood", "Sushi and sashimi", "Light pasta dishes with lemon and herbs", "Fruit tarts or berry desserts"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed; serve straight from the bottle", "glassware": "White wine glass or rosé-specific stemware", "temperature": "45-50°F (7-10°C) - well chilled to maximize refreshment"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Non-alcoholic rosé - dry and refreshing", "region": "Dealcoholized wine (likely European origin)", "vintage": "Non-Vintage", "ageability": "Best enjoyed within 1 year of purchase for optimal freshness", "grapeVariety": "Rosé blend (typically Grenache, Syrah, or similar varieties pre-dealcoholization)"}

name: Giustini Avoglia Fiano 2024
description: An expressive Fiano from Campania showcasing the grape's signature aromatic intensity and textural depth. This recent vintage captures the fresh, vibrant character of modern Fiano production while maintaining the variety's traditional honeyed richness. A captivating white wine with impressive complexity.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet is intensely aromatic with pronounced notes of white flowers, acacia blossoms, and orange zest. Layers of ripe pear and golden apple emerge, complemented by distinctive honey and toasted hazelnut nuances. Subtle mineral undertones and hints of wild herbs add intriguing complexity to this expressive nose.", "finish": "The finish is long and satisfying, with evolving spicy and nutty notes that develop beautifully. Clean acidity maintains freshness, while the wine's natural weight provides a lingering, mouth-coating presence. Hints of honey and baking spices fade gracefully.", "palate": "This Fiano offers substantial weight on the palate with honeyed stone fruit flavors balanced by refreshing acidity. The mid-palate reveals spiced pear, nectarine, and almond paste, while the characteristic hazelnut note provides textural interest. Floral elements persist throughout, supported by a subtle chalky minerality that adds depth and structure."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled sea bass with lemon and capers", "Roasted chicken with herbs and garlic", "Creamy risotto with wild mushrooms", "Fresh mozzarella with heirloom tomatoes and basil", "Seared scallops with brown butter sauce"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting required; serve chilled directly from the refrigerator after brief rest to allow aromatics to emerge", "glassware": "Medium-sized white wine glass to concentrate aromatics", "temperature": "48-52°F (9-11°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Full-bodied white, aromatic, unoaked", "region": "Campania, Italy (likely Fiano di Avellino DOCG)", "vintage": "2024", "ageability": "Best consumed within 2-4 years to enjoy peak freshness; some examples develop interesting spicy complexity with 5-7 years of aging", "grapeVariety": "100% Fiano"}

name: Rueda Heredad de Penalosa Verdejo 2020
description: A pristine expression of Verdejo from Spain's Rueda region, showcasing the aromatic intensity and fresh character of modern Spanish white winemaking. This wine captures the essence of Verdejo with its full body, aromatic complexity, and refreshing finish. A delightful discovery from one of Spain's premier white wine regions.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet is vibrantly aromatic with bright notes of citrus blossom, green apple, and fresh fennel. Pronounced tropical fruit aromas—passion fruit, white peach, and melon—mingle with subtle herbs and a distinctive mineral edge. Hints of wild flowers and fresh-cut grass add complexity, while the cool fermentation preserves pristine fruit purity.", "finish": "The finish is clean and persistent with lingering citrus and herb notes. Refreshing acidity leaves the palate cleansed and energized, while the wine's natural weight provides satisfying length. A touch of minerality and subtle fruit character fade gracefully, inviting another sip.", "palate": "Soft yet full-bodied with excellent textural depth and weight on the palate. Flavors of crisp pear, green apple, and grapefruit are complemented by tropical nuances of guava and lychee. The mid-palate reveals subtle anise, white pepper, and a refreshing mineral backbone. Bright acidity balances the wine's natural fullness, creating an engaging interplay of richness and freshness."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled prawns with garlic and olive oil", "Fresh goat cheese salad with citrus vinaigrette", "Pan-seared halibut with herb butter", "Spanish tapas—Manchego cheese, olives, almonds", "Light pasta primavera with vegetables"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed; serve well-chilled directly from the refrigerator", "glassware": "Standard white wine glass or tulip-shaped glass", "temperature": "45-50°F (7-10°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Full-bodied white, aromatic, fresh", "region": "Rueda DO, Castilla y León, Spain", "vintage": "2020", "ageability": "Best enjoyed young within 2-3 years of vintage to preserve aromatic freshness and vibrant acidity", "grapeVariety": "85-100% Verdejo"}

name: Tigerstone Garnacha 2020
description: An expressive Spanish Garnacha showcasing the grape's characteristic red fruit purity and subtle spice. This wine captures the essence of Spanish viticulture with its balance of juicy fruit, elegant structure, and Mediterranean warmth. A delightful expression of Garnacha's versatile character.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose offers bright, appealing aromas of ripe strawberry, fresh raspberry, and red cherry with excellent clarity and purity. Subtle notes of white pepper, dried herbs, and garrigue add complexity, while hints of violets and wild flowers contribute elegance. Light touches of vanilla and sweet spice suggest gentle oak influence, creating a balanced and inviting bouquet.", "finish": "The finish is smooth and moderately long with lingering red fruit and spice notes. Gentle tannins and refreshing acidity create an elegant, food-friendly conclusion. Subtle hints of leather and herbs emerge as the wine evolves, while the fruit character remains primary and appealing.", "palate": "Medium-bodied with juicy, fruit-forward character showcasing red berry flavors—raspberry, strawberry, and cranberry. The mid-palate reveals layers of spice, dried herbs, and a touch of savory earthiness. Soft, approachable tannins provide gentle structure, while moderate acidity maintains balance and freshness. The wine's natural fruitiness is complemented by subtle pepper and herbal notes, creating excellent harmony."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled chorizo and Spanish tapas", "Roasted pork tenderloin with berry glaze", "Paella with chicken and seafood", "Manchego cheese with quince paste", "Grilled vegetables with romesco sauce"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Brief aeration of 15-20 minutes enhances aromatics, though wine is approachable immediately", "glassware": "Standard red wine glass or Grenache-specific glass", "temperature": "58-62°F (14-17°C), slightly cool"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Medium-bodied red, fruit-forward, approachable", "region": "Spain (specific region undetermined, possibly Aragón or Campo de Borja)", "vintage": "2020", "ageability": "Best enjoyed within 3-6 years of vintage while red fruit character remains vibrant and fresh", "grapeVariety": "100% Garnacha (Grenache)"}

name: Bodegas Riojanas Monte Real Gran Reserva 2006
description: A distinguished Gran Reserva from one of Rioja's historic bodegas, showcasing the traditional style of extended oak aging. This 2006 vintage earned 87 points from Wine Enthusiast and represents classic Rioja elegance with a balance of fruit maturity and oak complexity developed through 24-30 months in American oak barrels and 36 months in bottle before release.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose delivers textbook aromas characteristic of aged Rioja Gran Reserva. Dried raspberry and cherry fruit intermingle with the scent of fallen autumn leaves, creating an evocative, earthy complexity. A distinctive note reminiscent of seashell adds a mineral dimension that speaks to the wine's maturity and terroir. Subtle hints of vanilla and toast from American oak aging round out the aromatic profile.", "finish": "The finish is notably smooth and lengthy, with persistent flavors of dried cherry, spice, and dark chocolate. The tannins have softened beautifully through aging, creating a silky texture that glides across the palate. A gentle earthiness lingers alongside the fruit, testament to proper bottle maturation.", "palate": "Despite its age, the palate remains remarkably fresh and vibrant. Black cherry mingles with dried fruit notes of raisin, while warming baking spices and rich cocoa flavors emerge from the extended oak aging. The wine shows excellent integration between fruit, oak, and tertiary development. The American oak influence is evident but refined, contributing structure without overwhelming the delicate fruit character."}
foodPairings: ["Roasted lamb shoulder with herbs de Provence", "Manchego cheese aged 12 months or longer", "Wild mushroom risotto with truffle oil", "Slow-braised beef cheeks in red wine sauce", "Ibérico ham and traditional Spanish tapas"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Open 30-60 minutes before serving to allow the wine to breathe and tertiary aromas to develop. Brief decanting can help if sediment is present.", "glassware": "Traditional Bordeaux or Rioja glass with a wide bowl to concentrate the complex aromatics", "temperature": "16-18°C (60-64°F) - slightly cool room temperature to preserve freshness"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Gran Reserva - Traditional Rioja with extended oak and bottle aging", "region": "Rioja DOCa, Spain - specifically from historic vineyards in La Rioja Alta", "vintage": "2006", "ageability": "Drinking beautifully now but can hold for another 5-8 years. The 2006 vintage shows excellent freshness despite maturity, with peak drinking window through 2030.", "grapeVariety": "100% Tempranillo from select vineyard parcels"}

name: Conde Valdemar Reserva Magnum 2016
description: An exceptional Rioja Reserva presented in magnum format, the 2016 vintage earned an impressive 90.7 points from community reviews on CellarTracker. Bodegas Valdemar crafted this wine from carefully selected Tempranillo grapes, aging it for 18 months in a combination of French and American oak barrels to achieve remarkable depth and complexity while maintaining the vibrant fruit character that defines this outstanding vintage.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet opens with gorgeous clarity, showing a luminous medium ruby-garnet hue with deep tinges. Intense aromas of fresh strawberries lead the way, accompanied by white pepper spice and vanilla custard richness. The American oak makes its presence known immediately with toasted coconut and vanilla notes, while highly extracted dark cherry, a whisper of raisin, and black plum create layers of fruit intensity that speak to the wine's concentration.", "finish": "The finish extends impressively long, with persistent tannins that are both gripping and refined. Mixed nuts, dark fruit, and oak spice linger beautifully. The velvety texture continues through the finish, while the wine's inherent freshness keeps the palate engaged and ready for another sip.", "palate": "Wild strawberries burst forward on the entry, followed by sharp, ripe raspberries that showcase the vintage's fruit purity. Cola-like notes add complexity alongside berry tart flavors that demonstrate excellent freshness. The oak treatment reveals itself through mixed nut characteristics in the lengthy finish. The texture is notably velvety, yet powerful tannins grab hold and persist for minutes, providing excellent structure. Rich and textured throughout, the wine shows remarkable intensity balanced by refreshing acidity."}
foodPairings: ["Aged ribeye steak grilled over oak", "Slow-roasted pork shoulder with Spanish paprika", "Grilled portobello mushrooms with aged balsamic", "Traditional paella with chorizo and rabbit", "Blue cheese paired with quince paste and walnuts"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Highly recommended - decant for 1-2 hours to soften the powerful tannins and allow the complex aromatics to fully emerge. The magnum format benefits from extended aeration.", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux-style glass to allow the wine's intensity and oak notes to integrate with air contact", "temperature": "16-17°C (61-63°F) to highlight both fruit and structure"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Reserva - Modern Rioja style with 18 months oak aging in French and American barrels, balancing tradition with fruit-forward expression", "region": "Rioja DOCa, specifically La Rioja Alta subzone, Spain", "vintage": "2016", "ageability": "Currently in prime drinking window (2025-2035). The magnum format provides additional aging potential due to slower evolution. Can be enjoyed now with decanting or cellared for 8-10 more years to develop tertiary complexity.", "grapeVariety": "Primarily Tempranillo with possible small percentages of traditional Rioja varieties (Graciano, Mazuelo)"}

name: Valdemar Estates Walla Walla Syrah 2020
description: A distinguished Syrah from Washington State's acclaimed Walla Walla Valley, specifically sourced from the prestigious Blue Mountain Vineyard. This wine represents the Valdemar family's expansion from their historic Rioja roots into the New World, applying generations of winemaking expertise to one of Washington's finest terroirs. The 2020 vintage showcases the concentrated, elegant expression that Walla Walla Syrah achieves in cooler sites.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The aromatic profile is complex and inviting, opening with layers of red and black fruit - think ripe blackberry and dark cherry accented by exotic acai berry. A distinctive hint of star anise adds exotic spice, while baking chocolate and cocoa nibs contribute richness. Earthy notes reminiscent of freshly tilled soil ground the fruit, alongside a subtle touch of dried fig. Delicate lilac florals weave through the nose, adding elegance. As the wine opens, additional nuances of black pepper and violets emerge.", "finish": "The finish is long and persistent with excellent intensity. Fine-grained tannins carry the dark fruit and savory elements through to a satisfying conclusion. Crisp acidity keeps the palate refreshed, while a sense of minerality and subtle oak spice lingers. The wine's energy and tension persist to the very end, inviting another sip.", "palate": "Savory and stylish on the palate, this Syrah demonstrates considerable intensity while maintaining balance and finesse. A robust mid-palate delivers concentrated dark fruit flavors - blackberry, black cherry, and plum - supported by fine-grained tannins that provide structure without heaviness. The wine shows lovely energy, tension, and vibrancy, with crisp acidity maintaining freshness. Distinct savory character emerges through notes of olive tapenade, dried herbs, and black pepper. The chocolate notes from the nose translate to the palate as dark cocoa and espresso."}
foodPairings: ["Herb-crusted rack of lamb with garlic and rosemary", "Grilled venison loin with blackberry reduction", "Beef short ribs braised in red wine and herbs", "Duck breast with cherry-port sauce", "Aged cheddar or Gruyère with dark chocolate"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 45-60 minutes to allow the wine to open fully and the tannins to soften. The wine will reveal additional layers of complexity with aeration.", "glassware": "Large Syrah/Shiraz glass or Burgundy-style bowl to capture the wine's aromatic intensity and allow proper aeration", "temperature": "16-18°C (61-64°F) to showcase both fruit and savory complexity"}
wineDetails: {"style": "New World Syrah with Old World influence - concentrated yet elegant, with savory character and fine tannins. Minimal intervention winemaking with careful oak integration.", "region": "Walla Walla Valley AVA, Washington State - specifically Blue Mountain Vineyard", "vintage": "2020", "ageability": "Drinking beautifully now (2025-2030) but has excellent structure for aging. Peak drinking window through 2035. The fine tannins and natural acidity suggest this wine will develop additional complexity over the next 5-10 years.", "grapeVariety": "100% Syrah from Blue Mountain Vineyard, one of Walla Walla's premier sites"}

name: Le Prieur Entre-Deux-Mers White 2022
description: A classic dry white Bordeaux from the Entre-Deux-Mers appellation, situated between the Garonne and Dordogne rivers. This 2022 vintage represents the fresh, aromatic style that has made Entre-Deux-Mers one of Bordeaux's most approachable and versatile white wine regions. Blending Sauvignon Blanc's vibrant acidity and aromatics with Semillon's weight and texture, this wine offers exceptional value and food-friendliness.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with striking aromatic intensity, typical of quality Entre-Deux-Mers. Fresh citrus notes dominate - lime zest, lemon peel, and grapefruit - alongside green apple and white peach. Delicate white flower aromatics add elegance, while hints of grass and subtle herbaceous notes speak to the Sauvignon Blanc component. The Semillon contributes white-fleshed fruit character and a touch of honeyed richness. Mineral undertones and a whisper of wet stone add complexity to this expressive bouquet.", "finish": "The finish is clean and refreshing with lingering citrus and green apple notes. Bright acidity keeps the palate cleansed and invigorated. Moderate length allows the flavors to fade gracefully, with the Semillon's roundness softening the finish while Sauvignon Blanc's crispness persists. A faint stony minerality lingers, inviting another sip.", "palate": "Crisp and refreshing on the palate, the wine showcases the region's signature balance and nervousness. Bright citrus flavors lead - lemon, lime, and grapefruit - accented by green apple tartness and ripe nectarine. The Sauvignon Blanc provides racy acidity and fresh fruit character, while Semillon adds mid-palate weight, supple roundness, and notes of white peach and subtle tropical fruit. The wine is well-balanced, neither too lean nor too rich, with lively acidity maintaining freshness throughout. A subtle mineral quality adds depth and interest."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh oysters on the half shell with mignonette", "Grilled sea bass with lemon and herbs", "Goat cheese salad with walnuts and honey", "Steamed mussels in white wine and garlic", "Asparagus quiche with Gruyère cheese"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting necessary. This wine is best enjoyed fresh and young. Simply chill and serve.", "glassware": "Standard white wine glass or Sauvignon Blanc glass to concentrate the aromatic intensity", "temperature": "8-10°C (46-50°F) - well chilled to highlight freshness and acidity"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Classic dry white Bordeaux - fresh, aromatic, and food-friendly. Fermented in stainless steel to preserve fruit purity and freshness.", "region": "Entre-Deux-Mers AOC, Bordeaux, France - between the Garonne and Dordogne rivers", "vintage": "2022", "ageability": "Best enjoyed young and fresh, ideally within 1-2 years of vintage (drink by 2025-2026). The wine is crafted for immediate enjoyment, though the Semillon component allows for modest short-term aging if desired.", "grapeVariety": "Blend of Sauvignon Blanc (60-70%) and Semillon (30-40%), possibly with small amounts of Muscadelle"}

name: Rippa Dorii Los Curas 2021
description: An exceptional white wine from the prestigious Rueda DO in Spain, crafted from 100% Verdejo grapes sourced from the Los Curas vineyard located just 5 kilometers from the winery. The 2021 vintage earned 86 points and a Bronze Medal from the Decanter World Wine Awards. Rippa Dorii employs a distinctive split fermentation technique, blending 80% stainless steel-fermented wine with 20% French oak-aged component to achieve remarkable complexity and texture.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is wonderfully complex and inviting, opening with vibrant aromas of citrus - lemon zest, lime, and grapefruit - alongside luscious white peach and ripe apricot. Fennel and subtle anise notes add an intriguing herbal dimension, while lightly toasted aromas from the oak component contribute hints of vanilla and almond. The aromatic profile is intense yet balanced, showcasing both the grape's varietal character and the winemaker's careful oak integration.", "finish": "The finish is long and satisfying, with the savory and nutty notes persisting alongside the stone fruit and citrus. The oak aging contributes a gentle spiciness and textural weight that carries through to the conclusion. Bright acidity maintains freshness, keeping the palate cleansed despite the wine's richness. A subtle mineral quality emerges on the finish, adding elegance and complexity.", "palate": "The palate delivers exceptional complexity and depth for a Spanish white wine. Stone fruit flavors dominate - white peach, apricot, and nectarine - supported by bright citrus acidity that provides lift and freshness. The texture is notably rich and weighty, with the oak-aged component contributing savory, nutty characters that add dimension without overwhelming the fruit. Hints of toasted almond, hazelnut, and a subtle creaminess from lees aging create layers of flavor. The wine strikes an admirable balance between fruit purity, oak influence, and textural interest."}
foodPairings: ["Traditional paella valenciana with seafood and saffron", "Garlic prawns (gambas al ajillo) with crusty bread", "Grilled sea bream or dorade in white wine sauce", "Chicken in almond sauce (pollo en pepitoria)", "Aged manchego cheese with quince paste"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Brief decanting or swirling in glass recommended to allow the oak and fruit notes to integrate. 15-20 minutes of air exposure can enhance the wine's complexity.", "glassware": "Medium-sized white wine glass or Chardonnay-style glass to accommodate the wine's textural richness and aromatic complexity", "temperature": "10-12°C (50-54°F) - slightly warmer than typical white wines to showcase the oak complexity and texture"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Premium Rueda Verdejo with partial oak fermentation. Grapes night-harvested for freshness, 12-hour cold maceration, split fermentation: 80% stainless steel on lees, 20% fermented and aged 6 months in French oak.", "region": "Rueda DO, Castilla y León, Spain - specifically from Los Curas vineyard", "vintage": "2021", "ageability": "Best enjoyed within 2-4 years of vintage (2023-2027). The oak component provides some aging potential, but the wine is crafted to showcase freshness and fruit. Peak drinking window is now through 2026.", "grapeVariety": "100% Verdejo from Los Curas single vineyard"}

name: Conde Valdemar White Tempranillo (White Labels) 2023
description: A revolutionary white wine from Rioja's pioneering Bodegas Valdemar, this is historically significant as the first wine ever produced from Tempranillo Blanco, a rare white mutation of the red Tempranillo grape. The 2023 vintage represents Valdemar's ongoing commitment to innovation with native varieties, following the family's five-generation motto of 'Always pioneering.' This distinctive wine undergoes 4 months of lees aging in stainless steel to develop complexity while preserving its vibrant fruit character and unique varietal expression.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose is strikingly aromatic and complex, bursting with tropical and floral nuances that immediately distinguish this wine from conventional white Rioja. Medium-high intensity wildflower aromas create an elegant, perfumed quality, joined by distinctive notes of cassis, fennel, anise, and dill that add herbal complexity. White-fleshed fruit aromas dominate - ripe pear, honeydew melon, and white apricot - creating a lush, inviting bouquet. The wine's aromatic profile is bright, clean, and expressive, showing a brilliant yellow color with green shades that speaks to its freshness.", "finish": "The finish is refreshingly fresh yet impressively long, with tropical fruit and herbal notes persisting beautifully. The wine's natural acidity provides lift and cleansing freshness, while the lees aging contributes a subtle textural richness that carries through to the conclusion. Lingering notes of white flowers, melon, and herbs invite another sip, making this a thoroughly engaging wine from start to finish.", "palate": "The palate is smooth, expressive, and notably tasty, delivering on the aromatic promise with layers of tropical fruit flavors. Ripe melon, white peach, and apricot mingle with the distinctive herbal notes of fennel and anise that characterize this unique varietal. The texture is rich and full-bodied, with 4 months of lees aging contributing a subtle creaminess and additional depth without adding oak character. Despite its richness, the wine maintains excellent freshness and balance through vibrant acidity. The experience is distinctive and surprising, offering flavors and textures not typically found in white Rioja."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled shrimp with lemon and fresh herbs", "Chicken breast stuffed with herbs and goat cheese", "Seared scallops with fennel and citrus salad", "Fresh mozzarella with heirloom tomatoes and basil", "Asian fusion cuisine including Thai curry or Vietnamese spring rolls"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting necessary. The wine benefits from a few minutes in the glass to allow the aromatics to open, but is ready to enjoy immediately upon pouring.", "glassware": "White wine glass with a slightly tulip-shaped bowl to concentrate the intense aromatics and floral notes", "temperature": "8-10°C (46-50°F) - well chilled to highlight the wine's freshness and aromatic complexity"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Young, aromatic white wine - fermented at 16°C in stainless steel tanks with 4 months lees aging. No oak influence, focus on pure fruit expression and varietal character.", "region": "Rioja DOCa, specifically from Bodegas Valdemar's vineyards in Oyón, Álava", "vintage": "2023", "ageability": "Best enjoyed young and fresh within 2-3 years of vintage (2023-2026) to preserve the vibrant aromatics and tropical fruit character. The wine is crafted for immediate enjoyment, showcasing the unique Tempranillo Blanco varietal at its most expressive.", "grapeVariety": "100% Tempranillo Blanco - a natural white mutation of Tempranillo, extremely rare"}

name: Free Spirits N/A Tequila
description: A sophisticated non-alcoholic spirit that captures the essence of traditional tequila through botanical distillation. Crafted to deliver the characteristic agave-forward profile without alcohol, this innovative spirit offers complexity and depth for discerning consumers seeking premium zero-proof options.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with bright botanical notes reminiscent of agave, accompanied by hints of white pepper and citrus zest. Subtle undertones of green herbs and a whisper of earthy minerals create an inviting aromatic complexity. The absence of alcohol allows the delicate botanical nuances to shine through with remarkable clarity.", "finish": "The finish is refreshingly clean with lingering hints of citrus and white pepper. Botanical notes fade gracefully, leaving a subtle minerality that invites another sip without any cloying sweetness.", "palate": "Clean and crisp on entry, the palate delivers vegetal agave-like flavors balanced with light citrus and herbal notes. A gentle peppery warmth provides structure without harshness, while subtle botanical complexity keeps the experience engaging. The mouthfeel is surprisingly full-bodied for a non-alcoholic spirit, with a pleasant viscosity that mimics traditional tequila's weight."}
foodPairings: ["Fresh ceviche with lime and cilantro", "Grilled fish tacos with mango salsa", "Guacamole and fresh tortilla chips", "Citrus-marinated chicken skewers", "Mexican street corn (elote)"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting needed; shake well if botanicals have settled", "glassware": "Rocks glass or traditional tequila shot glass", "temperature": "Serve chilled at 40-45°F"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Non-alcoholic botanical spirit", "region": "Produced in USA with botanical ingredients", "vintage": null, "ageability": "Best consumed fresh; 12-18 months from production", "grapeVariety": "N/A - Botanical spirit with agave character"}

name: Crimson Clover WHITE Sauvignon Blanc 2024
description: A vibrant expression of Sauvignon Blanc that showcases the varietal's hallmark freshness and aromatic intensity. This 2024 vintage captures bright fruit character with crisp acidity, reflecting modern winemaking techniques that preserve the grape's natural vibrancy and zesty personality.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Explosively aromatic with intense notes of freshly cut grass and gooseberry leading the charge. Layers of grapefruit zest, passion fruit, and white peach create a tropical-meets-herbaceous bouquet that immediately captivates. Subtle hints of jalapeño pepper and crushed stones add complexity to this exuberant aromatic profile.", "finish": "Crisp and refreshing finish with citrus pith and lingering grapefruit notes. The acidity drives a long, mouthwatering conclusion that leaves the palate clean and eager for the next sip.", "palate": "The palate delivers racy acidity that frames flavors of Meyer lemon, green apple, and kiwi fruit with precision. Mid-palate weight shows ripe white peach and subtle honeydew melon, while maintaining the varietal's characteristic spine of zingy freshness. Clean mineral notes provide structure without heaviness, and a faint grassy quality reinforces the wine's varietal purity."}

name: Sonder Roussanne 2022

name: Heron Hill Baco Noir Reserve 2020
description: A Reserve-level expression of Baco Noir from Heron Hill, one of New York's Finger Lakes region's pioneering wineries. Baco Noir, a French-American hybrid grape, thrives in the Finger Lakes' challenging climate, producing distinctive red wines with dark fruit intensity and earthy complexity. This Reserve designation indicates extended aging and careful selection of the best lots.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Dark and brooding with aromas of blackberry preserves, black currant, and crushed blueberry dominating the bouquet. Earthy notes of forest floor, turned soil, and autumn leaves add rustic complexity characteristic of hybrid varieties. Hints of black pepper, smoked meat, and leather emerge with aeration, while subtle oak influence contributes vanilla, cedar, and a whisper of char. Distinctly New World in its fruit intensity yet showing Old World earthy restraint and savory depth.", "finish": "Long and structured with firm but ripe tannins gripping the palate. Dark fruit echoes slowly fade to reveal earthy minerality, tobacco leaf, and a distinctive Baco Noir earthiness that lingers pleasantly alongside hints of dark chocolate and coffee.", "palate": "Medium to full-bodied with robust tannins softened by the 2020 vintage's maturity and Reserve-level oak aging. Flavors of ripe blackberry, boysenberry, and black plum are enriched by notes of espresso, dark chocolate, and molasses. The wine's hybrid heritage shows in its earthy mid-palate—think mushroom, wet stone, and black tea—balanced by bright acidity that prevents heaviness. Integrated oak adds structure and complexity with hints of toasted oak, vanilla bean, and baking spice complementing rather than masking the fruit."}

name: Two Mountain Hidden Horse Red No. 22
description: A proprietary red blend from Two Mountain Winery in Washington's Yakima Valley, where the winery specializes in estate-grown wines. Washington State reds often showcase ripe fruit with excellent structure, benefiting from the region's long growing season and diurnal temperature shifts.

A whisper of sage, dried lavender, and black pepper contributes aromatic intrigue typical of premium Washington blends.", "finish": "Long and luxurious with persistent dark fruit and spice notes gradually revealing hints of tobacco, cedar, and fine-grained tannins. The finish maintains freshness despite the wine's concentration, with echoes of dark chocolate and espresso lingering alongside structured tannins that promise aging potential.", "palate": "Full-bodied and richly textured with velvety tannins and concentrated fruit flavors. name: Thelema Shiraz 2021
description: A classic Stellenbosch Shiraz from Thelema Mountain Vineyards, one of South Africa's most respected estates. Founded in 1988, Thelema has built its reputation on elegantly structured, terroir-driven wines from high-altitude vineyards. This Shiraz showcases the cool-climate expression of Syrah/Shiraz with peppery complexity and refined fruit rather than overripe jam.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose opens with vibrant dark berry fruit—blackberry, black raspberry, and mulberry—framed by distinctive Syrah spice: cracked black pepper, white pepper, and coriander seed. Floral notes of violet and iris add elegance, while subtle hints of cured meat, olive tapenade, and smoked paprika contribute savory complexity. Cool-climate characteristics emerge as graphite, wet stone, and iron filings, with integrated oak adding whispers of vanilla, espresso, and dark chocolate. A characteristic Stellenbosch note of fynbos (wild herbs) provides unique regional character.", "finish": "Long and complex with layers of dark fruit, pepper, and spice gradually revealing earthy minerality and fine-grained tannins. The finish maintains freshness and structure, with echoes of blackberry, espresso, and white pepper lingering alongside hints of dried herbs and graphite. Thelema's hallmark elegance is evident in the wine's refined, balanced conclusion.", "palate": "Medium to full-bodied with firm yet silky tannins and bright acidity that signal cool-climate viticulture and thoughtful winemaking. The palate delivers concentrated flavors of blackberry, blueberry, and dark plum alongside Thelema's signature spice profile: black pepper, five-spice, and juniper. Savory mid-palate notes of black olive, bresaola, and grilled herbs add complexity and food-friendliness, while well-integrated oak contributes mocha, vanilla, and toasted oak without overwhelming the fruit. The wine shows excellent balance between power and finesse, with mineral undertones of graphite and schist reflecting Stellenbosch's granite-based soils."}

name: Collina San Ponzio Barbera D Alba 2023
description: A youthful Barbera d'Alba from Piedmont's heart, where this indigenous variety thrives in the hills surrounding Alba. The 2023 vintage showcases Barbera's hallmark bright acidity and vibrant cherry fruit with minimal oak influence, emphasizing freshness and food-friendliness typical of this approachable yet serious Italian red.

The wine's youth is evident in vibrant fruit purity, with minimal oak allowing the grape's natural character to shine. Underlying notes of red currant, pomegranate, and a whisper of white pepper add aromatic dimension.", "finish": "Clean and refreshing with persistent acidity and red fruit notes that linger alongside subtle herbal and spice elements. The wine's tannins are soft and approachable, allowing the acidity to provide structure and drive. Mid-palate brightness is enhanced by hints of blood orange, cranberry, and pomegranate molasses, while minimal oak influence preserves the wine's fresh, fruit-forward character ideal for current drinking."}

name: Paso Robles Pomar Junction GSM Crossing 2014

This GSM (Grenache-Syrah-Mourvèdre) blend exemplifies the innovative 'Paso blends' that defy traditional winemaking rules while honoring the character of each component grape, crafted from vineyards on the region's distinctive weathered granite and volcanic soils.

name: Scheid Vineyards Elder Rock Chardonnay 2018

name: Mendoza Laderas del Valle Cabernet Sauvignon 2017
description: A classic Argentine Cabernet Sauvignon from Mendoza, the region responsible for 70% of Argentina's wine production. Crafted from high-altitude vineyards benefiting from continental sunshine and Andean glacier-fed irrigation, this wine captures the intensity and structure that define premium Mendoza reds from this renowned wine region.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Bold and expressive with concentrated aromas of blackcurrant, black cherry, and ripe plum. Layers of dark chocolate, espresso, and cedar emerge alongside notes of eucalyptus and dried herbs characteristic of Argentine Cabernet. Subtle hints of vanilla, tobacco, and leather suggest oak maturation, while a touch of violet and graphite add complexity. The nose reflects Mendoza's sunny, continental climate with ripe fruit concentration.", "finish": "Long and structured with persistent dark fruit and oak-derived complexity. Firm tannins provide grip and aging potential while maintaining smoothness, characteristic of well-made Mendoza reds. The finish reveals chocolate, espresso, and subtle herb notes that linger with impressive length.", "palate": "Full-bodied with robust structure and firm tannins typical of Mendoza Cabernet Sauvignon. The palate delivers powerful dark fruit flavors of cassis, blackberry, and black plum, complemented by notes of dark chocolate, roasted coffee, and sweet spice. The wine's concentration reflects optimal ripeness from high-altitude vineyards, while integrated oak contributes layers of vanilla, toast, and cigar box. Balanced acidity provides framework and freshness despite the wine's substantial body and alcohol warmth."}
foodPairings: ["Argentine asado (grilled beef)", "Grilled ribeye steak with chimichurri", "Braised short ribs with red wine reduction", "Empanadas with beef and olives", "Aged provolone or hard Italian cheeses"]

wineDetails: {"style": "Dry red wine, full-bodied with concentrated fruit, firm tannins, and oak aging characteristic of premium Mendoza production", "region": "Mendoza, Argentina", "vintage": "2017", "ageability": "Drinking well now with integrated tannins and developing complexity. Can age for another 5-8 years with proper cellaring, developing tertiary notes of leather, tobacco, and earth.", "grapeVariety": "100% Cabernet Sauvignon"}

name: Pasquiers Sablet Rouge 2023
description: A vibrant Côtes du Rhône red from the village of Sablet, situated at the foot of the Dentelles de Montmirail in Provence. This young vintage showcases the fresh, approachable character of Southern Rhône reds from this traditional wine-producing village, crafted in the region's classic style with emphasis on ripe fruit and Mediterranean herb influences.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Fresh and inviting with bright aromas of red cherry, strawberry, and raspberry. Classic Provençal notes of garrigue—wild thyme, rosemary, and lavender—add aromatic complexity alongside hints of black pepper and dried herbs. Subtle touches of red plum, cranberry, and violets provide additional layers, while a light mineral quality reflects the limestone terroir of the Dentelles de Montmirail foothills.", "finish": "Clean and moderately persistent with lingering red fruit and herb notes. Soft tannins provide gentle structure while the wine's natural freshness and acidity leave a bright, food-friendly impression. Subtle mineral and spice notes complete the finish.", "palate": "Medium-bodied with vibrant fruit character and accessible tannins typical of young Côtes du Rhône wines. The palate delivers juicy flavors of fresh red berries—cherry, raspberry, and red currant—complemented by savory notes of Mediterranean herbs, earth, and subtle spice. The wine's youthful energy is balanced by soft tannins and refreshing acidity, making it immediately enjoyable. Light touches of white pepper and dried herbs add complexity without heaviness."}
foodPairings: ["Ratatouille with fresh herbs", "Grilled lamb merguez sausages", "Herb-roasted chicken with olives", "Beef daube provençale", "Tomato-based pasta with Italian sausage"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Brief decanting of 15-20 minutes to aerate this young wine and enhance aromatics", "glassware": "Standard red wine glass or Côtes du Rhône glass", "temperature": "58-62°F (14-16°C), slightly chilled"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Dry red wine, medium-bodied with fresh fruit character and Mediterranean herb influences", "region": "Sablet, Côtes du Rhône, Southern Rhône Valley, France", "vintage": "2023", "ageability": "Best enjoyed young within 2-3 years to capture the wine's vibrant fruit and freshness. The 2023 vintage is drinking beautifully now.", "grapeVariety": "Traditional Côtes du Rhône blend (likely Grenache-based with Syrah and/or Mourvèdre)"}

name: Monte Real Gran Reserva 2014 2036042
description: A classic Rioja Gran Reserva from Bodegas Riojanas, Monte Real represents traditional Spanish winemaking at its finest. This 2014 vintage has undergone extensive aging in American oak barrels followed by bottle maturation, resulting in a refined and elegant expression of Rioja's Tempranillo-based wines.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet is complex and evolved, offering red cherry and strawberry compote alongside dried rose petals and leather. Classic Rioja characteristics shine through with pronounced vanilla, coconut, and sweet spice from American oak aging. Tertiary notes of tobacco, cedar box, and earthy forest floor add layers of intrigue, while a subtle orange peel brightness keeps the aromatics vibrant and lifted.", "finish": "Long and graceful, the finish features lingering cherry and spice notes with a gentle grip from fine tannins. The wine fades slowly with hints of vanilla, dried fruit, and a touch of minerality. A clean, slightly tannic conclusion demonstrates the wine's continued aging potential while remaining beautifully integrated and ready to enjoy.", "palate": "Medium to full-bodied with silky, resolved tannins that speak to its extended aging. Flavors of cherry cola, cranberry, and red plum are woven with notes of butterscotch, cinnamon, and clove. The oak integration is seamless, providing structure without overwhelming the delicate red fruit core. Bright acidity maintains freshness and drives the palate through its mid-length, while subtle savory elements of dried herbs and umami add complexity. The texture is smooth and refined, showing the elegance that comes from patient cellaring."}
foodPairings: ["Roasted leg of lamb with garlic and rosemary", "Manchego cheese with quince paste", "Iberico ham and Spanish charcuterie board", "Duck confit with wild mushrooms", "Slow-cooked pork shoulder with paprika"]

This wine has reached its drinking window but will hold for another 5-8 years.", "grapeVariety": "85% Tempranillo, 10% Graciano, 5% Mazuelo"}

name: Hendry Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
description: Hendry Vineyard, a Napa Valley estate with deep roots dating back to the 1939, crafts this exceptional Cabernet Sauvignon from their sustainably farmed blocks. The 2019 vintage benefited from ideal growing conditions, producing concentrated fruit with balanced acidity and refined tannins characteristic of their meticulous vineyard management.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Intensely aromatic with layers of blackcurrant, black cherry, and blueberry preserve. The nose reveals compelling secondary notes of crushed violets, graphite, and pencil shavings alongside hints of sage and bay laurel. French oak contributes subtle toast, vanilla bean, and baking spices without masking the pure fruit expression. As the wine opens, nuances of dark cocoa and espresso bean emerge, adding depth and sophistication.", "finish": "The finish is exceptionally long and complete, with black fruit flavors persisting alongside oak-derived spice and cocoa. Tannins are firm but supple, providing structure for aging while ensuring current drinkability. The wine concludes with lingering notes of dark berries, espresso, and a subtle herbal character that adds freshness.", "palate": "Powerful yet refined, this Cabernet delivers concentrated flavors of cassis, black plum, and boysenberry. The texture is luxurious and velvety, with ripe, finely structured tannins that coat the palate. Mid-palate richness is balanced by fresh acidity that provides energy and lift. Notes of dark chocolate, coffee grounds, and black olive add savory complexity to the ripe fruit core. The wine shows impressive density and extract while maintaining elegance and precision. Mineral undertones and hints of crushed stone add another dimension to the layered profile."}
foodPairings: ["Prime dry-aged ribeye steak", "Braised short ribs with red wine reduction", "Grilled portobello mushrooms with blue cheese", "Rack of lamb with herb crust", "Aged cheddar with dark chocolate"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 90 minutes to 2 hours. This young Cabernet benefits significantly from extended aeration to soften tannins and reveal its full aromatic complexity.", "glassware": "Large-bowled Cabernet Sauvignon glass", "temperature": "17-18°C (63-64°F)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Premium Napa Valley Cabernet", "region": "Napa Valley, California", "vintage": "2019", "ageability": "Drinking well now but built for the long haul. Optimal drinking from 2025-2035, with potential to evolve gracefully through 2040 with proper cellaring.", "grapeVariety": "100% Cabernet Sauvignon"}

name: Giustini Avoglia Susumaniello 2023
description: From the sun-drenched heel of Italy's boot comes this exceptional expression of Susumaniello, an indigenous Puglian grape experiencing renaissance. Giustini's Avoglia bottling showcases the variety's unique character—vibrant, spicy, and deeply connected to the terroir of Salento, offering wine lovers a taste of authentic Southern Italian winemaking.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose explodes with exuberant dark fruit: blackberry jam, crushed black cherry, and ripe plum dominate. Mediterranean scrub aromatics emerge—wild rosemary, dried oregano, and sun-baked earth—creating an unmistakably Italian profile. Nuances of black pepper, licorice, and dark chocolate add depth, while a subtle violet floral note provides lift. The wine's youth shows in its primary fruit intensity and vibrant spice.", "finish": "The finish is long and satisfying, with dark fruit and spice lingering pleasantly. A touch of earthy minerality and dried herb character provides savory balance to the sweet fruit. Soft tannins and persistent acidity make the conclusion both structured and approachable.", "palate": "Bold and generous on the palate, this Susumaniello floods the senses with concentrated dark fruit. Blackberry compote and black cherry liqueur lead, supported by savory notes of cured black olives and Mediterranean herbs. The wine's medium to full body is balanced by fresh acidity unusual for Southern Italian reds, keeping the rich fruit from becoming heavy. Supple tannins provide structure without astringency, while hints of espresso and cocoa powder add complexity to the mid-palate."}
foodPairings: ["Orecchiette with broccoli rabe and sausage", "Grilled lamb chops with rosemary", "Eggplant parmigiana", "Aged pecorino romano cheese", "Braised short ribs with polenta"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Benefits from 30 minutes of decanting to soften tannins and allow aromatics to open fully", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux glass to concentrate aromatics and provide ample surface area for aeration", "temperature": "Slightly cool, 60-65°F (15-18°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Medium to full-bodied dry red wine", "region": "Puglia (Apulia), Southern Italy", "vintage": "2023", "ageability": "Can be enjoyed young for fresh fruit or cellared 3-5 years for integration and complexity. Peak drinking: 2024-2028.", "grapeVariety": "100% Susumaniello"}

name: Hendry Primitivo 2021
description: A Napa Valley expression of Primitivo (Zinfandel's Italian cousin) from the renowned Hendry Ranch estate vineyard. This wine demonstrates the variety's characteristic ripe fruit intensity with California sunshine, balanced by thoughtful winemaking that honors both Italian heritage and New World terroir.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose explodes with concentrated aromas of blackberry jam, dark cherry, and ripe plum, complemented by warm baking spices including cinnamon and clove. Notes of dried fig and raisin suggest the variety's tendency toward ripeness, while hints of vanilla oak, black pepper, and Mediterranean herbs add complexity. A subtle earthy undertone of leather and tobacco emerges with air.", "finish": "The finish is long and warming with persistent dark fruit, spice, and a pleasant touch of espresso and vanilla. Soft tannins carry through, leaving a plush, mouth-filling impression with just enough structure to support rich foods.", "palate": "Rich and full-bodied, the palate delivers layers of dark fruit including blackberry, black cherry, and boysenberry, supported by the variety's signature peppery spice. The wine shows good structure with moderate tannins that provide grip without astringency. Flavors of mocha, dark chocolate, and sweet oak integrate well with the fruit, while maintaining balance despite the wine's generous alcohol and extract."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled ribeye steak with peppercorn sauce", "Italian sausage and peppers", "Braised short ribs with red wine reduction", "Wood-fired pizza with Italian meats", "Aged Pecorino Romano and charcuterie"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 30-45 minutes before serving to soften tannins and allow the wine's complex aromatics to fully express themselves", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux or red wine glass to concentrate aromatics", "temperature": "60-65°F (15-18°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Full-bodied dry red wine with ripe fruit character", "region": "Napa Valley, California (Hendry Ranch estate)", "vintage": "2021", "ageability": "Drink now through 2028; the wine is approachable young but will develop more complexity over the next 3-5 years", "grapeVariety": "100% Primitivo (Zinfandel clone)"}

name: Leira Reyero Albarino 2023
description: A pristine expression of Albariño from the prestigious Rías Baixas region of Galicia, Spain. This wine showcases the variety's hallmark combination of vibrant acidity, stone fruit character, and saline minerality that has made Albariño one of Spain's most celebrated white wines and a perfect companion to seafood.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet opens with intense aromas of white peach, apricot, and ripe pear, complemented by citrus notes of lemon zest and grapefruit. Delicate floral hints of orange blossom and jasmine add elegance, while subtle saline and mineral notes evoke the wine's coastal Atlantic origins. A whisper of honeydew melon and wet stone provides additional aromatic complexity.", "finish": "The finish is long and refreshing with persistent citrus and stone fruit flavors. The wine's bracing acidity continues through the conclusion, while a pronounced mineral and saline quality leaves the palate cleansed and eager for the next sip.", "palate": "The palate is vibrant and focused with racy acidity that carries flavors of stone fruit including peach, nectarine, and apricot, along with citrus notes of lime and pink grapefruit. Medium-bodied with excellent texture and weight, the wine displays a distinctive saline minerality that speaks to its proximity to the Atlantic Ocean. The fruit remains pure and precise, supported by crisp acidity that provides energy and length, with subtle notes of almond skin adding depth."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled octopus with paprika and olive oil", "Fresh clams, mussels, or oysters", "Galician-style seafood including pulpo a la gallega", "Ceviche or raw fish preparations", "Aged Manchego cheese and almonds"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "No decanting required; serve well-chilled to emphasize the wine's refreshing acidity and aromatic purity", "glassware": "Medium-sized white wine glass or Albariño-specific stemware", "temperature": "45-50°F (7-10°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Dry white wine with coastal influence and high acidity", "region": "Rías Baixas DO, Galicia, Spain", "vintage": "2023", "ageability": "Drink now through 2027; best enjoyed within 3-4 years to capture the wine's vibrant fruit and refreshing character", "grapeVariety": "100% Albariño"}

name: Pasquiers Cotes du Rhone Rouge 2023
description: A vibrant organic Côtes du Rhône from Domaine des Pasquiers, a family estate run by the Lambert brothers since 1935. This wine embodies the warm, Mediterranean character of the Southern Rhône's Vaucluse region, crafted from organically farmed vines across their 87-hectare estate near the village of Sablet.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The bouquet bursts with sun-ripened red berries and dark cherries, characteristic of Grenache noir from warm southern vineyards. Aromatic complexity builds with notes of garrigue herbs—thyme, rosemary, and lavender—that speak to the Mediterranean terroir. Subtle hints of black pepper and crushed stones add an earthy dimension, while a whisper of violet provides floral lift.", "finish": "A moderately long finish showcasing the wine's fruit-forward nature with lingering notes of red berries and Mediterranean herbs. The finish is clean and refreshing with soft tannins that fade gently, leaving a pleasant impression of warmth and spice typical of Southern Rhône wines.", "palate": "Medium to full-bodied with supple texture and approachable tannins that reflect the organic farming practices. The palate delivers juicy red fruit flavors—raspberry, strawberry, and red plum—balanced by Syrah's addition of structure and darker fruit notes. Bright acidity keeps the wine fresh and food-friendly, while herbal nuances of dried thyme and black olive add savory complexity. The mouthfeel is smooth and rounded with minimal oak influence, allowing the pure fruit expression to shine."}
foodPairings: ["Herb-roasted lamb with Provençal vegetables", "Grilled sausages with ratatouille", "Beef daube Provençal", "Aged Comté or Gruyère cheese", "Chicken cacciatore with olives and tomatoes"]

Drink now through 2027.", "grapeVariety": "Grenache noir dominant (60-70%), blended with Syrah and Mourvèdre"}

name: Tenute Orestiadi Pinot Grigio 2024
description: A crisp, refreshing Pinot Grigio from the sunny hills of western Sicily, produced by Tenute Orestiadi where art and wine converge. Founded in 2008 in Gibellina Nuova within the Belìce Valley, this wine showcases organically grown Pinot Grigio from volcanic-influenced soils, expressing a distinctive Sicilian character with Mediterranean brightness.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Bright and lifted aromatics featuring white peach, green apple, and citrus blossom. The nose reveals typical Italian Pinot Grigio character with delicate floral notes of acacia and hints of pear skin. Subtle mineral undertones emerge, reflecting the Sicilian terroir, along with whispers of almond and a touch of Mediterranean herbs that add complexity to the otherwise pure fruit expression.", "finish": "Clean and refreshing finish with lingering citrus notes and a characteristic hint of pleasant bitterness reminiscent of lemon pith. The wine concludes with excellent minerality and a mouth-watering quality that makes it highly food-friendly and ideal for warm weather drinking.", "palate": "Light to medium-bodied with refreshing, crisp acidity that defines the Italian Pinot Grigio style. The palate delivers clean flavors of green apple, white peach, and citrus zest with a distinctive mineral edge that speaks to the volcanic-influenced soils. A slightly spritzy quality enhances the wine's freshness, while the organic farming practices contribute to the wine's purity and vibrancy. The texture is lean and refreshing with just enough body to carry the delicate fruit flavors without heaviness."}
foodPairings: ["Grilled Mediterranean sea bass with lemon", "Calamari fritti with aioli", "Caprese salad with fresh mozzarella", "Pasta with clam sauce (linguine alle vongole)", "Prosciutto and melon antipasti"]

wineDetails: {"style": "Italian Pinot Grigio - light-bodied, crisp, refreshing white wine", "region": "Sicily (Sicilia), Belìce Valley, Italy", "vintage": "2024", "ageability": "Best enjoyed young and fresh within 1-2 years of vintage to preserve crisp acidity and delicate aromatics. Drink now through 2026.", "grapeVariety": "100% Pinot Grigio from organically grown grapes"}

name: Campus Oaks Old Vine Zinfandel 2016
description: A powerful expression of California old vine Zinfandel, this wine celebrates the heritage and intensity that comes from mature vines with their concentrated fruit and complex character. The 2016 vintage captures the bold, fruit-forward style that has made California Zinfandel famous, with the depth and structure that only old vines can provide.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "The nose explodes with concentrated aromas of ripe blackberry and black cherry, interwoven with jammy notes of strawberry preserves and peach compote. Baking spices dominate the aromatic profile with prominent cinnamon, clove, and vanilla from oak aging. An underlying peppery note adds intrigue, while hints of sweet tobacco and dark chocolate contribute to the wine's complexity. The high alcohol content (likely 15%+ ABV) is evident in the wine's heady, warming aromatics.", "finish": "Long and warming finish with persistent black fruit flavors, sweet spice, and a characteristic peppery note. The finish shows the wine's power with lingering warmth from the alcohol and a pleasant drying quality from the tannins. Notes of tobacco and dark chocolate emerge at the end, adding sophistication to the bold fruit profile.", "palate": "Full-bodied and lush with a mouth-filling texture characteristic of old vine Zinfandel. The palate delivers intense flavors of ripe blackberry and dark cherry with generous notes of raspberry jam and dried fig. Rich baking spices—cinnamon, nutmeg, and vanilla—layer over the fruit, while the wine's elevated alcohol creates warmth and viscosity. Firm tannins provide structure despite the small berry size and thin skins typical of Zinfandel, balancing the wine's power with grip. The old vines contribute concentrated fruit flavors and deeper complexity than standard Zinfandel bottlings."}
foodPairings: ["Smoked beef brisket with BBQ sauce", "Baby back ribs with spicy dry rub", "Grilled burger with sharp cheddar and caramelized onions", "Pulled pork shoulder with coleslaw", "Venison or game meats with berry reduction"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 45-60 minutes to allow the powerful wine to open and integrate its high alcohol and intense fruit flavors", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux or Cabernet glass to tame the alcohol and concentrate the aromatics", "temperature": "62-65°F (17-18°C), slightly warmer to showcase the wine's aromatic complexity"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Bold, full-bodied California Zinfandel with high alcohol (15%+ ABV) and concentrated fruit", "region": "California, USA (specific appellation not specified)", "vintage": "2016", "ageability": "Old vine Zinfandels can age 5-10 years. This 2016 vintage is currently in its drinking window and will hold through 2026, though it's typically enjoyed for its exuberant fruit-forward character.", "grapeVariety": "100% Old Vine Zinfandel"}

name: Vina Albina Gran Reserva 2005
description: An exceptional Gran Reserva from Bodegas Riojanas, one of Rioja's most traditional producers. This wine represents the pinnacle of Rioja's classification system, having undergone extensive aging (20 months in new oak plus minimum 24 months in bottle before release). The 2005 vintage showcases the depth and complexity that only time and careful cellar management can achieve.
tastingNotes: {"aroma": "Mature and complex aromatics displaying the evolution of nearly two decades. The nose shows concentrated notes of dried cherry, prune, and fig alongside classic Rioja characteristics of leather, tobacco leaf, and cigar box. Rich oak influence presents itself through vanilla, toast, and sweet baking spices—cinnamon and clove. Tertiary aromas of forest floor, dried mushroom, and autumn leaves add earthy complexity. Subtle hints of balsamic, dark chocolate, and coffee emerge, while a core of preserved red fruit remains present beneath the developed layers.", "finish": "Long and persistent finish showcasing the wine's maturity and concentration. The conclusion echoes the palate with dried fruit, leather, tobacco, and subtle oak spice. Soft, integrated tannins fade gently while leaving impressions of balsamic, dark chocolate, and forest floor. The finish demonstrates the wine's excellent aging potential and current drinking perfection, though it can continue to evolve.", "palate": "Full-bodied with a concentrated and tannic structure that has mellowed and integrated beautifully with age. The palate delivers flavors of dried cherry, dark plum, and fig with characteristic Rioja notes of leather, tobacco, and cedar. The wine shows excellent balance between its fruit concentration, oak influence, and evolved tertiary characteristics. Firm but rounded tannins provide structure without astringency, having softened considerably from the wine's youth. The aging process has created a harmonious integration of all components—fruit, oak, acid, and tannin work together seamlessly. Classic Gran Reserva characteristics of savory complexity dominate while maintaining a core of concentrated fruit."}
foodPairings: ["Roasted leg of lamb with rosemary and garlic", "Aged Manchego cheese with quince paste", "Wild game terrine or venison stew", "Ibérico ham and cured Spanish meats", "Slow-braised oxtail with rich reduction"]
servingInfo: {"decanting": "Decant for 45-60 minutes to allow this mature wine to open and shed any bottle age; handle gently as older wines can be fragile", "glassware": "Large Bordeaux or Rioja glass to appreciate the wine's evolved complexity", "temperature": "62-65°F (17-18°C)"}
wineDetails: {"style": "Rioja Gran Reserva (minimum 24 months oak + 36 months bottle aging before release), traditional style with extensive aging", "region": "Rioja DOCa, Spain (likely Rioja Alta, from Bodegas Riojanas in Cenicero)", "vintage": "2005", "ageability": "This 2005 Gran Reserva is nearly 20 years old and currently at peak drinking maturity. Can hold through 2030 for those who prefer more tertiary development, though it's showing beautifully now with its balance of fruit and evolved characteristics.", "grapeVariety": "Primarily Tempranillo with Carignan/Mazuelo and Graciano"}
